text: My wife and I ate here because it kept coming up on our yelp apps. It was delicious!! Cathy, the owner's daughter was our waitress, and she set an excellent tone to the experience. Very vivacious, helpful , super friendly, and very quick, attentive service. I ordered a noodle salad with beef and shrimp, topped with their fish sauce. So good. My wife had the #37, a pork chop with shrimp, steamed rice topped with a fried egg, and an egg roll. She enjoyed it also. We will definitely be back!!

*DISCLAIMER* Awful and unapologetic service! Though many reviews offered high marks for this restaurant's food, in my book, the thing that sets the tone of the restaurant is its service. When we (3) first entered the restaurant, no one greeted us and there was a party of 10 and 2 in front us. Many people showed up after us, so it seemed that the restaurant was popular. After 25 minutes, the party of 2 left while the party before us waited an hour before they were seated. And yet even after they had just been seated, a party member had to grab the menus themselves from the front because of the lack of service. If a restaurant receives as many high reviews, then high quality service has to be accompanied with it. I don't care if the food supposedly tastes good. If the servers don't even apologize, let alone acknowledge you, why bother?
I only tried the pho with tofu and it was delicious. The tofu wasnt very tasty thiu but the broth and vegetables made up for it. Will be back and order it with just vegetables next time. Only$8.
Best Vietnamese in the area hands down!!! Pork spring rolls and potstickers were delicious!!! Fantastic, attentive service!! Amazing salad bowls!! Can't wait to go back!!

I updated to five stars as it is really a good one. I tried other phos, and found this one is very clean, and the food is delicious. The only wish I have is hope it will also open on Monday!   Every time if I do not feel like cooking and need a light dinner, I go there!

Tried the #22 Mi Quang (egg noodle soup) and the #34 bun tom bo nurong (rice vermicelli salad bowl). The #34 was the bomb! Fresh and clean tasting, not heavy at all. The #22 just wasn't my thing, not to say it wouldn't be great for someone else. With so much on the menu we will be back to try everything.

The food here is just great. The pho and eggrolls are the best I have tasted. The only problem is the service. I've had one of the young guys twice already, and he has chosen other people before myself and family. Maybe he's bias, but how is he going to take the order of some else who was there after us. When we told him we were there first he, he still brought their good first. I'm sorry I'm not white, but this discrimination is ridiculous. Trust me we are not difficult people and we tip really well.

I was in Glendale briefly and my friend who lives there took me here for some good ol' Asian food. It was a great pick since I hadn't been eating anything substantial all day. I only managed to get one dish, of course, but would be willing to try out more if I go back!  Those of you familiar with Com Tam entrees will know what this common restaurant dish is that I ordered. It was charbroiled pork with egg cake, pickled vegetables, broken Jasmine rice, and shredded pork. This also came with a bowl of Vietnamese fish sauce which I prompted doused my rice in because I love broken rice mixed with that sauce. The pork itself was delectable though a little tough to cut. They had sliced it up into attached strips, however, so that was easier than having to cut it all up myself. The vegetables were great but not as crisp as I would've liked. My complaint with the dish was the egg cake, which was too hard and condensed. It made me wonder if it had been sitting around for a little bit because of its texture. I only managed two bites of it before I called it quits. As for my drink, I had a Thai tea that I had asked for without boba but the waiter still put it in there...and it wasn't great at all. The Thai tea itself was delicious but the boba was disgusting. I avoided it by drinking from the top. My friends ordered pho so if I ever went back there again, I think I'd try that next.

I've been dying to try this place and finally made it for lunch today - Wow - Awesome! We had the egg rolls and Pho Ga - Excellent - everything was fresh and tasted amazing ;-) Everyone was really nice and welcoming... I will definitely be back!
We visit during the lunch hour and a absolutely love any and everything they make, the veggies are nice and fresh and always crunchy.
Food was good but service wasn't too great. I was there when there were barely any customers so there was no excuse. The waiter didn't seem like he cared and rude in my opinion.
They have the best pho here. Initially I was a little uncertain as I had loved the pho in Chicago, but This little place is great! They also have really good spring rolls and rice.
Best Vietnamese food in AZ! I'm so in love with this place that I plan on coming here for years to come....yummy!

after reading the reviews on here, decided to give it a try....  Started off with the spring rolls and then got the combo fried rice(w pork, beef, chicken and shrimp), gotta say I was very impress with all the flavors that came out those dishes, added a little spice and everything was nice.  The service was good, very attentive and will help you out with their expansive menu.  Gonna visit again soon.

If you find yourself in Glendale on a Sunday afternoon looking for food, you don't have a lot of options.  That said, Little Saigon is a great place to stop by.  Located in a converted old home it has a certain charm and is a pleasant place to relax and enjoy a meal.  We had the beef Pho and a Chicken and Shrimp salad and both were very good.  Portions are generous.    The staff was friendly and took care of all our needs.  I would definitely go back when in the area.

I come for the beef Pho and potstickers! I've come here like 15 times to eat and while I want to try some new things, I just crave their beef Pho and potstickers all the time so I always order that. Pho broth is full of flavor, ingredients are fresh, and meat is tender. The potstickers are just amazing and the dipping sauce is perfect. It's very reasonably priced, the food is great, and staff is always friendly. Not to mention, siracha, chili, and hoisen is on the table so you aren't limited to just a little! The restaurant is really small, very casual, but very cute.
Love it here I am totally adicteeeddd to PHO I like eating  here and after walk around downtown Glendale ..the part that I like more is the ambience family own and is like a little secret

So my family and I had this place for the first time about a week ago. Really good, the Pot-stickers are out of this world bursting with flavor and a must try with the sauce. We ordered one order of spring rolls.....we ate them so fast we had to order more. Very tasty I can't wait to try this place again. Service was also great and met all expectations. Side note save room for shaved ice.

Was excited to try this location after reading all the fabulous reviews...but the food and service was subpar. Not to mention the Mr.'s stomach did not favor the curry :( sadly won't be returning. Really wanted to like it, but just couldn't! Still on the hunt for good, authentic Vietnamese!

Delicious! The food is very fresh and they give you a lot of really fresh veggies. The grilled chicken with vermicelli type of noodles are delicious it has all kinds of tasty seasonings!!! its seriously like the best thing in the world!!!! its that good!!!. Their pho is good too!  they give you a good portion of fresh veggies and seasonings like fresh cut mint leaves and such, its awesomee!!!!

I love this locally owned restaurant.  The service has always every single time been excellent and friendly.  The rice flour crepes are spectacular, the chicken pho soup is a must.  We eat there at least once a month.  And any other dish we have gotten has been very flavorful and yummy.  We call in for take out and the food is still perfect and delicious after the drive home.  Lots of veggies to go with the rice flour crepe and the pho soup.  It's one of our favorites and consistently never disappoints us.

Heard about this place from a friend and decided to give it a try. Service was fast and friendly.  Food was great and the price was very reasonable.  100% satisfied and I would definitely recommend you to try it too.

Been searching for a decent pho place in Richmond hill for a while with no avail and finally found this tucked away place in the T&T plaza. Pho was great, nice Herby flavour with no beefiness and the durian smoothie was very good! Thick and didn't cheap out on the durian. The spring rolls were nice and crunchy too.

I miss good Vietnamese food and after being offered some unappetizing food at a conference nearby this was a welcomed sight! I drank the Boba Thai Iced Tea, Shrimp summer rolls, and curry. It was a party in my mouth! It felt like home! I cannot wait until it gets cooler to try their Pho! Drooling just thinking about returning!
One of the best Pho spots I've been to here in Phoenix! Potstickers were on point as well!!

Had the fried rice, spring rolls, and crispy stirred fried flat rice noodle.  I wouldn't say this place is a 4.5 stars but food were decent and fast.  Good service.  Price ranges from 7 to $10 for the entres.

Legit Vietnamese food. My husband is a culinary student and we go to a lot of Vietnamese restaurants because it is his favorite genre of food. This is authentic food that is simply delicious. Cute little place in downtown Glendale so feel free to do some antique shopping on foot when you are done.

Has been awhile since I have had This Amazing PHO Tia , and today it was so perfect welcomed in with a smile and made me feel like I was welcomed , my food was amazing and enjoyed it very much ! Love this place always a relaxing and beautiful place to come and eat ! Thank you !

I have frequented this restaurant for over 20 years (incl. past locations).  The food is the best in the area and surpasses that I've had in the many cities I've visited.   Every friend I send to this restaurant go back; I recommend you try it too.   Soup is great, so is the lemongrass chicken, seasoned flank steak, and salads. Top off you meal with a tasty iced coffee--but not too late in the day if caffeine keeps you awake!

Great food and friendly staff if you go on the days when the owners are present.  Wish they had consistency in their food/service, but when someone other than the owners are running the joint, watch out for missing soup parts (shrimp, fish balls, etc.)   Their lemongrass soups are WONDERFUL!  And you don't want to miss their hot pots.  Yummy

On a daughter's recommendation I had my first meal at this hidden gem in downtown Glendale.  The wait staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our server spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable about the menu. The menu is huge (about 100 items- you order by number) so it can be a little confusing understanding the differences between even just the soup cboices! In the end we all ordered soups and they were very large portions but chock full of noodles and meat and a good size plate of veggies to toss in. It was a lot of food! And very good! It's a small restaurant but we didn't feel crowded at all and enjoyed our view at the window. The only down side for me was that I'm pretty sensitive to different foods etc and I got pretty bloated later in the day. I'm gonna guess it was the salt in the soup. Next time I think I'll try one of the rice plates. ..they also looked yummy.

Came today just cause I needed to go to the T&T. I didn't have high expectations as I was here probably about 5 years ago and remembered it was crap. Little did I know its a NEW pho place that replaced the last crappy pho place. I am so glad we came!!! Was here with my family and it was FANTASTIC PHO!!! Not overly salty, with strong broth flavour. Usually we get dehydrated after with all the MSG from other pho places but not here. We tried standard pho and chicken pho. Both were incredible!!!  The only complaint I have is that they take cash only. Its also more expensive than your average pho place so we were definitely short on cash. Medium bowl about $8 and large $9. The place was packed with about 4 groups of people waiting. They definitely need to expand. I cant wait to come back tomorrow!

I've been to Little Saigon twice. Both times, my friends and I have got the exact same thing. Loads of spring rolls and the pho tai. The rolls are excellent, as other reviewers have noted. But for me, the highlight was the pho. The broth is so, so good. It can't but make you feel happy when you take a big slurp. Add some extra jalapenos on there, some sprouts and sauce and mmm...I need to stop writing this review. Making me hungry just thinking about it.  TIP: try the soda chanh mui (salted limeade with soda water) with the pho.
Super good.  Very authentic viet food..pho, spring roll,  vermicelli ..the whole menu is delicious. I eat every weekend before grocery shopping at T&T next door.

Such a quaint and delicious restaurant! Everything we ordered was amazing- pho, fried catfish, veggie springs rolls and thai boba iced tea were amazing! Plenty of dish options for vegetarians like myself. But of course I had to get pho and the broth for the vegetarian pho was so flavorful! Hubby and I will definitely will be back!

Their hours were posted as closing at 3:00 pm.  We got there at 2:40 and were refused entry, with the host saying that they stop seating people at 2:30.  If that's the case, why don't they post closing hours as 2:30?  My family use to run a restaurant and our customers and business were important to us.  If someone came 5 or 10 or more minutes after our posted closing, we would still welcome them.  In this economy, the majority of restaurants we have gone to have gone out of their way to provide good service.  I guess this place doesn't need or value the business.  I'm giving them 1 star only because someone recommended this place but I will not be returning to see what we missed.  There are plenty of excellent Vietnamese restaurants in the Phoenix area.

this was a pleasant little discovery we made. we'll be going back for sure! the ambiance was that of a busy place, food was great, (if you knew what to order) service wasn't too annoying like the other oriental places.

What do I dream about when I'm back in NYC? I'll tell you: the supremely delicious banh khot that's made to perfection at Little Saigon. I've never had anything like it in my life, and I only wish I didn't have to wait for summer vacation to enjoy it again.  I've loved this Little Saigon for years: it's a charming place, the people are fantastic, and yes, there are many other things on the menu that are superb. But the banh knot has captured my heart!

Here for the 1st time Surprised by the excellent quality of all the food!  Had: 2 Deep Fried Spring Rolls 1 Cold Shrimp Rolls 2 #355 Pho Satay Noodle Soup with Shrimp ... was not sure whether the women's washroom was accessible, for my wife in a wheelchair, but the men's was not.

This is hands-down my favorite restaurant in Glendale. Very cute, family-run restaurant in downtown Glendale. They have the best Vietnamese spring rolls--roast pork, shrimp, vermicelli, cilantro wrapped in delicate rice paper and dipped into a peanut sauce.   The pho is great--Asian comfort food. Catfish is also good. Just had the seafood won ton noodle soup last night and didn't like the wontons, but the broth was very nice and light.   Very reasonable prices and friendly service. I take all of the friends I like to this place.

If i could give half stars it'd be 3.5 stars. A good clean place to eat.  The soup base for the pho was good and didn't taste like it was overloaded with msg or was leftover from the day before.  I got the pho with rare beef and the meat was nice and lean and thinly sliced. overall I had a good experience but I wouldn't say it was extraordinary but it's one of the better pho places in the area.
This place does their food really well. Probably one of the best tasting and most authentic Vietnamese food in the area. Cash only & no takeout orders though.

Me and my date wanted to try a new restaurant and decided on Little Saigon... The appetizer was yummy, we had the vegetarian spring rolls. We ordered our food.. and the first couple of bites were good, but then I noticed a giant cockroach crawling down the wall behind my date! Needless to say we didn't finish...
Awesome vermicelli and homemade potstickers! The vietnamese ice coffe delish and strong:) Tried their porkchop rice plate and their flashfried shrimp all very yummy!And prices very reasonable :-)

This is a hidden gem in Richmond hill. Such a cute little spot. Lunch time on a Saturday it get really busy, but worth the wait. It's always clean and the food is always on point !  The owner is always so nice and always checking to see if we need anything else .
Super service, yummy food - you have to save room for the fried bananas...wow!
I've been coming here for a few years and I enjoy it every-time. The food is fresh and delicious and service is fast.

Really great pho, I highly recommend the rare beef variety. The pad thai was very bland but the kids liked it. Any of the pork based menu items are really delicious, especially the spring roll and the vermicelli noodles.

I am very familiar with Thai food, being part Thai and all. Vietnamese food on the other hand is a different adventure for me. Yes I have had it a few times, but what I had was nothing to write home about. I saw the reviews of Little Saigon on yelp, and persuaded my husband on a very hot 115 degree day to try it with me.  We are fans! We started out with the spring rolls. Not the deep fried kind but the fresh rolled kind, it had vermicelli stuffed with shrimp, herbs and grilled sliced pork. These are some of the best around. Most places just use the unflavored sliced pork, this was actually sliced,marinated and grilled. Made a huge difference in the taste. The only way it could be improved, would be the addition of some mint. The peanut sauce that it came with was good, different from the Thai peanut sauce I am used to but good. We ordered the regular iced tea. It was clear and refreshing. I usually order the salted plum or salted lemonade drinks whenever I have Vietnamese cuisine, but did not want anything with salt as it was so hot outside. I ordered the #38, it came with 3 grilled shrimp,a thin cut of grilled marinated pork tenderloin, white rice and an over medium egg on top. It had a few pieces of lettuce,daikon,carrot,cucumber, and tomato on the side served with a mini fried eggroll with minced pork inside.  They brought out the sweetened fish sauce to go with it  and I was happy with my selection. The pork was tender with a minimal amount of fat around the edges, and the shrimp was butterflied. The eggroll was not greasy and it was crisp. Overall I would order it again, but want to try something different next time around. My husband got the #56. Pork short ribs that fell off the bone, and shrimp served in a clay bowl floating in  a delectable peppery brown broth, with carmelized onions, and a garnish of green onions on top. Served with white rice on the side.The ribs tasted a bit like re heated meat, but the sauce/broth made up for it. The prices and portion size are just right. I would rather pay for good quality than quantity of food that other places dish out.  It is a bit hard to find. There are no big signs that stand off the road, we actually passed it then turned around. The setting is in what used to be an older home. They have a nice patio that I can see spending some great nights with friends outside in the early spring.  Inside, there are a few different rooms. Maybe a few tables in each room. The main room has tables to fit a larger crowd. We ended up in a smaller room to ourselves. I think it's a great place to bring a date without breaking your wallet. The place was very clean. Even the restrooms. That's a key right there. If the restrooms are dirty at a restaurant, guess how the kitchen must be?  We will come back to this place and I see it as becoming one of our favorites. The service was friendly and I would rather give my hard earned money to a family owned and operated restaurant than a chain any day! This would be a great place to start off dinner before going to the Glendale art walks or Glendale Glitters! Give them a try!

I admit it. I'm a romantic. Sometimes I give my heart away too easily to a handsome french fry here, or a buff egg roll there, only to have it broken on our second meeting. The french fry has gone limp, the egg roll greasy. That's why I forced myself to hold back after going to Little Saigon the first time. I had to see how I'd feel on our next date. Now I'm ready.  The place is really cute. It's in one of the little houses that make up much of downtown Glendale's shopping district. You'd expect to be served Irish stew or corned beef and cabbage here. There are lace curtains in the windows and potted fake plants scattered about. But the food is Vietnamese, and lots of it, too. You can order by number, or enjoy feeling foolish trying to pronounce the Vietnamese names of the dishes correctly - all one hundred and one of them. So far we've tried eight.  The dish that first delighted us was #62, bo cuon la nho ($9.99), This, of course, is marinated beef wrapped in grape leaves and served with rice noodles and "paper". It comes, as do many of the dishes, with a large helping of fresh-as-can-be romaine lettuce leaves, mint, thai basil, coriander, and sliced carrots and cucumbers. It it looks like you're going to run out of greens, the pleasant servers (none of them Vietnamese) happily bring you more. The beef is tender and flavorful, contrasting nicely with the brininess and chew of the grape leaves. On our second visit,  Ken ordered #55, black peppered bite-size pork ribs with caramelized onions ($6.99). It was served in a pot which came boiling to the table. The broth was delectable, flavored by the onions, and the ribs were falling off the bone with just the right jolt of pepper.  I decided to order two appetizers - egg rolls ($4.99) and banh xeo ($7.99), which are rice flour crepes filled with pork, shrimp and bean sprouts. The egg rolls were good, but not noteworthy. The crepes were delicious. I've had them at other places and they usually arrive at the table soggy from the filling. These were perfectly dry and crisp, despite the load of meat and veggies. Our friend Sue, who was with us on our first visit and happily came on the second, had the fried rice bowl ($6.99) both times, so we plied her with our goodies. I bet the next time she'll go with the ribs.  There are 10 variations of Pho, with rice noodles, and 5 more soups made with egg noodles. Then there are 6 hot pot soups. Many dishes are served over rice, and others with stir fry noodles. Catfish is done 4 ways and shrimp 3. There are 3 green mussel salads and 5 mixed salads including one with jellyfish. I could go on, but if you go on line, you can see the menu for yourself.  As I mentioned above, the servers are friendly and attentive. They actually remembered our names and what we had eaten on our first visit. We had directed other friends to Little Saigon that night, and the servers remembered them, too. The portions are large, the ingredients fresh. And there's even a cute patio. I think I'm ready to commit.

By far the best Vietnamese restaurant In Phoenix. We ordered the fried  vegetarian egg roll. Omg is all I can say. The pho soup is the best and very addictive so expect to go back for more.  My daughter in law got the pork chops and rice. Her favorite.  All ingredients are fresh and colorful and the presentation of your order shows they take pride in what they are preparing. The service is second to no one. They are all very attentive and appreciate you being there. I would recommend if you haven't tried it then you need to. You won't regret it.

One of these days, I'll be adventurous and try the amazingly beautiful plates of food that I can't pronounce. I'll actually dig into the piles of leafiness and rice noodle wraps that look like lacey doilies. But I wasn't adventurous tonight. I know I adore curry so I went with the chicken curry with carrots, potatoes and onions. My taste buds were very happy with me! It was more than I should have eaten but I ate it all anyway - yum!  Great service. Will definitely go back!
This restaurant is getting more & more busy ... line up now to be seated! No secret why...their Phi is so authentic and delicious!

Excellent food and service.  Cute little place in town, well worth it.  We are very picky when it comes to restaurants and we were quite pleased with this experience.    Definitely a 'locals' hidden gem and not touristy...we are from Vancouver, Canada and we like to find locals secrets :)
We eat here almost every other week.  The soups are out of this world.  Anything you order here is going to be awesome.  Highly recommend this place.
Love this place as it's nice and cozy restaurant with great tasty food. Service is great as well. Will definitely recommend it to everyone!

We went to Little Saigon a few months ago, with the expectation that this is gonna be one of the few places with great Vietnamese food we can fall back on when we crave it due to all the great reviews on Yelp. However, just like another one in Cave Creek, it blew away my expectations, and not in a good way. I dunno what it is, but maybe since I'm Asian and I go to Vietnamese restaurants you can give us crap food and crap service? Hell, I don't even care about the service, all I really care about is the food.  Service - ok. barely. nobody bothered to refill our drinks, even though we were right outside the kitchen, with NOBODY else there dining at the time. The girl took forever to come take our order, messed up our order, and had trouble with the credit card machine afterwards as well. Damn. If you were new (don't know for sure) at least let us know what to expect.  Food: We ordered spring rolls, chicken pho, cold noodles, and the infamous #55 spare ribs that many people raved about via quick tips at the time.  Spring rolls: Ok, but the peanut sauce tasted like...well...let's just say water would've had more flavor. How can you mess up peanut sauce?  Pho: not bad, but nothing great to write home about.  Cold noodles: see above   infamous #55 spare ribs: Well, I don't really know. When we got this thing in a clay pot, we opened it, and there were pieces of fish. We were like WTF? We asked the waitress, to which she replied, yes, that's #55. We asked if #55 was fish, and not spare ribs, to which the waitress replied yes. She then goes back into the kitchen, and moments later, the cook comes out, asks us if we wanted spare ribs, which we confirmed. He then said he would cook us the spare ribs, and took away the clay pot full of fish. It wouldn't have been so bad if the spare ribs were amazing, but what came back was a few lumps of meat on bone that was submerged in black pepper. Of course, there were no apologies. If you go to their website and look at their menu, #55 is clearly NOT fish.  After we finished what barely passed as dinner, we got our bill, and gave our dedit card to the waitress. She seemed to have a lot of trouble with the credit card machine, and apparently entered in the wrong amount the first time, so she had to do a refund and start a new transaction. Normally, not a big deal. However, she was fumbling around, not saying anything, then going in and out the kitchen with our debit card, then finally someone showed her what to do. In the meantime, we were starting to wonder if they had taken down our debit card number, and if our checking account was going to be wiped out by the time we got home (did not, thank god).   Needless to say, we won't be back...

I love this place! Came here for the first time 3 years ago with a Vietnamese friend who vouched for the place, I now bring my mom here every mother's day and on her birthday (we eat after our massage at Oasis down the street)! We love it. Always start with the spring rolls and the rice flour crepes. For entrees we get beef/chicken pho or mi quang (really good). Once in a while, we'll do the catfish soup or the spicy chicken. We've never been disappointed with a meal from here.  Drinks: my mom always gets the salted plum soda, NOT my taste at all, but she loves it. I stick to Thai boba.   Great place in unique downtown Glendale.
Well worth the drive out from Toronto. Very tasty and excellent service.
Its pretty good Pho in a nice quiet location, Charming.

I have been coming here for about 4 -5 years and they are amazing! It's usually always busy but they get you in and have your food served in a timely manner. Their spring rolls are amazing as well as their pho. I've also tried #23 and if you enjoy vegetables this is a great entree. The staff always remember me and my usual order and are always warm and friendly.
Delicious gem in the west valley. Portions are small but they are reasonable prices so I just kept ordering more
Love the food here. It is small but worth it. John is a great person to talk with and the staff really knows the menu. I go here at least once a week.
Waaaay better then pho than they actually care about there customer service not like pho than where your left alone and never checked on for a refill lol
Place is clean but portions are small. Also the pho broth is one of the worst I've had, way too sweet and oily without depth of flavor. Also the flank was too fatty as well.

good food, service was friendly but a little slow in terms of getting a check and a box.  I did get the rice flour crepe, it was good but I have had better, this one was very thin outer layer of crepe and didn't have as much flavor as I have had at other restaurants.  I loved the Boba smoothie, was a little melted when it showed up but it was delicious.  I would give this place a second shot.

I have eaten here numerous times but never completed a review of the business. Let's see where to start.   This place us super cool and it is inside of an historic home. The service is top notch with everyone working hard and extremely friendly.   I ordered the chicken fa which was awesome. Coupled with fresh veggies that you have the option to put in the soup is great.  It's too bad I was working I would have loved to wash it down with a nice bottle of Sapporo.   I look forward to coming to little Saigon every chance I get. If you are ever near downtown Glendale this is the place to go!!

Still the best Vietnamese food in town. For that matter, the best asian comfort food. Always a good meal. My wife and I hadn't been in almost six months (stupid diets) took a friend from out of town last night, and it was amazing... just like we remembered it. John (the owners son) and his wife Ha, remembered us, and asked us where we had been! LOVE THIS PLACE. This is a must try restaurant!

I've been to about 20 Vietnamese places. I mainly get pho or rice plates but this place is great. Pho soup tasted great, eggrolls (kinda on the small size) but still taste awesome. And the rice plates or awesome. This was the first time I've had a beef salad and it was soooo good. I would recommend it. Out of all the places I have ate pho this place ranks in my top 5.

Been twice now. We are Pho-natics and have been to many Vietnamese places in Phoenix. Although not as good as Pho Trahn overall, this place is far better than most. What distinguishes it: service is very good, something that many Vietnamese places lack. Very clean, and has a relaxing patio (beware, they frequently have the patio closed however during the "cold" moths) and the ingredients they use are much higher quality. If you've been turns off by the fatty, low quality cuts used in Pho in other places, this is your place.   Also, while the Pho gets the most attention (Pho Bien and the pork/beef are excellent) the Hot Pot (K got the seafood) Soup was amazing. Very generous portion and almost sweet to the taste with a good amount of acidity. The Pho is very balanced in its broth but the hot pot is delicious if you're looking for something different.

I love this place.  I've been there twice.  The steamed catfish was some of the best catfish I've ever had, and probably much healthier than the fried catfish you would find elsewhere.  Their pork was excellent too, not to mention their superb desserts.  I strongly recommend getting the fried banana.    Moreover, the servers made me feel very relaxed and at ease.  The Vietnamese are a chill, friendly group of people who really know how to blend different flavors into pleasant dishes.
Poor service! 3 dined, 2 served and 1 forgotten. Said, "Sometimes you all can't eat together, we are busy!" Wouldn't comp meal had to take mine to-go.  :(
Been coming to this place for almost 20 years now.  My favorites are all the items under the vegetarian section.

Pretty dang good food. Service was alright. A little on the slow side. Spring rolls weren't the greatest, but I did enjoy the chicken and shrimp plate I ordered. Pretty inexpensive.  I'd definitely go back if I'm back in Glendale, AZ.

I guess I shouldn't compare the Vietnamese food in Arizona to Vietnamese back home in San Jose, CA because there is definitely no comparison! If you're Vietnamese and looking for good, authentic Vietnamese food, you won't find it here. The portions are small and when you order drinks, 75% of the cup is filled with ice. I guess if you're really desperately craving, then this place is okay. I, for one, will wait until I go back to Ca to fulfill all my cravings.

This place is awesome!  You have to get the spring rolls, and wrap them in lettuce with the radishes and mint and all of the garnish that comes with it and dunk it into the sauce!  You will want to go back over and over just for these!  The food has always been really good and we love the place!

This was my first time eating pho and I loved it. My friend who is a bit more of a pho connoisseur said it was definitely above average with a good taste to it. The spring rolls were delicious and we got an egg noodle dish that was very nice-not too greasy which I like.   We also loved the outdoor seating on the patio under a lit up tree (jazz music from the coffee shop across the street added to the ambiance). I would definitely go back.

Our favourite place for a quick beef pho in fragrant broth + cold vermicelli noodles with BBQ meats. Food is consistently good and reasonable in price. Always courteous and personable. The place is getting very popular with the locals, but deservedly so. Come early to avoid the wait.

My friends and I needed some fuel prior to our all-day board game meet, and what better way to fuel up than through delicious pho/vermicelli?  Restaurant size: Ample amount of space for parties of all sizes (maybe not 8+ though)! Booths and bench seating available.  Food quality: Yum! Noodles were soft, meat was well marinated, spring roll was crispy...not too difficult to mess it up!  Service: The servers were pretty attentive and quick in terms of seating us, taking our orders and returning with food. Nothing extraordinarily out of the blue, and no bad habits to note.  Final thoughts: Not a bad place to come in and grab some Vietnamese cuisine, if you're in the area and have a hankering for it! The place is *CASH ONLY* and they have an ATM right beside the cashier if you so need.

Favorite place for viet flood.  They close really early. It says 8pm but sometimes stops letting customers come in around 745pm. But even if you get their before 745, sometimes they will tell you things are sold out, so come early. Usually a line up as well, but this place is worth the wait.   Our favorite dishes are the pho and the chicken and pork rice.   Very homey feel to the restaurant.  They don't take credit card.
Delicious and fresh restaurant!  If you are in the mood for Vietnamese food, this is the spot to go to.  Family owned, and you can taste the time and effort they put in to their food.

A fantastic Vietnamese restaurant right next to a giant T&T supermarket in southern Richmond Hill making the trip even more worthwhile. You can do your grocery shopping and get some fantastic take out.  Now, I've only been there a few times, and I've only ordered the beef noodle soup although I think my father ordered their chicken noodle won ton and he liked it. I have not had their vermicelli but I find that the most significant and revealing test for any restaurant is to taste their broth. If it is bad, they are cutting corners, lacking skill, etc.  I've eaten from Vietnamese restaurants from Barrie to Hamilton and everywhere in between hundreds of times. I've probably been to at least two dozen distinct restaurants, too. As far as Vietnamese restaurants in this area go, I've had a good sampling to compare this to.  Little Saigon has a delicious beef broth. Very likely one of the best I've had. It's full bodied, not overwhelmingly salty, and doesn't have any strange aftertastes (like some places that do not keep clean). Portions are good, prices are decent. If you want some Vietnamese food, this is an excellent place to go.  It's a small restaurant but I've never seen it packed so reservations are unnecessary. Extra points: The last time I went there, I had to slam on my brakes driving my Pho home and it fell over. Didn't leak! Bravo. I also walked in and ordered soup and received it in a few minutes.   Beware: They have a sign that says "Cash only". It's nothing fancy but offers some standard Vietnamese fare at low prices. Parking isn't too bad, either because of the giant plaza it is part of.

My wife and I were looking to go eat some Thai food and searched Yelp for reviews. We spotted Little Saigon and it's great reviews. We have never had Vietnamese food before. We decided to give it a shot. The place is a cozy little house in Glendale. We were welcomed by the son of the owner and he greeted us like we were family. We were seated promptly and a great meal ensued! We especially like the veggie fried rolls app. Delicious! The curry chicken dish was good, but the cuts of chicken could've been better. We will be back and recommend you check this place out!

Really tasty pho soup, vermicelli and shrimp (or pork or any of them) rolls.  I moved to the GTA more than a year ago, found Little Saigon through Yelp and I have become a regular since then.  The staff is always very nice too.   Note that it's a small place, cash only. And it's getting popular. I usually go, order and pick the food up 15min later.   They used to have a shrimp tortilla that was the best, but it's been a couple of months since it's not available anymore.

We drove 25 mins to this restaurant after a recommendation. When we arrived, there was a sign that said 'wait to be seated' and a sign in sheet. We signed in and waited. Servers saw us but ignored us. Figured they are busy. But the restaurant doesn't seem to be that busy. We decided to wait a little bit longer. A server saw us and turned and walked the other direction.. Hmm there were also other people behind us. Guess they just didn't care. After 15 or so mins of them not acknowledging us we left. Sometimes it's a hit or miss for good service but the drive was too far and the unnecessary wait was irritating. Might try this restaurant again if in the area.
My favorite restaurant! The staff is friendly and they make you feel like you are at home. I take people who have never been and they fall in love with the place everytime.
Great food and excellent service. The soup was delicious and I would definitely come back for some pho in the future!

4 stars for cleanness; I like it when restaurant is clean, not sticky and they don't have the "fish sauce" smell like other Pho places :)   3 stars for food. We ordered grilled chicken vermicelli, it was very fresh from the cucumber to bean sprouts, I could see and taste that they were fresh.  Chicken was good, seasoned well but a bit dry.    Cold drink served in a take out plastic cup so I didn't feel like to rush to finish it :)    For sure I will go back.
I've eaten here so many times and it's so good. Tried many Pho place this is also the best.
Go to Vietnamese place in Richmond Hill. Also fresh, consistent, and good quality food.  Highly recommended, but may need to line up during peak hours
Go to Quan Hy in LA, CA and your opinion on the food here might change. To me, food was okay.

I went in today for dinner with a friend We had the house special noodle, spring roll, grilled pork roll. The spring roll, grill pork rolls were very good, the noodles was not the best I ever had. And the menu is very limited and they did not have my favourite drink ( che Ba mau )If you're looking for something that really authentic try pho Linh from Monday to Thursday they have the spicy crab noodle it is to die for. Friday to Sunday they have spicy beef noodle soup if you can't handle spicy make sure to tell them, because they make it very spicy.

Amazingly good food, fresh and authentic.  I really wasn't expecting much given my other attempts at eating Asian food in Phoenix.  Service is friendly and effecient, portions are generous for the price... it's a little lacking in ambience, but what cheap authentic asian restaurant isn't? ;)  Only been here once, but everyone enjoyed their food.

My biggest complaint is that it will take me years to get through the menu! Their food is good and its a true family run business. The atmosphere is quaint and intimate. Whenever I go I get the server to bring me whatever they recommend at the time. I have never had the same thing twice!

I love Little Saigon! Heard about it from my doc and went the same night. We've probably been back at least a dozen times. The ambiance is adorable (makes a great date place), prices EXTREMELY reasonable and the food is awesome. You truly can't go wrong but I advise sticking to the traditional dishes for the most bang!

Wow a very clean pho place finally.  The semi open kitchen is well visible and they are not afraid to show you the kitchen.  The washroom is very clean, the table and the cutleries.  Honestly many of the pho places aren't very clean, some never clean their table clothes and when they clean the tables, they leave a stinky smell.  Even the metal teapot here is pristine, I'm impressed.  Now to the food part, soup base very good, not too bland and not too salty.  The thin noodle is good and the meat is also very good.  Although this would have been a 5 star if they give just a little bit more meat.  I haven't tried their rice dishes so I can't comment on that.  But I would definitely return to this place.  I did get a chance to try their avocado smoothie, amazingly good!  I don't remember the pricing but if I remember correctly, the larger size pho is $9 which I think is very well priced.  Lots of parking space as it's located within a huge plaza where TNT supermarket is located.   The other downside to this is Cash only although they have a ATM inside the restaurant.
Favorite! We love it. Order from them at least once a month. They are always busy so try not to go at lunch time. We love the pot stickers, spring rolls and Beef Pho.
Clean, inexpensive and the Tofu vegetable Pho soup is fantastically flavoured! Remember cash only.

I had the regular rare beef pho. Broth was tasty and not loaded with msg. Noodles were fresh and al dente just the way I like it. Sprouts and herbs seemed very fresh. Service was friendly and quick. Very very clean place. Sarachi and fish sauce available but no chili oil on tables (I didn't ask but they may have had some available). It was slightly pricier than average. I would go back if I am in the area.

The best Pho place I have been to in the Valley from Mesa to Glendale. I sometimes come here more than once a week. Their peanut sauce is the best Vietnamese peanut sauce I have ever tasted. The staff is friendly and helpful and they know the menu well.  I get the vegetable pho and add chicken.

Best pho in town and the cleanest pho restaurant I've ever seen!!. Been eating there since they opened, sucks that they stopped serving the beef roll appetizer (it was amazing) but still go there at least a couple times a week for the pho :)

Little Saigon has been our favorite Vietnamese restaurant for over ten years!  Mind you that we don't live in the Phoenix area.  The food is always fresh and it is always 100% perfect.  Each time we go there are other Vietnamese customers dining at the restaurant, which then tells me that the food is authentic.    Throughout the years I have tasted most of their food offerings and it is always flavorful.
Great place, nice and cozy, had the pho soup and Vietnamese coffee and everything was great tasting.the broth was so light and nice loved it.  It must try place.
Great place! I love their food, fresh, delicious. I drive 45 minutes just want come here for dinner. Good price and great food. Definitely top one on my list. :)

Being this my first time I'll give it 3 stars. I will go a couple more times and then I can really give it a review but for my first experience it was ok. I got the vegetarian spring rolls and the chicken pho, both were good. Nice flavor and fast service.  The booba tea was good too. The only bad thing that I saw was the people who were sitting across from me were trying to kill a roach that was on the blinds! I'm sure they were loyal regulars or something because they didn't make a scene or said anything.

Best Vermicelli I've had in the GTA. Eaten at many Vietnamese restaurants and this one gets top notch for taste and fresh ingredients. Wife comes here regularly for the Pho which she says is the best she's tasted in Toronto. She is Japanese and super picky about both food and her restaurants. Everything we've had on the menu so far has been very good.
This place have the best pho in town. The vercemili salad is one of a kind. Staff is great and good atsmosphete. I recommend anything you will like to try.

Little Saigon, such a quaint little place in [usually] desolate old town Glendale.   Weekends are reasonably busy here, but we came on a Thursday...and were basically the only ones there. Is 8pm really that late??? Come on, night owls, where are you?  Ordered the delicious spring rolls (as described in the review below mine). The sweet fish sauce is such a great complement for these things. Also had the egg crepe, filled with bean sprouts and shrimp. Bean sprouts were fresh, crisp...but the shrimp were a little overcooked. Piling the crepe onto a bed of lettuce, mint leaves, and lemongrass was so refreshing. You can eat so much of this stuff, and not feel guilty. Those were just appetizers.   Now onto the main course. I'm always indecisive about which soup I want, but I settled with the #12, which consisted of rice noodles in beef broth, beef and pork slices, tendon, tripe, and meatballs (consistency was similar to that of the meat in a gyro). With some generous dashes of sriracha, chili paste, and fish sauce, I was in another world. In addition, this lovely medley was served in a king size bowl. Thumbs up to that, and to myself... for finishing the whole thing.   Everyone I dined with was quite satisfied with their dishes, and I would have liked to share a description of each dish, except I was too consumed with my own bowl that I became oblivious of my surroundings about 20 minutes into the meal.   Towards the end, the endearing chef made an appearance and surprised us with dessert- on the house. Nice!   I enjoy coming here... very homey, and lighthearted people. I'll probably visit again this week!

This is my favourite place for pho in toronto. The beef broth is really fresh and not diluted like other places. Vermicelli and Tom Yum are both outstanding. There's always a line up for this place. Service and staff are really nice people.

Yes very nice little place to go to eat nice location in Old Town Glendale, been there twice very good food the Pho very delicious and other different dishes.The only thing that turn me off and my wife that they pressure you to eat your food fast. They are running around that's fine with me but took my bowl of Pho half way thru it when I went to the restroom I was kinda full but wanted to take the rest home, second occasion we were told are you finish I said no why? we need this table for other parties , I was can you wait !! the few minutes later the waiter brings the bill for us to pay up and leave..... so we paid and left but never came back to this place again.

Forget the environment, go for the delicious food! The spicy curry vermicelli is what I get every time, after talking to a regular. The menu is big and daunting, so he helped me out by suggesting that, and you cannot go wrong with that or pretty much anything else. It is huge but always packed and amazing! Worth the wait, if there is one.  Huge portions, and great prices too!

When there's a restaurant that has almost a perfect rating it's a must visit. My wife and I came for lunch and we were lucky enough to get a table before the lunch rush. (Word of advice by 12 it was completely full with people waiting for tables). Being not that hungry we split an order of vermicelli and an order of spring rolls and everything was delicious. The vermicelli was fresh and one of the best ones I've had in Richmond hill so far. The amount of pork we received for the dish was also more than enough. The spring rolls were nicely fried and very tasty.  Service was a tad slow but with a packed house it was a reasonable wait. This place seems to do very well by having a smaller menu and they do it right.  Overall I will come again when I have the craving to try out the other items on their menu.

FINALLY... I found our go-to pho place in the West side.  Excellent portion sizes for the price, ton of menu items, and airy atmosphere (good chance you won't smell like the food when you leave).  Only went here once, but definitely good enough to rate it now.  Food updates after a few more eats.

Was craving Vietnamese food and wanted to try this place out! The outside decor reminds me of restaurants out in Vung Tau! We had an appetizer of Goi Ngo Sen Tom Thit which was out of this world. Wish there were more shrimp crackers on the plate to gorge on hehe  The boyfriend had Com Tam Suon Bi which he thought was pretty good for Arizona standards. I ordered the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio and thought this place was way better than another place we tried last week.   All in all, we would definitely come back!
THE Absolute BEST PHO on the west side!  Add extra jalapenos for your hangover cure Everything is fresh and hand made in house!  We frequent quite a bit and look forward to our next visit

Love this place. I am lucky to have a shop 2 blocks from here, so I can walk over any time. Great little house, food is fantastic and the staff is very helpful and friendly!!! If you have not been there yet....get there!
This quaint little restaurant tucked away in historic downtown Glendale is a must visit for foodies!  Stop in and try the authentic Vietnamese cuisine and you will leave wishing you ventured sooner.

I've heard about this place and people rave about it. The food was good. I've had better Vietnamese in the valley. I went there with co-workers for lunch because they advertise outdoor seating. They rather rudely told us it was closed . The service is pretty bad. They were rude from the start. We felt like we didn't get enough time to look over the menu before someone was getting us to order. After that everything was good until I notice a cockroach walk across the bottles of sauces and up the wall. I'll spend my money where the service is better, where outdoor seating is available, and cockroach free tables.

Man, I love this place.   I usually end up with #23, I don't know how to say it in Vietnamese, but it's damn good. My wife usually gets a #22, which is apparently a very, very, authentic dish. I am told you can only get it in certain areas of Vietnam, it is also delicious.   Spring rolls, best anywhere, I have yet to find a better spring roll from the 20-or-so other Pho places I've been to.  #47 for those of you who like Steak and rice dishes.

Loved this place, very quaint and cute for a get together. I had their springrolls and they were made fresh. I also ordered #26 the crispy & spicy stir fried veggies and noodles, AMAZING. I loved the family atmosphere and the hospitality was great. I even got my tea to go! If you want to try something more authentic and with exceptional service, make sure to stop by at Little Saigon!

the food was very good I felt bad for the girls there were only two of them for 20 tables full and people want to be seated the beef pho was one of the best I have had in town the veggie spring roll was OK will be back soon

I visited with my family. I actually came here before but could not get a seat because there was a long line. This intrigued me and hence the review here. We ordered Pho with tofu and vegetables (#157), House Special Pho (#158), Pho satay with rare beef and tripe (#354), Deep fried spring roll (#120), and Shrimp roll (#121). I ate House Special Pho (#158). It was delicious and had a right amount of meat. I also tried the vegetarian pho (#157) that had tofu and broccoli inside. This pho had a noticeably low amount of noodles. Thankfully the server responded and gave us a bit more. The spring rolls (#120) and shrimp rolls (#121) were both passable. While the food was excellent, there were a few things I did not like. First, they only accept cash. Second, everything we ordered was ever so slightly more expensive than in other places. The interior was suitable for a pho restaurant. Everything was clean, including and especially the utensils, which a big plus for me. The server was friendly, though not as responsive due to the restaurant being busy. I would not travel again just for this restaurant. However, I would like to come back if I am in the area.

Best pho in town. Best spring roll. Good food. Good prices. Highly recommended. Sometimes there can a wait but well worth it. Good thai tea. we have been going here for many years. taste is consistent. we will keep on coming back.

Been here with my bf multiple times! Id say at least 3 times now! Every time we went we got the house pho and we never get old of it. In fact, i'd say we even crave it sometimes when we're hungry. The prices are so reasonable for the quantity as well! Sadly it is only all cash but it is a small restaurant so it's understandable. The service is super quick too! We usually come when it isn't that busy but even so, it comes in around 5-10 mins after ordering. A medium size pho is super filling. The decor inside isn't spectacular though. Its not anything nice but bad either. I believe it is also family ran. -1 star for that but thats it. I highly recommend Little Sigeon for those craving pho and looking for somewhere not too expensive!
Their pho is clean and they have specialty pho which is a creamier broth. They are always packed kae sure u account for wait time
This is the BEST vietnamese restaurant in west valley! Their food taste very authentic. The atmosphere is very cozy. The service is outstanding!

The only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because they messed up my to go order once and tried to make me pay for their error. Love this place and love introducing people to this place. From the spring rolls to the Pho it is awesome. Everything is delicious and the atmosphere is cozy.

A great restaurant to visit if you are in the Glendale area. I ordered the spring rolls and chicken pho- which were both to die for. And there were many other items on the menu I would have loved to try if I were in the area any longer. If you're interested in having something a little bit different for dinner, check out little Saigon!
Boyfriend took me here as his favorite place. Absolutely loved the pho I had and definitely will be coming back again to try some other stuff.

This is the first Vietnamese restaurant I have eaten phó at. I have tried other Vietnamese places but none compare to this restaurant. I remember as a child they used to be located inside a mall. All the food on the menu is amazing. I've tried all their spring rolls, soups, noodle dishes, and desserts. I hope this place never shuts down its my favorite place to eat good Vietnamese food. However, will say that their customer service isn't that great at times. They are usually busy whenever I come in to eat. I usually order everything right when I sit down so we don't have to wait a long time for the waitress/waiter to come back around. I have eaten there so many times I know the whole menu so I usually know what I am going to eat before I even walk into the place. I highly recommend the spring rolls ( with extra peanut sauce), any of the soups, the salads, and I get the number #23 noodle dish sometimes. The frozen coconut boba or the fried banana desert dish is bomb too. Whenever I take people to eat there for the first time it becomes their favorite Vietnamese spot to eat at too. I have gotten family and friends addicted to this place as well. Whenever I am in town I always stop by to eat here, even drive across town to get here.
Had the spring rolls (#2) and the #22, which was amazing!!!! Fast service, too! Wish I lived closer.

Excellent food and atmosphere. John and Ha are the best! Johns dad is a beast in the kitchen, whipping up some of the best rolls, rice, and Pho Vietnamese cuisine has to offer. There are plenty of places to dine around Glendale, but this place is a must for us when we are in the area.

Attempted twice to come here for dinner. Came too late the first time so they were closed; they closed pretty early at 8pm.   The wait wasn't long but was completely packed. There were still lots of people waiting for seats close to closing time. Noticed the staffs were really welcoming.   Food was really good and fresh. The soup base was just perfect in flavour and the fried spring rolls were crispy (I find that not all pho places make good spring rolls when this is supposedly a signature dish).   Overall, we enjoyed our experience. The presentation of everything was clean and comfortable.

This place is a staple of my diet and for very good reason! Every single item is busting with a variety of flavor and give you an authentic taste of Vietnam. I love the spring rolls with the peanut sauce that I could drink as a beverage if they would allow it. The #37 is my standard with marinated pork chop and grilled shrimp with a side of rice topped with a sunny side up egg. I thought it odd the first time with the egg on top but after enjoying the meal I couldn't think of the meal without it.  I love the pho as well but only during the winter months as soup in the summer never seems appetizing.   Trust me if you love Asian food varieties give this gem in downtown Glendale a shot and never look back

I've finally had a chance to come back to this restaurant and try their pho.  The service was still amazing so I feel somewhat guilty, but I'm going with 2 stars.  After all, pho is the main factor here.  I was really disappointed by their pho.  The broth was bland and lacked flavor.  The meat was okay, but the portions were a bit small.  I'm gonna have to stick with Central King Eggroll for pho - the only place I've found in AZ that is even close to CA pho quality.

This is by far my favourite pho place. It is a nice, small restaurant, located in a plaza. I have been several times now and I will continue to do so. The staff are nice, quiet, but very nice. The prices are great ($7.00 for a regular size pho) and their servings are amazing compared to other places that I have been to.  I have also tried their vermicelli, fried rice, and pad thai, all of which were fantastic. My favourite has got to be their pho. Super fresh! Great place!

Legit yummy! A friend and I met up for early lunch last Saturday and we loved the character and charm of the remade house, complete with potted plants and picket fence. As Yelpers suggested, I parked at the thrift store parking lot just north of the restaurant, but there's also street parking available on 57th Ave.  We showed up close to open because we were both starving and hate crowds. The inside was small, but I loved the nice touches like flowers on the table along with a full assortment of condiments, curtains on the windows, and fairly intimate setting.   I wasn't sure what to expect in terms of service after reading the below reviews, but it started off great - the waiter was friendly and offered to answer any questions we had. I had a Vietnamese coffee and my friend ordered a plain boba tea. Her tea was great, and my coffee was good, but not awesome. I enjoy watching the coffee sit and drip into the condensed milk myself and savoring that rich aroma, but here, they prepped the coffee in the back and just brought me the finished glass. It could have been a bit creamier, but it wasn't too sweet, and the coffee was delightfully strong.   We started with the shrimp and pork spring rolls (#2), which were a bit bigger (longer) than the ones I'd had in other restaurants, so they were sliced in half - $4 was fair for two of these bad boys. They were absolutely scrumptious and very fresh, but packed a little loosely, so the goodies kept falling out as I was trying to dip the roll. I'd recommend grabbing your spoon and scooping the peanut sauce as you need it. Also, try it with the red chile sauce on the table...yum.   We both had our hearts set on pho and ordered two bowls of sliced beef & shrimp pho, #12. The server remarked that it was his favorite menu item, so we were excited. The plate of goodies on the side did not disappoint, but we could have used some extra cilantro and basil. The flavor was just salty enough, the shrimp were more generously sized that I expected, and the beef was tender and not fatty or oily. I've noticed that some Vietnamese restaurants tend to add oil to their pho, and thankfully, Little Saigon did not. The bowl wasn't very greasy at all.  When we had gorged ourselves on delicious pho, we hung out for a few minutes and caught up. This is when I could see what other Yelpers had experienced in terms of service - as soon as the restaurant started to fill up, the servers became stressed and harried, checking tables with visible impatience. That's a bit ridiculous when you're making your way through a giant bowl of pho. I always tip extra if I stay a little longer, so I wasn't about to guilt myself into leaving. When we left a few minutes later, there was a grand total of two people waiting out in the foyer.   I also noticed that Little Saigon has a sizeable patio area out front with lots of potential, but a sign read "patio closed." If seating's an issue, guys, open up the patio. Shame too, it was a beautiful day. Unfortunately, indoors got a bit stuffy and warm, especially near our window seat. I even checked to see whether the window would open...lol.  Before tip, a boba tea, Vietnamese coffee, two spring rolls, and two bowls of delicious pho came to $30. Not bad for being stuffed out of our gourds.  Overall: solid Vietnamese cuisine, frankly the best (excluding homemade) I've had in the Valley. For you Vietnamese noobs, the menu details everything clearly and is organized by types of noodles - a must for gluten-free eaters (the rice noodles are great!). However, I'll be sure to get there during their non-peak hours to skip the attitude.
My second favorite vietnamese restaurant in the valley. Great pho, great atmosphere... spring rolls are to die for. Can't go wrong with this place, everything is good here!

Ordered a house special pho. The broth tastes soooo good. I will be happy if I am just given with the bowl of broth. Other than the broth, the pho is chewy though the portion of pho is comparatively small. Besides, it has a few slices of beef, beef balls and beef tendons etc.  On the side, the sprouts and the herbs are fresh. The tea tastes good as well. I will definitely come back again to try other dishes.

Fo-yeah!! This place rocks! The first time we went there was based on Yelp reviews and we weren't disappointed. The egg rolls eaten wrapped in mint and cilantro and dipped in fish sauce simply blew us away. I'm yet to taste that kind of perfection anywhere else.  The second time we went, the service kind of put us off. The waiter brought us the wrong order and when we sent it back he made faces and ignored us the remainder of the meal, which we thought was very unprofessional.   My husband gives the 'Fo' 5 stars (a soup with noodles, meat and sprouts ) which is really high considering that he has eaten really great authentic Vietnamese food in Japan and HK. We love this place and will keep going back.

Had high hopes from reviews. Place was literally the inside of someones house. Server seemed prejudiced because she brought our drinks out and never came back. Another server did the rest. And they would check on every table a lot except ours, because they probably thought white ppl tipped better. I ordered calamari and it was a bit burnt at parts meaning black. It was bland. I barely ate any and just drank soup from what my SO ordered. Servers obviously noticed I barely ate, not once did they ask "is something wrong? Did you want something else?" They just handed me the check and I spoke up saying I didn't like it because it tasted burnt and bland to me to which the server responded, "it's not burnt. It's like that because at stirfried." Like yeah.... I know what burnt is. I've had deep fried food that was stir fried before and it didn't have black marks on it and taste bitter.. and he's like you can talk to the manager. Like I've worked in restaurants as a server when I was younger and whenever I notice someone not enjoying their food I would ask about it and let the manager know they don't like it not just tell them to talk to the manager about it. So at this time I was upset I'm just like yeah whatever. The guy just walked away without getting the manager or anything. I had to walk up to the cash register to pay. He didn't say anything. All I got was "sign here." I usually tip at least 20% on every meal and this is my first time not tipping. Customer service was horrible. I didn't even eat the food and just left it. Customer service and satisfaction should be their first priority rather than defending it and trying to make someone pay for something they don't like. So cheap! Felt so prejudiced against and then almost forced to pay for shitty service and a shitty meal. Go somewhere else for viet food.

Great viet pho spot if you're willing to line up.  The line ups have gotten a bit crazy over the last few months, and there's always that odd person who will try to bud so it gets stressful waiting.  Food: great, both the soup noodle and vermicelli dish is very good. Broth is not fatty and vermicelli comes with abundant vegetables.   Place: line ups are too crowded, long wait, not many tables as it is a small restaurant.   Service: good and polite and fast.   Price: due to high demand, their prices recently increased on certain menu items.   Overall, would reccomend, but only to those who are ok with a long wait, likely outdoirs as well when the line gets long.

Some of the best pho soup I've ever tasted. The broth is very strong and flavourful. However, the vermicelli was a little bit on the oily side.They don't have all the options you would typically find in a Vietnamese restaurant as their menu is a bit shorter.  It is cash only and I went on a Saturday afternoon around 2pm and had to wait 20 minutes for a table. The service is great and the staff is very friendly, would definitely come here again!

Very romantic little restaurant in Glendale near all the downtown shopping. They have good food and great service. The menu has a wide selection with vegetarian options. There is outdoor seating, too! Great place, I'm a regular here.

Service was quick and attentive and the food was good. Not as good as the other place we used to eat Pho at but was OK. Our old place, Central King Eggroll in Goodyear, switched owners and isn't nearly as good as it once was and we're trying to find a new place. Little Saigon was good but not great and the Pho was super greasy which isn't what we're used to.  I would eat here again if I were in the area but won't drive all the way from Goodyear to eat here.

The place was smaller than I expected, which was unfortunate because after we arrived and sat down, a bunch of people showed up but had to wait because a group of 15 basically took over the whole restaurant...  We ordered the pho special, pork vermicelli, and spring rolls. The food was decent. The spring rolls were too oily for my liking. I've tried other places that weren't as mediocre. I'm sure my bf and I will be back if we're craving pho and don't want to drive to our usual place.

This hidden gem is tucked away in the heart of downtown Glendale. Little Saigon is a very small restaurant and does not seat too many patrons at one time. When we went in, there was a couple leaving and we got their table, the last table available. There were only a couple of people working in the restaurant, but they were very efficient in getting drink & food orders, answering any questions, etc.  After a glance over the menu, I knew I was in the mood for some fried rice so I decided to get a grilled chicken plate and substituted for fried rice. My date got the most filling pho soup per recommendation from our waiter. I'm not a huge fan of pho, but my boyfriend really enjoyed it. He said he'd definitely recommend it since it was flavorful and had a lot of meat; like our waiter said, it was very filling. As far as the rice dish goes - my only complaint about the chicken is that it was a very fatty piece. The fried rice however was really good. When we go next, I'd ask if I can get just the fried rice because it was the best thing on the plate, along with an order of the egg rolls. I might try one of the stir-fry noodle dishes as well.  The food & service was good, so we'll be back here in the future!

The spring rolls were good and the food we ordered was A-OK.  that about sums it up.  Not the great Vietnamese food I ever had but it's hard to go wrong with fish sauce!  Service was decent, too.   We had the noodle salad and pork and beef with fried rice.  It's definitely good enough to come back and try something new on the menu!

I absolutely love this restaurant! It's so delicious and my husband loves the deep fried banana dessert. The rolls are the best! The waiters and waitresses are always so nice too. You can tell it is a family owned restaurant.

Quick summary... this place is awesome! It's located in a cute little part of Glendale in what must have been a house at some point. The service was excellent. We had a super sweet waiter who was very attentive. Their fresh spring rolls were good (and served in a cute little divided dish)  although a little hard to eat.. My filling kept falling into the peanut sauce. The Pho was good as well.. there wasn't a ton of beef in it but it was still filling and the price was right so it didn't bother me much. They offer a variety of imported beer options which is fun and their thai tea boba was delish. Definitely a neat little find while driving through Phoenix on the way back to Tucson. The prices were also the best I've seen for Pho in a while. I'd love to come back here.
One of the best Pho in Richmond Hill. Pho is "pure" and clean. Speedy service. Expect to wait in line 10-15min when busy.

My first time exploring a new Vietnamese restaurant in AZ. I ordered the special dry noodles and a friend order Pho special. My noodles came out looking very greasy due to how it was prepared. Very much Chinese food style, the broth is not hot enough, green onions is stale, the broth lack of flavor from the slow cook of the bone, same for the pho. It's a family operation and home atmosphere. The food is not as authentic as I like it to be. The flavor is gear towards non traditional Vietnamese food.  Overall, service is great, ambient is good, food is ok to my expectations for authentic Vietnamese. I would not comeback or recommend to friends if they love authentic Vietnamese food. It's average food to my personal opinion.  Enjoy
Little Saigon is the best vietnamese food you can get in Glendale. Good, cozy atmosphere too. But watch out on Sundays, they close a little early; make sure you get your order in by 6:30pm!

We went for Pho and it was delicious!  The various cuts of meat tasted fresh and freshly cooked.  The rice noodles were also delicious and they warmed up just right.  We had the fried spring rolls and those were a tad bit on the small side but we could tell they were also fresh.   This place is usually packed on the weekends but if you go during the week, you get seated right away.  Our server was nice and pleasant...she checked on us with perfect timing to refill our drinks.   Highly recommend this place for Pho lovers!

This small but clean restaurant is conveniently located next to T and T supermarket, so you can come here for a quick economical bite after groceries.  Service was well done, waiter was attentative.  Ordered the grilled lemon grass chicken vermicelli with spring roll, which eventually met my expectations. They proportion the ingredients well, as there was plenty of chicken and veggies. I really don't like it when restaurants overdo the vermicelli, so this place did a good job. The chicken was nicely flavoured with lemongrass and was juicy.  Overall, a good place to drop by for a quick eat of adequate quality for a good price!

I had been wanting to Little Saigon for a very long time.  So glad I finally made it happen!  Wow!  It's now at the top of my list when I get to choose.  I'm going there for my Birthday!  The family that makes it happen is fantastic and the Pho is the absolute best around.  Everything on the menu is scrumptious, Spring Rolls are a must.  It's really difficult to get past the Pho to try the rest of the menu though!    Thank you Cathy and Caroline for answering all our questions and helping us decide.  It's really difficult to get our Vietnamese food anywhere else.

My go to pho place because the place is close by my house!  The portions are generous and the service is quick.    The menu is small but has everything I want.  The broth is also not super oily like some of the other pho places.  I come here usually once a week!

Delicious and good quality food. I have been pleasantly surprised by this restaurant in the location.  Like many others rated, the vamicelli has been very delicious. Added additional fresh herbs and greens, mixed along with the shrimp and pork made if a great and very lean dish. The service has been very pleasing accommodating. The restaurant itself is a classic average Asian decorated location with a clean interior.   Can more than recommend trying out this place for the vamicelli's!!

I can't add much to the great reviews, except I had to rave about Little Saigon!  I've tried a few Vietnamese restaurants on the west side, then my hubby stumbled across Little Saigon on his first trip to Yelpland.  Located in charming downtown Glendale only two miles from home, we went there on a Saturday night.  There is a generous patio with lovely twinkle lights, and you can hear the music from the coffee shop across the street.  The interior is bright and cheerful, with, I think, 3 rooms.  The place was almost full - always a good sign, and a very friendly waiter seated us and took our drink orders.  The menu is generous, and the prices reasonable.  We shared spring rolls and potstickers.  Best spring roll ever, methinks: not too much lettuce as filler, delish pork and shrimp that tastes like it once swam, with a light peanut sauce that does not overwhelm.  The potstickers were also great - generously filled with tasty pork and veggies, complimented by a mild Asian BBQ sauce.  We were off to a good start.  Hubs, who is new to Vietnamese cuisine, and who gets props for trying, chose a pan fried rice noodle dish with meat (at least chicken and shrimp) and veggies.  He thoroughly enjoyed it, generously offering me one bite, and pretending not to notice when I stole a couple more.   Just as my bench-mark dish for rating Thai restaurants is Pad Thai, my dish for Vietnamese food is Bun Thit Nuong (or Bun Thit Heo Nuong here).  My bowl had all the right stuff: tender, flavorful grilled pork (not a speck of gristle - a first in Phoenix!), lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, mint, and julienned cukes, vermicelli and sauce.  I love the sweet, vinegary sauce that comes with Bun Thit Nuong, and my sweet server told me the ingredients.  It was simply so very good.  Little Saigon has the whole package:  clean, cute, friendly and attentive service, and excellent food.  We can't wait to go back and try some of the other things on the menu, and mentioned in Yelp reviews.  Can you say "Yum, yum", Dum Dum?
Tried this place for the first time and it was so good!!!! I had the pork on vermicelli noodle 10/10 !!!! My new  go to pho place!
Came here on a weekday evening and this place was very busy.  Pros: - Well priced - Nice ambiance - Good food  Cons: Food is a little bland

Great mom and pop Vietnamese.  "Hidden" location, super friendly service, clean bright atmosphere and good food.  My word of mouth for Little Saigon is get some of this food in your mouth.  I was with Mark R. today, but I may bring my wife here on a date.  The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable.      I did the goi-cuon-chay and then mi-xao-me.  I asked then to make the stir-fry noodles (mi-xao) extra spicy, but it was medium at best. The red chili paste on the table made it easy to add heat, so no problem there.    Digression: The spice issue brings out one of my double standards.  I want authentic ethnic food but, not authentic atmosphere.  Anyone else who has been outside the resort in a third world country should agree.    To the point Little Saigon was bright clean and comfortable and the food was great.  Fire up your GPS and come on down!

This place is so damn delicious! By far best Vietnamese place to eat and customer service is also great!   I've been eating vegetarian for over a month and every time I eat there I get the veggie egg rolls, spinach with garlic sauce, and there lemon grass tofu that normally comes with chicken but obviously leave the chicken out... And OMG! #foodorgasm! Lol.. AMAZING!

A good place to go for phô noodles! It's one of our new favorite pho restaurant.  Soup for the soup noodles is hot and tasteful but not overpowering. Great service and a clean place to dine in!  Food came in an appropriate time. The appetizers rice paper rolls are neat easy to eat won't spill out everywhere. Overall we enjoy eating here. Just remember to arrive earlier for dinner to get quick seating availability.

I have been looking at the reviews after friends had recommended this place. My husband and I went last night and the greeting we got at the door was very welcoming. The dacor is nice and I look forward to trying it in the fall in the evening when the lights are on on the patio.   I am glad I looked at pictures in advance because the menu is very extensive. I will definitely be going back. Thank you for a wonderful evening and great food
