I've been here waaaay too much, first of all if you've never had Viet food I suggest getting an order of spring rolls or egg rolls for appetizers and a bowl of beef pho with meatballs for entree. Or if you feel like a rice plate, pick the pork chop and butterfly shrimp. You can never go wrong with what I just listed.

Thanks to Yelpers, this is now my favourite Vietnamese restaurant!   The grilled lemongrass beef vermicelli with a spring roll tasted authentic, the fish sauce wasn't diluted like most places, and it's actually ran by Vietnamese people. Highly recommend!

Mmmhmmm this place rocks!  The service is outstanding and it's located in a sweet little spot downtown Glendale.  The prices and hours are a bonus and they do serve great unique drinks,  na and alcoholic

Had the number 13 (the vegetarian pho) and it was very yummy! I don't like that the noodles are one big bundle thrown in on the side because it was hard to take them apart but once I got them separated it was delicious.   Only two people working the front but both seemed to be very attentive and on top of keeping the customers satisfied.

After staring at the pictures on here and being shut down the last time I tried to order out from the place I decided to go in person and give them a second chance.   We went on a Saturday night. Even though the place clearly says you have to be there by 8:30 to be seated, the sign on the door was already turned to the closed side and it was 8:07!!?? What is the deal with this place? I felt like just turning and walking away but the wife insisted on going in. The place was completely dead. Maybe 3 tables of customers and a group of relatives at another table. The inside is like you are in someones house that was converted to a restaurant. Nothing fancy and the walls need a really good scrubbing but for the most part it was relatively clean. The house is located on the northwest side of the street. Just south of a St Vincent De Paul building.   We were seated right away and ordered some spring rolls first. They were clear rolls and were stuffed with shrimp, beef, noodles, and some cilantro. There were two decent sized rolls and came with a peanut dipping sauce. They were tasty but I couldn't help but think they would be much better warm.   I ordered the 27 Pho ap Chao - pan fried noodle stir fry w/ beef, pork, chicken, shrimp, and veggies. It was piping hot and had a pretty decent flavor to it. It had a massive amount of vegetables. I am talking carrots, leaks, snow peas, etc. It could have used a little more meat but other than that it was very good. Then at the bottom of the dish I finally dug my way to the pan fried noodles. They were outstanding. Crunchy but soft. Burnt a little but not too much. They may have been the best part of the dish. My wife ordered some spicy chicken with vegetables. Her meal came with white rice and was huge as well. It tasted very similar to my dish but without the bomb noodles.   The server was very friendly and it seemed very much like a family ran business. The entire bill came out to under 30 bucks and could have fed two more people. I am very glad I gave this place a second and third chance. My only suggestion would be to either stop doing phone orders or provide the extra service and to not put your closed sign up when you are supposed to be open for almost another whole hour. If this place wasn't recommended from a friend I probably would have never gave it another chance.   To their defense they have a sign that states they do not take phone orders when they are busy. Maybe they should at the least put that on their answering machine so people don't keep trying to call back? That being said, their food is terrific, the portions are generous, and I can't wait to go back. Next time I will be sure to try and get there a little sooner.
Yummy. The family stopped by furring vacation. Good stuff.

Hands down THE best Vietnamese spot in the state! Spring rolls are fresh and there is an entree for everyone on the menu. Your mouth will water when you hear the sizzling little pots used to serve their most delicious menu items!
Another amazing meal. Pork and steak dishes are fantastic.  As usual, pho didn't disappoint. Great food with reasonable prices.

Wonderful little place. I absolutely love the outdoor courtyard and the quaint little establishment inside. The waiter was very patient and likeable and the service was quick. Food was spectacular and there was a lot of people coming in to have lunch. (:
Pho gooood! Taste like authentic Vietnamese food. Great service. We eat here all the time!
Cute place with delicious food. I can't wait to try it again.

The Pho is the best in Richmond Hill here. However the wait is long and they close 2:30-5:30.   Also the service is a bit slow since they're so busy. And they do not do takeout. And only accept cash, but ATM is available inside the restaurant.

Oh my gosh the food was so good! My boyfriend and I went there last night and Min was our server. He was super friendly and answered all our questions with out making us feel stupid! Will gladly go there again ESPECIALLY if he's  he server. We haven't been this satisfied with our food in forever!

Zero stars... Just drove for 30 mins to get here because of your ratings and you are closed? But your site and yelp say you are open until 8pm..... Its 4pm and they sent me away said to come back at 530... Nope sorry not how it works for me anyways...

This restaurant is definitely a fun place to visit and the old timey Glendale house that they have here is both enjoyable and relaxing inside. It can be a little hard to find so bring your GPS or cell phone.  Came here with my new Yelp friend Michael C for a mini UYE. We were trying to find a new place with some spicy kick and decided to give this place a test drive.  Ordered some Veggie Spring Rolls and some Catfish Soup. Mr Mike went with a Spicy Chicken and Noodle dish and had them make it extra spicy. They also have plenty of nifty condiments to jazz things up a bit on the table.  Both the food and the service were outstanding and the prices were very reasonable. Their menu has a good variety of Vietnamese favorites and you can have them customize the ingredients if there are certain foods that you should not be eating.  Looking forward to bringing my wife here and treating her to a nice comfortable meal. The cool part is afterwards you can go for a swell walkabout around the downtown area and visit some of their really old town and classic shops as well as just soaking up some scenery. I'LL BE BACK!  4.5 STARS

This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I went there on a Friday night for dinner. Service was super fast and the food was delicious.   I took my father there the next day for lunch. Even he complimented on the food. He's the kind that will not eat at a Vietnamese restaurant since it's something we can "have at home." :)   Just absolutely love this place.
Love the quaint cottage appeal and absolutely delicious food!!  Dinner for the price of lunch!  Already making plans to bring friends next time

I went for first time to this place I was really pleased with food and service I ordered the rice paper spring roll with shrimp and pork (MUST HAVE) a chx broth pho and also the rice vermicelli bowl w shrimp, If you're really into noodles this is the place 100% recommended. Plus place is super cozy!

Solid 4. Fair value for your money. Only exception are the tiny pork egg rolls, 6 pieces for 6 and they're the size of my 7 year old pinky finger. The beef pho was ok, the broth was tasty and the beef was very tender. The barbecued pork vermicelli was also tasty fair portion for seven bucks. The shrimp and BBQ pork plate dinner seemed kind of small the shrimp didn't seem very fresh, the BBQ pork was tender and delicious.  Our server was also very good checking up on us , and making sure we were happy with our meal. I'll go back to this place when I'm in Glendale.

The pho + other entrees are pretty standard, but the thing that sets this place apart from the rest are their EGGROLLS.  Being an Asian from the Bay Area Ca (an Asian Mecca) I've searched high and low for adequate Asian food in Phoenix (a landscape that pretty much only caters to hamburgers and burritos) and I must say that Little Saigon has the BEST EGGROLLS in the Valley, hands down.

Great place for Phó Fried spring rolls were very nice ..  Pork in pork and vegetable wrap was o crooked with burnt edges ..  All in all great phó and sides .. with very reasonable prices  ..  clean place including restroom Very Nice staff Will come back

Small place and closes early(one hour earlier than window sign). Sometimes is packed. And that is because the pho is really good. Always go for rare beef pho. Shrimp and pork rolls are very good. Must try Vietnamese coffe (with condensed milk)

Great place to go when craving pho! The restaurant is in the same plaza as T&T so there is a large parking lot. Service is fast and friendly and the place is very clean. I ordered their house special pho which came with rare beef, beef balls, tripe and tendon and the broth was delicious! I will definately be back!

Okay, I'll admit it: one of the reasons I love going into any type of Eastern restaurant is because I'm still fairly ignorant of the cuisine.  Sure, I'll try just about anything, but half the time, I still don't know what it even is I'm ordering.  I really enjoy that.  The reason I bring that up is that there is SO much to try on the menu at Little Saigon.  It's a pretty sizable menu, and it might not be ideal for the indecisive.  Luckily, the size of the menu did not seem to diminish the skill at which it was prepared.  The appetizers looked like something out of a gourmet food magazine.  The main dishes (at least mine) was served literally still boiling and bubbling.  It all tasted as good as it smelled.  Oh, and since I seem to be addicted to trying new things, I'll advise you on this: the salted plum tea is actually surprisingly good.  While I'm no expert on Vietnamese cuisine, I'm sure I'll find myself back here soon to keep learning.

Back for part two  this pictured here is the best Pho and the best #SatayPho to be had  I almost have to say 'of all time'  actually IT IS.  Experience the most satisfaction & enjoy the time of your life in a bowl of pure liquid love. .  I can't get enough.

What a find during my ongoing Vietnamese food trip - a Vietnamese restaurant which, unlike the others I've been to, is located in a charming converted little home rather than in a run down strip mall.  But the food is just as good or better, and with run-down-strip-mall-eatery prices. Their banh xeo (crispy rice crepes stuffed with beansprouts and shrimp) is awesome, and the generous seafood soup with white asparagus is something I'd order even on a hot day.  One of my favorite Vietnamese dishes is rice vermicelli with shrimp and pork or beef, and while their version is not as bold in flavor as Dong A's, it is definitely quite tasty. The courteous service complements the brevity of the wait between placing your order and receiving your food.

Fresh food. Well mAde.good flavor. Lots on the menu. Each time I get something different. Each time it's better and better.  I was not a fan of the green tea ice cream. It was fresh and I am sure most people would like it.
Amazing food! I love it...perfect and fast service, my fist time here and I will be definitely back for more sprig rolls
First time eating there yesterday and the food was delicious, the service was great, and the overall atmosphere is very nice and warm. I recommend this place!!~

One of my all time favorite Vietnamese restaurants in Arizona. The loveliest people work here. Very personable/respectful servers, they're able to provide excellent service despite being slammed with tables. The owner often comes out to greet people and makes sure everyone is satisfied.  I've never had a complaint about anything I've ordered here, it's always been flavorful and filling. Big menu and everything is made to order! Prices are really affordable and the portions are great.

Found this little gem while shopping at T&T.   The food is excellent. Although the portions are a little smaller than other pho places, the quality makes up for it.  Ordered shrimp rolls and 2 special pho. The sauce for the shrimp roll is fantastic and the rolls were fresh as well. Soup base for the pho is clean and not too salty.   This place is cash only.

This place is great!! We've been there a couple of times, first with some friends or ours that are regulars, so the staff and the chef already knows them, and know what they like and how they like it. We were treated really good, and the different dishes we tried were soooo good. Between the crepes, and the fish in garlic sauce. Second time we went, we went on our own, and we were treated really good, too. It made no difference that they don't know us, and were not in the company of regulars, their service staff is great, attentive, and always on top pf things. I recommend it highly!

This is my absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Glendale.  Their Pho is amazing.  The vermicelli with check and egg roles is a personal favorite also.  Service is always good but anything around Noon and you'll be waiting a bit for lunch as they tend to get busy.  This is by my work and I try to go at least a few times a month.  It's worth the drive from wherever you are at in the valley!

We've been here a couple of times and we never really had issues and plus we did come later in the evening, maybe the workers were tired. We sign and get seated in 4 mins, we get out drinks and start ordering. We ordered pho and egg rolls. Takes awhile to get the food, we finally get it. The nuc mam is watered down, and to our luck my bf gets a hair in the food. He was cool about it, didn't make a scene and it takes about 15 mins to be noticed by a waiter, he sends back the pho with the hair. It takes another 20 mins to the pho back. The pho has less meat and broth. At the end we ended up paying for everything or didn't get an apology or discount since the pho did have hair

Great locally owned authentic restaurant. I love every dish I have tried. Chicken pho, the chicken curry pot, the eggplant vegetarian meal, and so many other dishes. Don't forget to order the fried bananas as an appetizer! Yummy! And they still have the best peanut sauce I have ever tasted at any Vietnamese/pho kitchen. If you like pacing your appetizer and meal make sure to order your appetizer and do not order your meal til you are almost finished with the appetizer. This restaurant does not do very well with timing of meals mostly because it is a small restaurant and they need to get people in and out in order to accommodate everyone. That being said, if they are busy this is not a place to hang out and hog a table for hours. Enjoy a great Vietnamese meal and then enjoy down town Glendale if you want to visit with your friends.

Best vietnamese food EVER!  They make me feel like family when we visit.  Usually, I have one or two things I like at restaurants and stick with those, but everything on their menu is so good!  Gotta try it all.

Been here twice so far and plan to return multiple more times. The place is small but the food is amazing. The jellyfish salad is very refreshing on a hot day. Haven't had anything bad yet and with only 2 visits so far we have managed to sample a lot from the menu.

Actually never tried the food but had the service. Waited 35 minutes without any sort of acknowledgement. Finally had to ask one of the servers and was told it was going to be another 15-20 minutes with a slight smirk. We are "backed up" he said. More then enough tables to seat the additional 4 parties behind us just not smart enough with wait management for a restaurant. No apologies, none needed, because I don't think they really cared. Should have walked out within 15 minutes.

But why is this place so popular?? Having stumbled upon this Viet restaurant on Yelp while in the area, I came here for lunch at 11 not knowing that it opened at 11:30. So no biggie, I go walk around the T&T next door for a while and return at around 11:25 to see if they were opened yet. TO MY SURPRISE.. like an actual "wtf?" surprise, there were over 30 people already lined up in front of the restaurant???   As soon as the doors opened, people flooded in and seated themselves until the restaurant was at full capacity. At that point, more people were still coming in so they already started to have a queue of people waiting in line for the next rounds!! Insane! I thought I was in for a real treat - found myself at a hidden gem perhaps?!   To my disappointment though, I found the food here to be VERY subpar. Maybe it's because I live closer to the Scarborough area but the pho, vermicelli, and rice wrap rolls here are NOTHING compared to the Viet restaurants I normally go to. From the flavors and textures to portion sizes and sheer variety on the menu, this place just wasn't that good..  The food here isn't bad by any means but I just really don't understand why they would have line ups! ..I'm thinking it's only because there's not much food to choose from up in this area.

This place rocks!  Well worth a short drive off I-17 to enjoy some of the best Pho in the Valley!  I've had the Pho, shrimp springrolls (outstanding) and their Kung Pow-savored every morsel.  Service from the owners is wonderful, I love it when a business "gets it" and this place is hitting on all cylinders.

Placed an order for pickup within 30 seconds of being on the phone. Food was delicious, we got #21 and #20 and couldn't tell which we liked better both were fantastic. Only complaint is that I didn't get any stuffed shrimp with my #20 and #21 only came with 2 pieces of shrimp.   I would come back, but I'm def going to explore other Pho options in the area first. I give the food itself a 5 star review but not receiving something I paid for is fairly upsetting.
This is my favorite restaraunt.   Period.  I did not grow up eating Vietnamese food, but it's now my favorite.

Maybe it was an off night. Had the pho and it wasn't that good. Nothing special just plain broth. The guy next to our table sure lived his because he was slurping away(loud slurping is encouraged when eating pho fyi). Had the taro shaved ice for dessert. Let me say it was gross. It tasted like old frozen ice. You know that taste of freezer you can get with food you put in freezer like ice cream? Well thats what this tasted like.  With so many other Vietnamese places all around Phoenix i will skip this place and try something else.

Our first experience here, we ordered the egg rolls and spring rolls.  Both were fresh and the egg rolls were hot.  The spring roll was delicious with the homemade sauce. That in itself was almost a small meal. The grilled beef with Bok choi was simply amazing, hot and fresh.  I accompanied my plate with Sriracha which took it to another dimension.  My sister order the veggie rice noddle soup w/ extra chicken.  It smelled awesome, the classic Pho soup with all the veggies.  The taste was outta this world. Definitely coming back to this place.
One of the best pho place ever!!! Definitely will keep coming. Only thing is you have to wait every time during the lunch or diner time.

Can definitely say it is worth the wait! came with a friend for friday lunch and waited around 20 minutes to be seated. Mostly tables and booths for 2s and 4s so be careful if you've got a large group. It's too bad their grill wasn't working (which meant only soup items were available), but the servers were friendly and mentioned it to everyone in line in advance. Guess most people were there for the pho since no one left even after hearing that...  Ordered the large house special while my friend got the large rare beef pho. The portions are pretty good here for a large size, with a good serving of rare beef, beef ball, tendon and tripe, along with noodles that were a nice thickness. THAT BROTH IS SOMETHING ELSE - full of flavor but not extremely salty or concentrated. Add the lime and hoisin sauce for even more goodness!  Service was quick and friendly, and the place was very well kept and clean. Large bowls were $10, which is pretty in line with other restaurants. If you're in the rhill area, I'd be hard pressed to find a better spot to satisfy a pho craving.     Note: their hours are pretty limited for both lunch and dinner, so pick your spots and days to go! ATM is inside for those short on cash.
Really good food. Really fast and very accommodating. Broth was amazing. Waiter was great to work with.
My daughter took me here from Mother's Day and we had a very delicious lunch and the service was excellent and the waitress was very sweet. So I give it A5 star rating.

This place is a gem! Had the number 24 and my wife had number 40. Absolutely delicious! Big portions too. My dish had a delicious fire roasted smokey flavor which I loved, gave the dish a wonderful flavor. Everything on the menu sounds great.  Will definitely be coming here regularly.

Great food and great service.  The pho is tasty and the rolls are very good.  The menu is simple and straightforward.  The place is really clean and the waiters are very calm and smiling towards the customer.

Had the mi quang yesterday and it was very filling and delicious!  It comes with pork, chicken and shrimp and a light broth and side of veggies! So good!   Downside is kinda pricey but worth it and I ordered the egg rolls but for six dollars you get these mini egg rolls not very appetizing but over all will be coming back.
Spring rolls were good.  Service was excellent. Pho had a lot of flavor. Portions was kind of small.  Overall good place. I'd come back again.
Clean and food is amazing. The service is really good compare to a lot of pho restaurants. Pho broth is clear and yummy. They do not accept debit so bring cash.

Had one of the Vermicelli salad bowls with chicken, quite amazing. A combination of sweet and spice with mint and cilantro. It's amazing and I recommend it. Service was great and a very friendly atmosphere.

Came here on a Saturday night expecting great food based on good reviews from Yelp!   Bad experience!   I had the spring rolls, pho tai and also the Vietnamese coffee.  The spring rolls were good and the pho was okay.  After I got home, I started having stomach pain and used the bathroom twice.  I don't know if it was the food or the drink that was bad, but I certainly will not go back.

I've dined here 3 or 4 times for lunch and have enjoyed each meal.  Their menu has a "Vegetable Entrees" section with a nice list of options.  So far, I've had the veggie spring rolls (yum), stir-fry tofu (yum), and the coconut curry (double yum!).  The employees are very happy to answer any menu questions I've had about dairy, fish sauce, and other non-veg ingredients.  The entree sizes are quite generous, and the staff is so attentive.  Our glasses were filled each time they got about half-way empty.  Every server walking by asked us if we wanted more rice.  And when I got a to-go box, our server offered me extra rice -- how nice!  I work in downtown Glendale and appreciate a great local restaurant that's good for vegetarians and vegans (there are so few down there).  I'll definitely keep going back.

OMG god am I glad I only live 5 minutes from here! Can I just live here and eat here everyday?!? I'm so serious this place blows my mind away!!! It's so ridiculously good! It's really intimate and when you first walk in you may think you are walking into any other hole in the wall Vietnamese joint but boy are you in for a treat! Anything you get on the menu I guarantee will be great. I highly recommend the spring rolls on the appetizer section, it looks like a condom with a bunch of veggies and shrimp and beef stuffed inside but it's amazing! Also if you have never tried pho before this is a great place to do so. I love seafood so I always get the shrimp and beef pho and it never disappoints me. Customer service is great! They are always on their toes to make sure you are pleased! This place absolutely deserves a 5 star. It's a must try!!!

My go to pho restaurant in Richmond Hill. The pho broth & noodle texture is on point. Vermicelli & toppings delicious. Grill pork fresh rolls are the addictive. Small restaurant in a busy plaza... worth the wait! Not a ton of variety but it's not a bad thing. Service is really good for an Asian restaurant too.

Well ended up at Little Saigon on Sat. night too and again great service and wonderful food. I am always affraid to try new things but I have trusted John's (the server) suggestions and loved them. I noticed going to this place it almost feels like going to visit with family the staff is so nice and even the people that go in there have been really nice. It was packed saturday when we went and there were so many different types of people and I still felt that warm welcoming feeling. I really like this place a lot and so does my family. I wanted to go agin tonight but I didn't want them to think I was stalking the place lol. So if you are ever in the area check this place out it is the bomb!

My friends have been raving about thus place for months. We finally made it out here to try it. The place was packed for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. Good sign. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table.  Feels like a large house turned into a restaurant. We were seated in s smaller room to the side. Only 2 servers working together. Both were hostesses and cashier and everything else st the same time. One took our drink order and ran off. Before drinks came the other server came over to take the order. Very rushy (is that a word)? I knew what I wanted from the awesome Yelper pics. So I explained to her that I was highly allergic to shellfish. Usually, actually, ALWAYS, when I mention the allergies, the servers go out of their way to make me feel welcomed. Always accommodate my needs and triple reassurance that my meal will be prepared and cooked separately and without contamination to any seafood. The server with a smirky and "not my problem " attitude told me that everything was prepared and marinated with fish sauce and contaminated with seafood while under preparation. Which I thought food preparation had to be separated. However, she then went on to tell me if u get hives I can't help u. If u need an epipen I can't help you. Her attitude was enough for my hubby and I to say thank you but we'll pass. And left to eat at a friendlier more accommodating Asian restaurant. Actually made me sad because the food looked so good but I'm not going to put my health in danger. And I will not let my allergies become a joke to unprofessional ppl. Had a nice lunch elsewhere.

Great place! Found it through Yelp after the Glendale Chocolate Affaire. Fresh coconut milk actually served in the shell! I've never had a better vermicelli dish? #33, Stir Fried Beef & Onions. Friendly family serving you. Vietnamese patrons. You know you're in the right place.

Have wanted to try this spot for a while and was not let down. The service was friendly and prompt and the restaurant is in a cute little house, off Glendale Ave. they were super kid-friendly as well. As for the food, we did Boba smoothies (the boba was cooked perfectly), veggie pho (really delicious broth and all the wonderful accoutrements) and a vermicelli salad. Everything was so fresh and cooked beautifully. I live in Phoenix, but will definitely be back!

I'm no expert on Vietnamese cuisine, but my first experience at Little Saigon made me want to learn more.  This place is wonderful, and you should try it next time you find yourself in Glendale.  The fun begins before you're even seated, as the restaurant is in a little old house.  The tables aren't jammed together and the artwork is eye-pleasing and relaxing.  Friend and I were impressed by the friendly, quick service.  But the food impressed us even more.  We had the potsticker appetizer, one of the best ever... not the sticky white dough typically found in a Chinese restaurant potsticker, these wraps are more like a thin French crepe, beautifully browned, filled with pork and veggies.  The dipping sauce on the side was delicious, though we also made use of the condiments provided at every table, namely fish sauce, sriracha, chili-garlic paste, and soy sauce.  We had two salads... #96, jellyfish salad with shrimp, pork, julienned  carrots and other veggies, and some herbs... and the #97, the lotus root and shrimp salad, also containing pork and julienned veggies.  Either salad could pass as a meal and we got the SMALL versions.  The flavors are off the charts on both, savory, herby, ginger, fennel, just delicious.    For entrees we got the #51, lemongrass chicken, and #55, bite size pork ribs with caramelized onions.  Both arrived at the table in clay hotpots, still bubbling, and were savory and satisfying.  We have resolved to go back to try the pho (which looked very good as we ogled our neighbors' tables) and other tempting offerings.  This place deserves the 5 stars, and your business.  You'll thank  me!
1st time here? Try a rice bowl, #50 is AMAZING. I also suggest you save room for desert, the shaved snow is FANTASTIC!

I had the experience of my employer ordering from Little Saigon for a luncheon we had scheduled.Never having had Vietnamese food I was weary but that changed. The spring rolls and soup were SO GOOD and so filling!! Look forward to trying more goodies from here in the near future.
Just moved here from San Diego and wanted to find a great place to grab pho and I have found it!!! Great place at a great price.

Took my oldest friend here  today for lunch, and got him hooked. He's lucky since he just lives about 2 blocks from this place. He had 2 pork chops shrimp with an over easy egg, a salad, and a side of veggies. I had the #64 beef and shrimp with veggies in a brown sauce. It was delicious, and just the right size for lunch. My friend took home a nice snack for later. This place will is worth the time for lunch, but get there early because it's small, and it fills up fast.

This place was quite solid and authentic! Although there was a line and pretty cold, we didn't wait too long. We tried the chicken vermicelli, beef ball pho, pork rice rolls and the hot viet coffee. Everything came quickly and was very fresh. Portions were good and the broth of the pho was great. I didn't get the typical thirsty response after I eat pho (usually a sign of too much msg).   Their hours are a bit weird but if I'm in the area again, I would come back.

The GF girl says: So I had the number 8 pho ( rice noodle with meatball) which is what I usually get at other places. I've never had meatballs that tasted like the ones at Little Saigon. They were crunchier than usual and didn't taste very appealing. They tasted like they had been frozen or bought premade. Otherwise, the soup broth and noodles were excellent.  The GF girl parent says: I had the rice paper roll appetizer with rice vermicelli shrimp, cilantro, and pork. With peanut dipping sauce-delicious. And filling.  Service was excellent.

I've been coming to Little Saigon for almost 20 years. In that time I have experienced several other Vietnamese restaurants in the valley, but consider only one the best - Little Saigon.  The place: A family run business located in a quaint, converted house that has a great vibe. Lots of warm feeling wood and decorated with traditional Vietnamese art and items. This is the only Vietnamese restaurant I have been to that cares about it's appearance as much as the food. The bathrooms are very nice and clean. Other Viet restaurants are usually found in strip malls, having all the ambience of going to the DMV.   The staff: Always friendly and attentive, especially John and his wife. John's dad is usually in the kitchen making the fantastic food that has kept me going back for years. If you ever need guidance through the extensive menu or need help on what to order, John will hook you up.  The food: Now let's talk about the best part of Little Saigon, the food. From the Pho to the Bun and clay pots, Little Saigon has it where it counts.  Fresh herbs and vegetables (nothing canned) and tender meats make it a great experience.  My personal favorite are the Bun bowls (Rice noodle salad).  The meats are marinated and gilled, having lots of flavor.  Noodles are done to perfection and the lettuce greens and herbs are always fresh.  The Pho (soups) are the perfect thing for a cool day and even in the summer. Flavorful broth with noodles, beef slices or meatballs (yes, meatballs) and more of those great herbs like mint and cilantro. Yum!  My wife is a fan of the clay pots for the slightly more intense flavors found with these meals. I enjoy them as well.  The beer I prefer to drink with my meals is the Vietnamese "33 Export" they serve. Similar to Tsing Tao, but seems to have a little more kick, ;)  If you are trying Vietnamese food for the fist time, I highly recommend Little Saigon.   You won't be disappointed and probably will get hooked like I did years ago.
This is the second time I've been here and it is amazing. The pho is on point and the potstickers are soooo good, I most definitely will be coming back again!!

Came here for dinner with a couple others. It was busy... So I thought it was a good sign.  Flavors were good... We had the brisket pho and lemon grass beef on rice.  But the portions were about 75% of our favorite place.  Perhaps they just had a bad night as it was super busy... So portions were inconsistent and a bit slow.  Might come back and try again.

My top two Vietnamese food places to go to. The broth is A M A Z I N G as well as the egg rolls. They put taro in the egg rolls which I think gives it more flavor and a different texture. Worth the 20 minute drive from my house.

This is a hidden gem! It one of those restaurants where is hard to be honest and say how great they are because you know if anyone finds out, it will be packed! The pho here was amazing, next time I will be trying another option on the menu.

Been here a handful of times, run by actual Viet people very friendly staff. The food is good! I can vouch for the pho! The lemon grass beef is probably the least favourite item I've tried. The vermecili bowl is great! Lots of food for the price. Not as cheap as other Viet locations but there isn't much for selection around Yonge and Major Mac.  They are closed on Mondays and close every nigh at 8pm. They won't even do takeout orders when it's too busy. For that they lose a star.

If you are Gui Lau stay away from this place as there is discrimination big time. Tried to go for a bun at 2pm the other day, I was by myself. They sat me down, gave me a plastic cup with tea, everyone else in restaurant had a full pot.  I ordered in less than a minute then watched 2 tables come in after me, and had to watch them both get their food before me.  And who the hell in this day and age doesn't do takeout? Never again.

We came in Friday night for dinner. There were two parties ahead of us so we passed the time by checking out the menu. Keep in mind, I hate seafood, I don't enjoy the taste, the smell, and I definitely don't like how sick it makes me. Being a Vietnamese restaurant, I knew my options were limited. I hinted to leaving but I lost that battle (thankfully).   We started off with Vegetarian Egg Rolls that were better than most places.   I had chicken Pho (7)  and my bf had a chicken dish (52)  My Pho was AMAZING. I was smiling the whole time and kept uttering, this is AMAZING. I wish he enjoyed his dish as much as I enjoyed mine.    While we were waiting another party politely asked how long it will be. He snapped and said "maybe 10 min, maybe 30, I don't know when people are leaving"  That was enough to make me want to get up and leave. I did not like how he talked to people. When he was seating us some lady gestured that she needed something and he rudely dismissed her.  Once we were seated all the staff was super friendly, but until you are actually at a table they can be quite rude.   5 for my food   2-3 for service

Walking in this place looked nice and clean. The pho was good, the broth was great, and I don't think they used MSG either! The man who served our table was really nice as well. Well, but why the 3 stars?   First, I ordered a Vietnamese iced coffee, but he told use that the ice machine was broken (what?). Okay, fine. I'll have a hot Vietnamese coffee. Shortly later, I hear them making a slushy drink (which presumably uses ice....). What the hell, I thought their ice machine was broken?  Secondly, my coffee never came. I walked up to ask him the status on it, and by that time we were already close to finishing our meal. So, I asked if I could have it to go, and they said no they don't do that...it's almost as if they just didn't want to serve me coffee.  Third, my girlfriend ordered bun (vermicelli noodles with pork). While it tasted fine, the pork was more bacon meat than BBQ pork chop type of meat. Sadly, this was her first bun experience. Although it was bacon meat, the marinade was still great and tasted as if bun BBQ meat should taste.

I absolutely love eating here for lunch! They have a lot of vegetarian options but you can always customize your dishes to make them vegan like I do. This place is very clean and cozy and has great customer service. To top it all off the food is delicious and authentic. I highly recommend it if you're in the area.
I've never been disappointed with anything I've ever ordered from there. Everything is delicious, especially  their soups and shave ice cream. The staff is really nice as well.

Love Little Saigon at Richmond Hill, ON! A small gem that many locals come for their Vietnamese meals.  Expect lineup and long wait.  My wife and I waited for about 30min on a Sat evening and the food was totally worth the time.  The waiters here are friendly and helpful.  The food is very good.  We ordered fresh rolls, beef pho and a vermicelli with grill pork.  The rolls were super fresh.  The regular size of the pho was large enough and the vermicelli - oh my! - it came with a fried spring roll and it was soooo good.  Overall the food was very good - fresh and good portion, and the price was reasonable.  Highly recommend this place.
Great spring roll! The pho wasn't great enough to make the wait worth it. Besides, pho should be quick!

I ordered to go around 11 am and definitely the food wasn't fresh at all. On top of that I found a strand of hair. It makes me lose my appetite. I guess I won't be return here again. I give 4 star for the Mixed veggies that taste pretty good and 1 star for the Pho Dac Biet ( it tastes awful).
This is a nice quite little restaurant. The people here are very courteous and friendly! The food is delicious!
I've been here a couple times and it never disappointed me.  I love the pho here.  The soup base is amazing.  Service is also great! Will definitely come back!

Wecame here for lunch. We waited about 10 minutes to be sat at a table. Spring rolls were delicious. Pho was excellent, veggies looked like they were just picked out of a garden. Lemongrass chicken was surprisingly flavorful. Even though server was busy she did a great job. We never had to ask for refills on iced teas. Jasmine tea was so good. Lunch was under $30 cheap for all we had
I have made an effort to try different things each time i go here and i love it all! The food is always amazing and the atmosphere is just great. Nice and attentive staff!

The servers here are always very friendly and knowledgeable about their food. They have a few veggie items on their menu. On my last visit I had the veggie fried rolls and the Bok Choy Ginger soup which was siprisingly tasty given it's simplicity. My boyfriend really likes their Pho Ga. *Note: the spring rolls come with warm marinated meat which I do not care for.

I went in with family who visited from out of town and we were in the mood for pho. This was my second time coming in. I ordered their meatball pho and it wasn't too convincing. Usually I like to start eating pho without any added ingredients. But it clearly needed it right away. No matter how much sauce, lime, cilantro, sprouts I added I just couldn't find the flavor. I was surprised on the reviews and ratings on this place but we really didn't like it here. The customer service was great but the pho was disappointing. I will not be back.

I think all of the positive reviews about Little Saigon actually clouded my judgement for a bit. I came back to this restaurant for a second time recently because I had forced myself to believe this place was above average due to all of its glowing reviews.  Now that I think about it, it really isn't that great - both times I came were on a Saturday afternoon, both times had a pretty lengthy wait time for a pho restaurant (~10+ minutes), and both times the food was decent but the service was meh.   So far, I've tried the house special pho, vermicelli, and deep fried spring rolls. These are all standard and popular dishes - tastes pretty good but not good enough for this place to have an above average rating on Yelp.   The service here kinda sucks. I'm not one to complain about my seating, but I seem to always end up at the smallest table for two right by the door. It's an awful seat because the door is always opening and closing, leaving you very cold in the winter, and there are always people lining up and waiting to get a table right by where you're trying to eat. I understand this may be out of their control. However, the table is so tiny that it could barely fit all of the dishes I ordered. Once the appetizers were finished, the servers didn't bother taking them away, leaving me in an uncomfortable position (when I was already pretty uncomfortable) to eat the main course. It was really difficult trying to speak up and get a server's attention to either take a plate away, ask for sauces, napkins, or the bill throughout my whole meal.  Overall, pho should be quick and easy and this place has a lot of unnecessary wait times that aren't worth waiting for. I probably won't be back.

This Vietnamese Restaurant is located in Old Town Glendale with all the cute shops. The atmosphere is really charming because this restaurant is a very old tiny cute converted house. This time I ordered the large chicken salad. I received a really big mound of fresh crispy cabbage mixed with light as air iceberg lettuce. My salad was laced with fresh herbs and white meat chicken and a fresh light limey dressing. It's a perfect meal for when your running around and it's hot outside. I thought the small salad would be too small but the large is more than I can eat. So small salad and and an appetizer or dessert is the way to go.  My husband had a pork and rice plate. It was very good and came with a fried egg and a crispy pork filled roll.   I wanted to try a macaron but our server got busy and slapped our check on the table while we were eating.   So we paid and left.
For a nice spot to grab lunch in downtown Glendale, this is one of our favorites.  Good food, and good value for what you get.

I'm pretty sure this is the place I was thinking. The last time I was here was actually my first time. And now that I've remembered this place, I really want to go back. I came here the day before my 19th birthday. I have no idea what I had but I do remember my little brother had gotten a coconut shrimp soup and OH MY GOSH was it delicious! My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  I'm so excited to go back now and try that and see what else they have. Definitely recommend this place!!
Great and close to home! Quality as good or better than any other I've been too. Like the texture of the noodles and all toppings were fresh and tasty. Beef was perfectly thin and rare.
Amazing food, amazing prices and cute atmosphere. Conveniently located in downtown Glendale. I wish they would reopen the beautiful patio!
The food here is so darn good!! I love the spring rolls and their authentic menu. Great service,  they truly make you feel like family.

I go to this place on the way home from school. Every time, I order the spicy lemon grass chicken with rice. It is really yummy. Lots of flavor and veggies which I love.  However, I dislike like how they give me only one bowl of rice. I love rice! I always order extra and the end up giving me no charge which is great. The waiters and the owner who is the main cook in the back are super nice!
Pretty good when you need close by Phó place... Good service every time I go there. Pretty fast with their food. 4 stars, not enough seating while waiting to get waited on.

I love coming here with my friend that I introduced to Vietnamese food. The staff is always pleasant and seem to appreciate your business.   The spring rolls are our favorite to begin with. It's right up there with our obsession for the Jasmine Tea. You can't go wrong with the many exciting food choices on the menu. We could try something new every time and be satisfied with the choice.  Keep up the good work!

Great place for good Vietnamese food.  We had the pork rice, beef pho and pork rice rolls.  The pork was not burnt, full of fat and tasty.   The broth for the pho was tasty and consistent with everything else the rolls were good.  The service is top notch-efficient and polite.  The premises is comfortable and clean.  Found this place based on other Yelpers good review and this did not disappoint.   Found another go-to place in RH!  Next time I will post pictures-was hungry and dug right in this time!

My favorite restaurant for Vietnamese food in the Valley. We eat a dish I cannot pronounce, that is char-grilled meat wrapped in grape leaves and served with rice papers, rice noodles, fish sauce, and veggies. You build them yourself. Sooooo delicious. The staff is real friendly. The restaurant is a converted home, and it is darling. Outdoor dining as well. It's the best
Little Saigon is the best Vietnamese food I've had in the Phoenix area.  The restaurant is family owned and the food is great.  I suggest the Rice Vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimp.

Although I have highly raved about Little Saigon, it appears that service can be hit or miss. I initially had a 5 star review rating food, environment and service. However, awhile back I visited with family during lunch time it was not at all busy and we waited approximately 15 minutes to just be greeted and seated, another 15 mins or so for someone to get to our table to greet and order drinks and again 15-20 minute wait for food and the orders for a family of (3) didn't come out at the same time. My Brother's dish was forgotten about and had to wait again another 15 minutes or so.  During our visit it was extremely SLOW.  Many other patrons were also not greeted and waited a long time. I was surprised when this had occurred with the Owners who were both working at the time and on the floor.  I am reserving my thoughts a bit on how I feel about this place. It once was a great find to quickly turn into a bad experience. A shame when I had family who visited from out of state and we drove 16+ miles to dine here because I raved about it so highly.  This particular visit was disappointing. I've been back once after this and the service and food was very good. Perhaps a VERY OFF day for them.

Love love love! Every time to drive up to the valley we always make sure to stop by and get some great food here. Love #25! Great small little place in downtown glendale. Thing I love the most on how it's tucked away from the street, it almost feels like you your pulling up to your own private hidden place.
Best pho in town. We are here on a regular basis and everything on the menu is delicious You could really feel the owner and management cares about their business and the food they serve. Cash only!
The best curry ever! We got #53, wanted to lick the bowl it was so delicious. Service awesome and super affordable.
Great local Vietnamese cuisine! The service was awesome and the food was amazing. Of course, you have to try the pho!

This place is the jam, and the boyfriend and I's go-to spot. The hours are a bit annoying, as sometimes you just miss them, but the food is great. I never really liked phô all that much before I went to this place. The rice bowls are great, the drinks are great, it's all worth writing home about  (or writing on Yelp about).
Some pretty kickin' pho! I have lived in the Bay Area and this place is on par with my favorite pho places there!

Pho was AMAZING! It's a small spot, not very fancy at all, and the menu is short and concise but everything was extremely fresh. My husband and I are huge fans of Pho and frequently seek out new spots; this is definitely going to be one of our top 3!

4.5 Star Food, 3 Star Portion size, 2 Star Service.  I've had the vermicelli salad and the fried rice, and the spring rolls.  All were typical Vietnamese fashioned food.  The wait staff, one guy and one girl is constantly busy and curt, and only basically just want to turn their tables, so if you go in asking questions don't expect any good answers or suggestions.  Size of dishes is smaller than other places, at least the vermicelli salad was, although it tastes great, as does the fried rice.

When I came in I was instantly pleased by the "fish are friends not food" sign on their aquarium. I knew this was a good sign. The patio option was closed when we were there.  I like the price and food selection ranging from pho to noodles to shark fin soup (I must try it!). With so vast a selection, I find it hard to be on point with all dishes.   I asked for a recommendation and ordered what looked like the easiest dish to make. A thin slice of pork and beef, fried rice, and a side salad. The most intriguing was the salad with delicious lightly pickled vegetables acting as a dressing. I thought the fired rice was rather bland and greatly benefited from a healthy dose of soy sauce (WARNING: not fish sauce is in smaller sized soy sauce bottle). I also tried the potstickers (highlight dipping sauce), shrimp noodle dish, and spicy chicken rice dish our company ordered. All solidly good, nothing remarkable.

Delicious, quick and well priced.  Now our go-to Vietnamese.  Everything was flavourful and fresh.   I had the rice noodle bowl with grilled pork and spring roll.  Served with the perfect amount of salad and noodles.  Lots of fresh herbs made it extra delicious. The shrimp rolls were tender and also had fresh mint and cilantro inside.  Served with a yummy dipping sauce.  It's a cash-only place.  They have a "white label" machine there in case you forget.
Just ok. The broth was tasteless and the meat in the bowl was scarce and way over priced. The staff did not carry a professional or friendly demeanor. We are now lifers at Phoenix Pho.

Had high hopes based on reviews, cute setting, but terrible service and garish lighting. The chicken pho was good, the steamed catfish was good, but extremely fishy, so if that's a problem you, beware. The waitress was abrupt, then ignored us, brought the food but no utensils, brought the bill without asking if we wanted anything else, never asked how our food was. Never made eye contact. Won't be back.

3.5  First time here was on a week night they close early after 8pm you are out of luck it wasn't busy ordered beef pho and grilled chicken spring roll vermicelli  by default the fish sauce is tad spicy so if you don't want spicy let the server know both were  a tad above average portions were good and price was good staff was friendly service was good the place is very clean I went there on the weekend second time it was like night and day literally totally totally packed waited half an hour for a table and people kept pouring in and it's was like 1:30 p.m. this time we had dac biet pho  and shrimp roll it came with a huge sauce which is nice I think I will try this place again bonus is plenty of parking in the plaza

The restaurant is clean, and friendly.  The service is good and the food is tasty as well.  I found the menu didn't have much selection, which is something I always look for when I am eating Vietnamese food.  I like a variety of different options of meat with my pho, vermicelli, or rice dishes.  Most dishes only came with just one item.  I believe they close quite early as well during the weekday, as once I came and they were already closing.  I'm usually a late dinner person, so places that close a bit later I tend to sway towards.

My husband introduced me to this place and I can't get enough of their egg rolls! I love the fresh ingredients used and the simplicity of the dishes. Yum. The servers are extremely nice and always helpful in case I need advice on something to eat! ;)  John is always a pleasure so hopefully you'll get the chance to have him serve you! But either way everyone here is wonderful!

This place has a great feel once you first walk in their door. The fish tank is really cool too! The fish seem exotic or something? Really, really neat. The place is not very big in size, which gives it that intimate dive restaurant feel. The courtyard/ patio in the front would be great for a group if you looking for a little more room.  This place is right in the heart of old town Glendale. Parking was not an issue at all when I went for lunch time. I parked in the thrift store parking then walked over. Seemed like a few others were doing the same thing as I noticed pulling up to the restaurant.   Once I got sat I noticed the menu was mostly in Vietnamese and had English translation as well. I wasn't sure what to order, as it was my very first time being here, or even to a Vietnamese restaurant for that matter. The server recommended the Pho, and a eves dropping customer also insisted that I try the Pho.   So I ordered the Beef and Shrimp Pho, along with some fresh spring rolls and  a Coors Light to drink. The Spring rolls where very different than what I was used to. They were extremely fresh wrapped in a weird film like texture of some sort. It was very delicious! The dipping sauce that comes with the rolls is perfect for the rolls. They bring out all the add in for the pho before the bowl of broth arrives. The add in consist of mint, cilantro, lemon, jalapenos, and some type of sprout root. Once I tried the Pho, I was blown away by out great it all was! It was actually really exciting and fun eating Pho since it was my first time. I can now see why everyone keeps recommending the Pho here!  What a great experience! I cannot wait to return here again.
This place has really changed! I have been going here for years, I ordered their pho and it was probably the worst I have ever tasted. Super salty and bland! Do not go here, this family is greedy.

What makes Little Saigon so special is the quality of the ingredients. The meats are lean, the veggies are fresh. I am a huge fan of Vietnamese fresh spring rolls, which are not baked or fried. Filled with rice noodles, shrimp and pork these are a refreshing starter for any meal... they can be a meal on their own! I like the bahn xeo (which reminds me of a thin fritatta filled with bean sprouts). The pho is great with all white meat chicken (and I kick it up a notch with the hot sauce and hoisen which are already on the table)! When I'm not in the mood for soup, I like to get the vermicelli dishes and have tried most of them over the course of the past two years. Satisfied every time! This is a great spot for dinner before Glendale Glitters or any of the many other festivals that take place in downtown Glendale.

Number 37.... Awesome!  Quaint place, small but inviting.  Clean and funny listening to the employees yell at each other in Vietnamese.  Decent wine and beer selection.  The pork on the 37 was AWESOME, and I'm not a huge pork fan.  Sliced thin, juicy and full of sesame ginger flavor.  Who can turn down an egg on a perfectly cooked scoop of white rice?!  The egg roll  was perfect and the shrimp....wow.  I'll be ack VERY SOON!  Wanted to try the boba but no time, I was on lunch break.
The pho was excellent. The service was very good. The place is nice and clean. It is cash only

This is my favourite pho place. Found it thanks to fellow Yelpers. Thanks!!  It's a smaller restaurant that seats around 40 people max. Cash only.   Service is friendly and is run by Vietnamese.   It is one of the cleanest pho places I've been to and I've been to quite a few across the GTA.  The bathroom is really well maintained.   On to the food:  The broth is sweet and really delicious.  I don't normally drink a lot of the soup but I can't stop at this place.  I usually order their large special which is $9.50 and is a big bowl of noodles.   We've also tried the Tom yum soup noodles which are good.   Their spring rolls are crisp from the deep fryer and go well as an appetizer or as part of a Vermicelli dish.   Overall I highly recommend. Just remember to bring cash. They do have an ATM though.

My wife and I have been in Glendale for close to 6 months now. This is the only restaurant I think is worth mentioning so far. They are way above everything else we've tried; in fact, they deserve to be in an entirely new category.  I would strongly recommend this place. Don't waste your money eating junk out of restaurants that are just tossing the same old garbage at you.   This is different and very good.  We had several appetizers, a couple main dishes, 2 beers and 2 glasses of plum wine and with a tip, got out of there for just under $50. If the awesome food doesn't convince you, maybe the cost will!  ;)
Excellent Vietnamese food. Try the fresh coconut milk too!

Its sadly a one star rating. Been coming for years but haven't been back in at least 8 months. Im giving this rating in hopes that they make changes.   First, very dirty and cluttered.   The outside area has seats but has never allowed seating because they are too lazy to clean it.   Bathroom looks like your 75 yr old aunties house..you know the one..and soap is watered down to literally water.  Needs a major update and cleaning.   I ordered the pho soup, as I always have. Meat was very rough and not fresh. The meatballs had a strange taste and the broth tasted light like water.   Hope the place improves.

I found my new favorite Vietnamese spot.  Its cute, quaint and located in historic downtown Glendale.  Lots of businesses located in downtown Glendale are in charming historic homes.  The front patio had several plants and vines on the white picket fence gave the a feel of entering a secret garden.  Once your inside you can tell this was a home at one point, wood floors throughout.   The hostess has you sign in.   After a short wait we were taken to our table.  Our drink orders were immediately taken.  I got some hot jasmine tea and lemonade and my daughter cold jasmine iced tea.  My hot tea was brought out in a cute porcelean tea pot and tea cup.    We then placed our food orders.  We got veggie egg rolls, chicken fried rice and rice noodles with chicken and veggies.  The egg rolls came out first and oh my holy egg rolls were they good.  Fresh lettuce, cilantro, cucumber, basil and jicama to roll up your egg roll and then sweet fish sauce to dip.  Soo good.  Fried rice tasted like actually fried rice.  The noodle stir fry was also amazing.   This is a nice little hideaway to sneak away and enjoy great food.  After you eat you can also enjoy all the antique shops in Downtown Glendale.  Perfect Sunday date with my daughter!

What's not to love about this place?  The veggies are so crisp and delicious, they make me want to find the source and buy some for home.  I'm not going to pretend to be an expert in the cuisine but everything I've tried here is absolutely delicious and I can't pronounce any of it.   The outside of the restaurant is adorable and kind of romantic and the inside is unassuming and seemingly clean.  I think it's very reasonably priced for such fresh and flavorful food.

Very very good food! I am very particular about my Asian cuisine and this place is awesome- fresh, flavorful and satisfying! I had the spring rolls and then the spicy chicken stir-fry. So good and the vegetables were perfectly cooked! Great service as well- very friendly. Can't wait to come again and try another dish!

This place was a pleasant discovery made via Yelp. Sort of a treasure in the seemingly deserted downtown Glendale, this place must've been a home at one time and is now a cool little spot with some amazing Vietnamese food. The boba tea smoothie (taro) is one of the best I've come across in the valley. Our group was very satisfied after our first visit and we all agreed that we'll be returning again.

This little hole in the wall exceeded my expectations. So far every dish we had satisfied my taste buds except that some were a bit oily. The shrimp salad and the pho(sliced beef) were delicious. The crepe is a must try!

Great little place. We always wanted to try it and finally had the chance. We have gone to many Pho places around the valley and this one definitely ranks up there. Very fresh and the place is spotless. The number 11 is definitely a hit. The number 26 was a bit small on portion but not on taste. The drinks we had were Taro Boba, Thai Tea Boba, and Vietnamese IceCoffee which my wife says is too strong but I totally enjoyed it. Come check them out but be prepared to wait.

I want to remember so hard what number each meal I've tried are but I can't. So I'll just kinda explain.  First time I ordered Jasmine Tea and their crispy noodles I want to say #26. Loved the crunchy noodles!!!! I added some of the chili paste they have on the table just because I love it, but really it doesn't need anything else. The veggies were on point and although it didn't have many pieces of chicken I had so much fun enjoying the noodles I forgot their was supposed to be chicken on my plate. Haha!  My husband ordered a plate that had shrimp and chicken with a salad and rice. The rice is perfectly done and the chicken tasted good. You could taste the coconut oil which to me tastes amazing.  On a different ocasión I had the spicy chicken with lemon grass. When it came out it was served in a plate that was sizzling hot which means it will stay hot for a while since I talk to much. You can taste the lemon grass and whatever else they add to this. They bring some steamed rice for you and you can either pour the chicken on the rice or add the rice to the plate. I mean you can eat it however you want the outcome is the same! DELISH!  I ordered a limeade which on the menu it specifically says they make it there. It's good!  Haven't tried the rest of their stuff and will definitely go back to try different numbers on their menu!  Let me add it's not expensive either! Ha! Who doesn't like delicious food for a fair price! This girl!!!  Enjoy! Don't be scared to check it out!

My husband really wanted to eat here because of all the good reviews, but it was disappointing we order grilled chicken and shrimp with fried rice. The chicken wasn't clean nor cooked properly the shrimp was dry, the rice was ok but to little of it, we all left our dinner.Sorry but I wouldn't go back

Just a great Vietnamese place in Glendale. Had spring rolls, pho, beef in xo sauce, shrimp in curry sauce, calamari and the beef/ shrimp combo and they were all winners. The service was great and were treated like family!!

Possibly the best Vietnamese in the valley, and definitely my favorite west of I-17.  Charming little place in a small house, right in the middle of downtown Glendale.  I've been here a few times and never had a bad dish.  Usually I go with pho or a noodle dish, but this time we branched out.   I got the #37 pork tenderloin with shrimp and egg - a delicious, thin marinated pork chop that was simple yet satisfying.  My wife got #56, which is a spare rib with a sweet and salty sauce, baked and served in a clay pot.  The dish is very flavorful and probably best shared between two people while paired with a less savory second dish to even out the palate.  I see a few complaints about the service - it's never been a problem for me, though they did recently stop taking Amex cards so no luck burning my recently received gift card...

What a little Asian gem among these parts. I didn't have much of a chance to try different pho joints back in Illinois, and I imagine there aren't too many here. But nonetheless, Little Saigon has great pho. We had the beef pho; broth was flavorful, and the option to put in as many or little veggies as you want was nice. My boyfriend said the combination fried rice was possibly the best he ever had. We had enough leftovers for two more meals.

Food was great, service was great.  Environment was very good, bathroom was clean. Had the banh khot for appetizer which was very good.  The mi` ddac biet main course was great.  The chuoi chien for desert was excellent.

Took us a while to finally make it here, but I'm glad we did- it was a treat! This place is tucked into a side street in downtown Glendale and I'm sort of sad that it took us so many years to get here. Service was fast and friendly even though there was a pretty steady stream of people coming in.   The food was all delicious. I had beef pho, and hubs had some sort of roll your own spring roll thing. This was some of the best pho I've had here, and I've tried more than a few. The broth actually had enough flavor that I almost didn't have to add the extra garnish, but of course I did anyways. It was salty, tangy, and just a little bit sweet. The beef was cut up into manageable pieces and there were tons of rice noodles. We had spring rolls and a strawberry boba smoothie that were equally good. While this place was a dollar or so more per plate than Da Vang, it was closer and the food was better.

My second try with Pho. I love it!  I had the beef and meatball. The broth was hot and flavorful. With a little hoisin and some soy sauce added took it up to the next level. I dropped in a good handful of fresh bean sprouts. My only thing I would say I put some whole cilantro and mistakenly thought I could chew it and swallow. Next time I will strip the leaves. The stem got stuck in my mouth. One meatball had a large piece of grizzle but the meatball itself was finely ground with great spices. Those little things didn't bother me. The price is right. This little place you could almost miss when driving on 57th Avenue is super clean and has very efficient and friendly staff.  I will definitely try not again on one of their other dishes.

LOVE this place! Very cute shabby little home turned restaurant that has plum wine and great noodles..what more is there to say!? I have had the hot pot, lemongrass soup and Pho on my visits here and was alwasy pleased. They also offered Macaroons on one trip there which I felt was strange but enjoyed every last bit of them.

This is a bright gem in downtown Glendale.   The food is excellent and the service was great.  I highly recommend this restaurant and look forward to returning again soon.  One piece of advice --- do your homework on-line.  The menu is extensive and can be overwhelming once you sit down.  I had made my selection ahead of time using their website menu (I ordered #2 and #56 - HIGHLY RECOMMEND both) and by reading Yelp reviews.    The only negative thing I have to say is that the noise level was HORRIBLE in the 'banquet room' where we (group of 14) were seated.  I will never go back to Little Saigon in a large group as it was difficult to hear what the person sitting next to me was saying.  The noise seemed to bounce off the walls.  Also, be aware that if you are in a party of six or more they do not split the check and will not take more than one credit card.  Another reason to go in a party of 1 or 2.    Overall --- FIVE STARS

I always love coming to Little Saigon! The food is always fresh and delicious! The staff is always friendly and helpful! I am working through the menu, and so far #81 and the fried bananas are my favorites!! It is always clean, and the best part is that it is family run. It is located in downtown Glendale, so after a phenomenal meal, you can always walk it off afterwards.

Went to lunch here over a weekend and what a cute spot in downtown Glendale. The restaurant had a lot of charm since it was originally a single family house. Service was very attentive and friendly. Prices were also reasonable. We had entrees including Egg Noodle  Soup (Mi), Tofu Lemon Grass Hot Pot and Tofu Vegetable Curry. All were really great. They also had a cute patio out in front that I'd imagine at night would be pretty with the more residential street, trees and lights. Great place that we would return to again!

Wonderful food. Great staff. Nice to families with small children. The VIET ICED COFFEE is so good. I went in sick with a head cold and feeling like I was done for 2 or 3 days. The waitress told me that a big bowl of PHO would make me feel better. A big bowl of Viet style Chicken Noodle Soup and lots of tea and I felt human again. I bought another portion to take away. Tastier than any cold medicine. The food here is better when You are healthy and You can taste it. Enjoy

Our favorite Vietnamese food in AZ. The Pho is huge, flavorful, full of noodles and delishisness. The curry is perfect. The right amount of onions, carrots, potatoes and Chicken. It's so good you can drink it. The spring rolls are a favorite of my wife and they are not fried, yummy and healthy. The ambience is local and fun. A must try for those who love asian cuisine.

The hubby and I had a yummy lunch on our "day date" today.  I had the 37 (pork, shrimp, fried egg on the perfect white rice) the Hubby had the 47 (steak, bells, onions, rice) we also shared the potstickers app.  I like the iced tea a lot. Very mild green tea.  The app was my favorite part, very good! I loved the fried egg on the rice, and really, the rice was the example of what perfect rice is. The pork chop was very yummy. I tried the Hubby's steak and it was very good, and I love the deep caramel onions, wish there were more.  I wasn't blown away with the salad and sauce, Saigon Kitchen set that bar high for me.  I very much look forward to coming back, trying other things on the menu, like Pho in the winter :) oh yeah.

Dear gods I love this place. I am sitting here right now writing this review daydreaming about the spring rolls.  As for the pho, I have heard from many reliable sources how delicious it is. I put too much cilantro in mine the first time, but even so it was pretty good. Just uh...make sure you go with someone that knows how to eat pho, because I did not and that's why I messed up. Make sure to put the meat, bean sprouts, and noodles in first. Everything else is up to your own liking.   Now this place is a 40 minute drive for me during rush hour, which should show my devotion. The staff were friendly, the food was ready when I got there. Just be prepared for there to be a lot of old asshole customers. You know the kind. Snow birds. But if you tell them to fuck off, you'll have evening entertainment too.   Now excuse me while I go daydream about the spring rolls more.

I have tried 5 different Vietnamese restaurants in the recent past.  This one stands out in my mind as the best of them.  And none of them had any reason not to go back.  For one thing the setting in the old house is great.  And it has a shaded patio out front.  I had a chicken dish with rice which came to my table still at a full boil.  I would have liked to try the egg rolls but 6 in an order would have been a full meal in itself.  The party next to me had an order of spring rolls and egg rolls and their comments were good.  I went in the middle of lunch on a Friday and it was almost at capacity but I was seated right away and there was some delay (maybe 5 minutes) in taking my order but the food came out in a normal time.  As in many Asian restaurants it is a family operation with the son of the owners being my waiter.  Being just over a mile from work I will be back again.    Parking in downtown Glendale can be a hassle at times, less than a block away on the NE corner of 57th Ave. and Glenn Dr is a lot that only gets full during special events. In fact the downtown area is small enough I would park there to go almost anywhere in the area, but I don't mind walking.

I love little Saigon. Super clean, super friendly, great service and the food is delicious and cheap.   The pot stickers are stuffed to the seam with shredded (not minced) pork and are seared and steamed perfectly.  I usually go for the Pho but will switch up for the beef and shrimp rice vermicelli every other visit. I always want Pho tho.  I've never left disappointed. I think I'm a regular now.  Another nice to know is that most of the cafés, restaurants and coffee shops have their own mini version (not as artsy and far from crowded) of First Friday activity. Little Saigon sits in the hub (if you will) of all things cool in DT Glendale. Alley way karaoke seems to be a common attraction. Most of the boutiques and antique shops do close up early so the most you will get is some interesting window shopping.  Fill yer flask, take a stroll.

Went on a Sunday afternoon with my brother since we were near downtown Glendale.  It is slightly hidden, but if you have Yelp you will FIND it.   =)  It is a house converted to a restaurant, so it is pretty small.    I ordered #1 Cha Gio:  Deep-fried egg rolls filled with ground pork.  Dip those yummies in the sweet fish sauce, I am gravy!  These were good, but I still preferred the "normal" size egg rolls.  Then I got #8 Pho Ga: rice noodle soup with shredded chicken.  The soup base is pretty good, plenty of noodles and cooked to the right texture, and the shredded chicken not fatty so excellent.  I also ordered the soy bean milk.    All in all I like the place and the food, but it is on the pricey side for Vietnamese food compared to other places.  Oh the service there is great.  The two servers were like basketball players.  In sync and great teamwork to make the customers happy.

What's up with all the 1 star reviews?  Perhaps high maintenance reviewers?  This place is a solid 5 star experience.  Have eaten lunch there almost a dozen times.  The food is traditional Vietnamese.  By far the best in the Valley.  And if you've ever visted Vietnam you'd probably appreciate this place even more.   Only wish it wasn't a 40 minute drive!

The trek from Ahwatukee to Glendale is loooong, but luckily I have family in these parts, so we come here often.  Hands down, the best Vietnamese food I've had in the valley, no contest.  The place is a very small converted house, and truly, because of the size, you feel as if you are there for a friend's homecooking rather than at a fancy restaurant.  So small in fact, that if you have a large party (which they can absolutely accommodate, by the way) you should call ahead.  I know some people call this a pho restaurant (and the pho is good - not the best I've ever had, but good) but really, it is absolutely a Vietnamese restaurant first and foremost.  Given the extensive menu with a long list of homestyle dishes, pho doesn't take a backseat, but it's certainly not the star of the show.  The one thing that I love about Little Saigon is that every dish comes with copious condiments.  Cha gio (crispy spring rolls) come with mounds of lettuce, cilantro, mint, carrots and daikon with bright nuoc mam (fish sauce) for dipping.  All of the soups include cilantro, mint, basil, bean sprouts, jalapeno and lime - I will instantly dock points if I'm having pho and I don't get all of the above.  Plus, crazy good dishes like the Curry Catfish with Black Pepper Sauce (served on a sizzling plate for two) come with rice and lettuce for wrapping as well.  Favorites of mine are the Summer Rolls with tasty shrimp and bits of grilled beef, Bun with Grilled Pork, the Pho with Meatballs and the Caramelized Catfish.  Even the fried rice that my husband always gets is savory goodness.  One important thing to note, though the waiters are perennially friendly and bustling, and the owner/chef is fabulous, this is not the place to make special recommendations or changes to the dishes.  If you are a fussy eater or want things your way, 9 times out of 10, you will not win that battle.  We've been coming here a while, and have seen some interesting antics between the kitchen and the dining room.  Just order and enjoy, the food truly is so good, you shouldn't have to make special requests as it is.  Very very worth the trip to Glendale.  I'm jealous of you guys, west side!

This is such a wonderful and cute little joint to eat at. Service is perfect and the owners are the best. They always make us feel welcome and make sure we are happy and satisfied. Of all the pho places near by this is by far my favorite. Have never had a bad experience !

Some of the best pho I've had! The broth is super tasty. Everyone that works there is very friendly and welcoming. They made sure our drinks stayed full the entire time we were there. I got pho with chicken broth and shrimp, my husband got shredded chicken. Both were great. For desert we tried their shaved ice. I ordered it with coconut ice, chopped mango and strawberry and condensed milk on top. Everything delicious and fresh. The restaurant itself is very cute and inviting. Recommend!

Downtown Glenedale, who knew?! An adorable cottage houses the best Vietnamese restaurant in North Phoenix, if not all of Phoenix! Family owned and run, you feel more and more like part of the family with each visit. They have a foundation of loyal customers built on word of mouth.  An extensive menu of usual  Vietnamese dishes. and though they have fab pho, my favorite dish is the barbecued fish (off the menu)- hand delivered on a steaming platter by Dad himself! One of these is enough for 2. Wash it down with a '33' beer and take a leisurely stroll through downtown Glendale.

Excellent experience all the way around. .  Food was excellebt, hot and fresh, homemade noodles...you could make an entire meal out of the potstickers... pleasant environment and staff, very accommodating
Wow, this was well worth the drive from Glendale. Everything was super clean and food was top notch. They cooked my egg and pork chop perfectly. Reminded me of home food. The drinks are super yummy!

My FAVORITE Vietnamese place in the whole world. A true hidden gem. Great service. Amazing food. I always get the same thing-bo cuon la nho (beef stuffed grape leaves). Not many places offer this dish. This order is fun because you get to build your own spring rolls. I drive all the way from south Phoenix to come to this restaurant, and it's 100% worth it every time.

If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese pho, you best skip this place. Otherwise, the food is decent. It's a bit on the pricey side. The only size they have is the large bowl and that comes to about $8. I only come here when invited by friends, but there are better choices for pho out there.

This place is a small place but the food is really good. But most of the time they are busy and the parking is bad especially if there's alot of people.   The food is really good especially the fried rice and the soup was really yummy as well.
