I would recommend people to come here even just to try if you love vitnames food this is the 1 place I would go and try if you are in the glendale area and the souranding is really nice if you like to walk around after you eat because for sure your going to be very full so a walk is needed which a plus because this place has a great place to walk around.  I recommend you also try there desert. Most of the time I come here I always try to make room for the desert. It's really good and it just melts into your mouth.

Wonderful neighborhood spot. The food was superb and service excellent. We enjoyed a grilled chicken vermicelli salad, stir fried vegetables, pork ribs and onions, and a make-your-own spring roll meal (#79). If I lived nearby I'd be here all the time.
Best pho in phx area. Tried the limited time oxtail pho... man it's tasted delicious. Meat was perfectly tender, flavorful broth. Lady's were very friendly and welcoming. Will be back.
Lived close to this restaurant for years and never thought to stop until my bestie had me stop in. SO GLAD that she referred me. Very yummy, family owned.   Makes me want to go there now :-)

This is the BEST Vietnamese restaurant that I have been to in Phoenix by far and consistent. This is my girlfriends favorite spot to eat she would rather come here then go to an expensive meal any day. I highly recommend giving this place a shot.

During winter time I sometimes like to get away from chaos and for some reason having pho soup alone while reading a good book is the most satisfying feeling ever.   I stumbled upon this cute little vietnamese joint in Richmond Hill,and after living in the Hills for the past 3 years, I'm surprised I never came here before.   I had the Pho with beef brisket (M)- 7.00  It was piping hot and quite flavourful. I really enjoyed the dish and the noodles to beef ratio was perfect.   dinging off one star as the service was a bit choppy (missing napkins at the table, tea came during the meal... but meh... it was good overall)   Will definitely be back to try the other items on the menu.   btw. CASH ONLY

Everything is so delicious and authentic here. Maybe slightly more expensive than the others but definitely worth every penny of it. Friendly staff and great service too. The only down side is you have to prepare to wait (most of the time).... but that's when you know the food is good right?

Visited again with our friends and food was just as good as before.  Fresh, quick and ample dishes.  Spring rolls were delicious as were #33 and #35; bun (noodle)dishes with meat of your choice, cukes, bean sprouts, shrimp., lettuce and tangy sweet fish sauce to pour over the noodles.  Add some Sriracha and eat!  Pleasant service and excellent prices.

Short version - they don't care about their customers!   I tried to dine here on three separate occasions knowing the food is most likely still good. But this third time (and last) has completely turned me off this place entirely.  They're generally pretty busy, give out numbers to be fair to customers waiting.  On two of the three occasions, I have seen empty tables not occupied just left empty and at the same time people piling up at the door waiting for their number to be called. The most frustrating part, is people walking in, seeing others waiting, spotting the empty table and just taking it - literally by passing the number system. The waiters have even seen this and said nothing to enforce their own number system, nor defending the people already waiting and actually giving them a menu and tea. I've seen this happen twice now.  If you're going to put a system in place to be fair to your customers (first come-first serve system) you should abide by it and enforce it. I'm severely disappointed that they didn't say or do anything and will not ever be dining here again.  Before the only issue was slow service (which probably created the wait) but pretending to turn a blind eye to someone jumping the line (for a system you put into place) is stupid and tells me you don't actually care about your customers getting fair treatment.

I have pho at least once or twice a week. This is hands down my favourite Vietnamese place in all of GTA. If you like your soup to be full of MSG and fat, this might not be the right place for you. The pho broth is fresh and you can tell it takes time to make.  Everything from their pho, to tom soup, to spring rolls, is made with precision and care.   The only thing I hate about Little Saigon is that it isn't open 24/7.

This place is pretty legit.   It is small and clean, and the staff are friendly.  I haven't had their pho yet, but I will soon enough cause I'll definitely be back. But I had their pork and spring roll vermicelli - take out no less. Everything was packed up nice and neat, fish sauce in its own container, and toppings neatly placed in its own area (I don't really like cilantro so I tend to pick it out if I forget to tell them), and thankfully it wasn't mixed into everything else.   The pork was seasoned and cooked nice, not dry. And the spring rolls were still very crispy when I ate it. A+!  The only bad thing about this place is they are cash only. They do have an ATM in the back of the store, but come on!

We've been to Vietnam many times and have tried all the famous and not so famous places for Pho and this place is honestly the closest you can get in Toronto. It's definitely better than the two famous places on Ossington.   We've been coming since they opened when they used to offer 10% off to bring in business to now where you go wait a long time to get seated if you don't come when they open because the cats out of the bag on how good it is. They are so busy that they don't even allow takeout on Friday and Saturday nights.  Large Beef Ball and Flank Pho ($9.00) The Pho here is fantastic and always leaves you wanting more. The soup is not oily, doesn't make you thirsty and has this nice sweet taste to it that makes you crave it once you are done your bowl. The beef balls are the ones made with tendon and are super bouncy and the flank is high quality and has a nice amount of fat.   The fried spring rolls are 2 for $4.50 and are absolutely delicious as well. How good are they you might ask? So good that I forgot to take a picture of them before we devoured them. The spring rolls use the thicker wrappers that are crunchy and have a lot of meat and filling inside.  My only wish for this place would be for them to open up a bigger restaurant so we wouldn't have to wait so long for tables but the fear with that is that the quality would go down with more tables to serve.  Since we come back regularly, I remembered to take a photo of the spring rolls and the fresh summer rolls.  Fresh Summer Rolls (2 for $4.50) The rolls here are freshly made and all the ingredients are of high quality. The dipping sauce is absolutely delicious and brings together all the ingredients. Definitely a must order when you aren't feeling for the fried spring rolls.

This is my absolute FAVORITE pho place! The pho is about $7, and the serving size is perfect for either lunch or dinner.  You don't get skimped on the veggies or noodles.  That's for sure. :) Every time that I've eaten there, I've had stellar service as well. Helpful hint: go on a Sunday at like 1 or 1:30. The restaurant is tiny, maybe like 25 tables or so (not counting the small patio area outside); so, it fills up fast.  Make a night or afternoon of it! Since it's in the middle of downtown Glendale, you're surrounded by cute antique shops.  Check it out! You WON'T be disappointed.

The food here was amazing.  We ordered it to go, It was ready when we got there, Came with extra sauces, Along with tons of additional produce.  Great service as well.  Overall a great place and delicious food.

Excellent food, service, cleanliness, and price. Will definitely tell my friends and return soon. Herbs are super fresh, and Pho's soup base is clear and tasty. Best Vietnamese place in town for sure!

"Authentic food with great flavour and value. Just remember to bring cash. "  This was a spot I found when I did the ol "pho near me" search on the yelp app. This place came up with great reviews.  Atmosphere  Very casual, small place, but enough tables to host you if you were shopping at T&T or Hillcrest mall and wanted some Vietnamese.  Food  The Pho is simple, yet flavourful. Good clear broth with no MSG-like flavour. Lots of meat in the house special pho. Good sizing too  Value  Under $10 for each menu item. Would be happy to go here again, but they have a sign up front and it's very clear, cash only. So make sure you have cash. They do have an ATM but I mean...come on right? That's why I'm giving this 4/5. Otherwise food is great.

Rushed to the 5:30pm opening, and the restaurant was already full...  we took a number and spent some time at T&T for 30 min before returning to the restaurant.  We ordered a pho (must), rolls with pork (yum) and a vermicelli (omg it's good).  Amazing good, great service, always worth the wait.
Best Viet food in the area, highly recommend the Satay Shrimp Noodle in soup and on the side note, the owner is unbelievably friendly.

I really enjoyed Little Saigon. I stumbled upon it while looking for a Vietnamese restaurant that wasn't a chain such as 88 of Train.   We had their vermicelli with lemon grass beef and pho. We were a little disappointed they didn't offer fresh noodles  for the pho like some Vietnamese restaurants, but the broth made up for it! It was very flavourful! The vermicelli was also great, however the fish sauce could use a little more tang.

Not one of best but simply the best Pho in Richmond Hill. Not a big selection Pho restaurant but everything looks enticing. We love their noodle soup, vermicelli, rice & meat plate, spring rolls. I also love the Seafood Tom Yin noodle!
[ALERT] they take Cash only. There is an ATM machine in the store but there is surcharge on top of the amount you withdraw. Please bring cash.

I met my 3 friends here for lunch.  None of us had ever had Vietnamese food, so we asked our server what he recommended.  We all tried different suggestions off the menu and they were all delicious!  The service was superb and everyone was very kind and friendly, asking us every ten minutes or so if we needed anything.  I highly recommend this wonderful place and we all agreed to come back again soon!

I had pho. It was thin, very tasty, but a little too salty, but there was way more meat than most Vietnamese restaurants. The service was very friendly and efficient. The price was reasonable - $9 for a large bowl. I would go back if I was in the area and was craving a nice, hot bowl of pho.

lemongrass chicken in sizzling pot -  a total variation of lemongrass chicken  that i've never tried before.   it came in a sauce that was pretty thin, like soup  but was SO flavorful and spicy.   it was perfect to mix with rice.   a solid 5/5 and my absolute favorite thing here  catfish dish (1st on the seafood item list) -  sweet, slightly spicy, the sauce was almost like a glaze also fantastic just .00000000001 behind the lemongrass chicken

I discovered this place shortly after moving to Glendale and in need of my pho fix. I first tried their pho tai which I wasn't very impressed with. I didn't give up on them though I went back and tried their pho Dac Biet (special pho) and was very impressed. It's my favorite place to get pho Dac Biet in this area. Not only are the portions big the quality of meats is awesome (except for the meatball that goes in, worst meatball ever lol but I don't care much for that), never over cooked and the noodles are always just right. I have also had their pot stickers, egg rolls, and bun thit (vermicelli bowls), all very good.  Don't forget to try their lotus root salad, it's SUPER yummy!

I truly wanted to love this place! I had the shrimp/pork spring rolls and shrimp/chicken vermicelli salad - both were quite good, with the exception of the rice paper and noodles tasting like they were rehydrated with unfiltered tap water (both had a weird taste). My husband's food, on the other hand, was terrible! He ordered #44 - the rice was extremely dry and chewy, the pork chop tasted ok, but was mostly bone and gristle, and the shredded pork was downright disgusting.

Excellent food at a low price. Finally, a Vietnamese restaurant where the Asian staff speaks English. You can ask a question, and get an answer without a puzzled look, pause, and a smile. A perfect place to expand your experience with Vietnamese food beyond phó.
Absolutely loved the food and excellent overall experience. Very friendly staff. Warm and clean decor. Will certainly be back to try more from the menu.
Found this little gem while searching all over for a good place to eat that wasn't a chain. This place did not disappoint me. Everyone was very friendly and the service was great.

We have been here since they opened a few years ago. Food is always good. We usually order the rare beef pho, vermicelli with grilled chicken and springrolls, or lemongrass pork with rice. It is a small restaurant so can get busy during peak hours.
Very good, very fresh!! Was my first visit got pot stickers and beef and shrimp vermicelli, was delicious!!!

Came here completely randomly looking for a light lunch. This was my first experience having pho and it definitely won't be my last. First impression was how clean and neat this place is. We were quickly seated in a nice little booth. Our server, (wish I had gotten his name) was so incredibly sweet and accommodating. When I told him it was my first experience he actually took the time to explain everything off the menu.   Next, we shared the spring rolls (which were to die for!), spicy beef satay pho and a chicken vermicelli, which was all delicious. For next time, I think I will stay with the regular pho instead of the spicy satay. Although it was tasty, not a huge fan of star anise spice, but don't shy away if you are looking for bold flavours!   All in all, food was good and inexpensive, plus the service was really friendly! Will be back!

Got here at 630 pm they close at 7 pm. This place always closes early. Heads up and call ahead. I ate here once before and it is very good. However they close whenever they feel like it. When we got here the sign said closed before we even entered the place. Thank god there is other Asian restaurants that stick to there hours of schedule.

Finally an evening when my schedule allowed a visit before their closing time. I normally don't make an effort to visit places which close so early but following many satisfied Yelpers including some of my favorite reviewers I was curious to give it a try and was rewarded with a rare  lineup-free immediate seating.  Noticed a difference from the typical "pho place" in that Little Saigon is a nice looking and welcoming space to be in. Obviously done on a much smaller budget than newer shops like Pho XIn Chao & The Pho, but with good taste & common sense. The tiny dinning room is very well utilized not to feel cramped even though it's not much bigger than a doctor's  waiting room. Seems to be a family & friends operation, all males, the servers were very courteous and there was a sense of pride and caring about the restaurant (although getting the bill took longer than seemed necessary)   Only two size choices for Pho. I went with the smaller one for $9 with Rare Beef & Tendon, it was comparable to the middle option of places that offer three sizes.  The Beef slices were about average in quantity & quality, sliced thin enough to quickly finish cooking in the  soup to my comfort level. The amount of Tendon was a little more generous than usual, and the chunks were on the firmer side.   Broth was of the "cleaner" variety with very minimal oil separation, the color leaned toward a brownish hue (as opposed to greenish).  It smelled like it would be an interesting multi-dimensional broth, but the taste seemed a bit light on seasoning - though by no means bland or weak, it had a strong "beefy" character which was satisfying, just in different way than I expected. In my little mixing bowl I tried it with both the Sriracha and the sweet sauce, it definitely paired better with Sriracha, although I chose to eat most of it straight up.  Overall very enjoyable. While it doesn't interrupt  my search for a Pho that blows me away, I wouldn't hesitate to get it again if I ever find myself here on time. I also hope to try the pancake and a very generous looking porkchops/fried eggs & rice combo I saw in the menu.

One of our favorite places to go to in Glendale! The Pho is the best in town, and the veggie egg roles are to die for! I love this place because it's authentic, has great customer service and always has the freshest Vietnamese in town! I also opt in for the Snoh dessert- we like the strawberry snoh with fresh mango and condensed milk THE BOMB! I suggest this place for the best viet in town!
Me and family absolutely love this place, they are always super nice and keep up with us their service is outstanding
This resturant is one of my favorites in the valley. Their pho is the best. Great customer services and wonderful place to bring friends and family.
I ate beef with rice noodle in soup this noontime, taste good and no MSG found! Will visit this restaurant again!
I am a Pho fan amongst soup fans. I eat Pho 3-4 times a month in SD and PHX. This is quality pho. #9 will do you solid. The staff is friendly. Good pho'ing!

Not sure why I forgot about this place and I haven't been there for over 8 years. It's definitely cool place with nice atmosphere and super polite waiters, even if you are rude, grumpy character they would still probably be nice to you! I haven't tried much there but what I did try was delicious and fresh, I'm going there today again to explore more stuff and have my Vietnamese coffee (I strongly recommend people who drink espresso ) to try it, it will be mixed with condensed milks so no sugar needed. Also if you are super legal person and care about taxes etc you should avoid this place since they accept only cash.
Always a great and delicious meal aling with good service! Been coming for years and never disappointed!

Vietnamese restaurants are not traditionally known for their ambiance, but this one really made me feel at home. Although some of the tables are pretty close to each other, it is a very comfortable environment. The dining experience was much nicer than I expected! My favorite Vietnamese dish is the vermicelli bowl with pork, and I also always get spring rolls. The meal here was one very good. It didn't meet up to my all-time favorite (Pho Tau Bay in New Orleans) and I think Da Vang makes it slightly better, but it was very good. The spring rolls were much better than those at the other places I've tried. (Sidenote: Really, how hard is it to make these? How can places like Saigon Nites and Cyclo not make them as good as me? And I'm a Cajun that learned by reading the back of a spring roll wrapper container!) My companion thoroughly enjoyed the boba tea; I didn't think it was worth the money, as it was only so-so. I did enjoy a good Vietnamese beer, but I don't remember what kind it was. Other than the beverages, the prices were reasonable. As mentioned by others, it's hard to find a place to park, but it's definitely a great place to eat (quality and price) if you are in downtown Glendale.

The food is average there but the owner and the waitress were awful. I have been going there since I moved to AZ, three years ago. I always go there with my family, a group of four, and always tip them more than 18%. Last week I had family visiting us and I brought them there for lunch, since we had 13 people, the waitress told us that it was required to add 18% gratuity to the bill, which was fine for us, but they didn't have a table to sit all of us. Instead they separated us among three tables and told us that we couldn't split the bill. One table of my family didn't know that there would be 18% gratuity added and was trying to find out the reasoning from the waitress and the waitress started yelling at my family and the owner came out from the kitchen screaming that "This is our policy"! In my opinion, even if this is a policy that the customers should follow, the owner and waitress could have informed us in a polite manner. They should not expect their customers to return if they were treated in a way of unsatisfactory. One should know that there are more than just that one Vietnamese restaurant in Arizona.
Went for the first time yesterday, got #38. Food was  very good and tasty. Service was great. We will definitely go back soon.

"It's like eating in my own home, except that I get to charge you," said one of the operators.   Enough said. Stop reading and savor the delicious life. (Apparently everyone in the Civic Center already knows about it.)

i drove by that area many times.. and i always thought it was someone's home.. =  ) food is great.. been going there since 2007..  spring roll is great.. peanut sauce.. mmmm...  i usually get ice coffee,  spring roll, and garlic shrimp..  i have tried almost everything on their menu..  few are good.. few are.. so so..   family owned place..  servers are great! love the older man who cooks in the kitchen.. i believe he is the main owner, and his son and wife are the servers..  they are awesome..    i love it when cook gets upset and start yelling!! it is like dinner and show!! =  )    if you like tofu.. try their glazed onion tofu.. it is crispy outside.. and soft inside.. man.. now i am getting hungry!!!  price is fair.. food is awesome.. great service.. perfect winning combo!!

I've sat and dined here along with take out numerous of times. Take out tastes just as great as dining in.  This restaurant serves authentic Vietnamese style food at its finest. The food is just wonderful. They serve the best Pho I've ever tried, ever.

Coming to Arizona twice from California, we have tried many eateries in this  Phoenix surroundings.  Tonight our family of five decided to eat at Little Saigon and it was a total surprise.  We ordered the traditional Vietnamese food like Lau ca Chua and Banh Hoi.  They were surprisingly delicious.  I tried these foods in so many places in Santa Anna, San Jose, San Francisco and so on but this is my best so far.  From friendly staff, reasonable pricing and the quality of foods, I agreed with the five stars their diners gave them, the write ups from independent publications and the Yelps.

Best Pho in the GTA! I've been to many pho places, and while there's lots of good ones, it's difficult finding authentic ones like they have in Vietnam.  This place is amazing and authentic. The prices are good, food quality is good, the restaurant is very clean, and staff are super friendly too.  My only drawback is they only accept cash, and there's no ATM nearby.  So bring cash.  Hopefully they accept credit/debit cards some day. :-)

This place was a fantastic find. I spend a lot of time in historic Glendale, and I have passed this restaurant many times. Finally we made our way to Little Saigon, and I couldn't be happier with the experience.  To start with, we has great service. The young lady that waited on us was friendly, knowledgable, and very helpful. She spent time explaining each dish and left me wanting to try a large part of the menu.  She never let my drinks go un-filled.  The food was fantastic! We shared the spring rolls and the sauce was excellent. The pork inside was tender and very flavorful.  I had the #14, rice noodle stew, and it was awesome. The beef was slowly cooked and very tender. It fell apart in my mouth! Very, very well made. It was so big that I had 2 meals worth of leftovers.  My boyfriend had the #48, which was breaded garlic shrimp with caramelized onions. He let me try one and, WOW! This was the best part. It was very hard to resist eating his entire meal.   Nicely done, Little Saigon.

This place is okay.  Its cute and located kinda off the main street in downtown glendale.  Looked like a house turned into a restaurant so thats cool but the food was okay.  Ive had better but maybe its because im comparing it to CA.  Favorite here in Az, at least in phoenix area is still the one off of camelback and 17th believe.  The soup for the beef pho was not very good, too much oil and really not flavorful.  The rice dish was good but small portion.  My bf seemed to enjoy it.  Overall id eat there again if I really wanted pho and my usual spot isnt opened.

Where to even start...YUMMMMMMMY! My husband and I should have a frequent flyer card to Little Saigon we love it so much and could not feel more at home when we go there. John and his family have created the such hidden gem of Glendale in a refurbish home; filled with the aromas of a home cooked vietnamese meal as you walk in the front door.   We try to make it there at least once a week if possible...and we always ask John what to order (he's never steered us wrong)...and to this date we've NEVER had a bad meal....and thats at least 15-20 meals later.   Some of our favorites include the Potsickers (a must have starter), #27 which is a pan fried noodle with light brown sauce meats, chicken shrimp and veggies (AMAZING), the fried rice is out of bounds (and John's dad has now been making it a little spicier with basil...props to the master chef himself...he's outdone even his own masterpiece!). The ginger chicken it great as well as a sirloin dish with green onion (our new found favorite...with a side of 'coleslaw').   I can't say enough great things about Little Saigon....Oh and it's reasonably priced too! But you won't be disappointed!!!

Yum! What a surprise to find a little place this good in the Phoenix area. The vermicelli was light and fresh, the curry tasty and slightly spicy, and the Vietnamese coffee just the right amount of sweet. The service was attentive and prompt, and the setting delightful! What more could one ask?

Wanted to try this place today, was so excited with all the stars and posting. So so upset and left without even getting seated. Our names was crossed out and the host state that we left, but we we're there the entire time. Also they seated two other guest on the list. When I confronted him, he didn't even apologize and again said that we left but was called. We then waited for the third table to be cleaned and again hostess called the next guest and skipped us.  So disappointed......never coming back wish I could give them a zero

Tip: This place is on 57th Avenue, as the address shows. You're driving and starving and you see 58th Ave and you think, "Yay, 57th is next!" Well, it IS, but it's 57th DRIVE. Ya gots to go one more block to 57th AVENUE. I wasn't paying attention so we got lost. Oops! :)  Anyway, finally got there and had a good lunch. The place is clean and the folks are nice. We had the Beef Meatballs soup and spring rolls. The food was a little bland for me, but my husband liked it; he's got a new lunch place for when he works in the area.

This restaurant was clean, and nice, the service was good. However, stay away from the bun bo hue, it was a disaster. I've never tasted anything so horrible!!! The pho was decent though, I've never tried anything else there. I will probably not come back.

So begins the summer tour of restaurants while the kid is at camp. Nice little Vietnamese place not far from our home.  The special pho bowl in large wasn't as large as some places, however the vermicelli was very generously sized. Delicious, healthy and inexpensive.
I live in Markham, the epicentre of pho and noodle restaurants.  Little Saigon is by far the best.  All of the others don't even come close!!!

This quaint little restaurant near downtown Glendale has been here for about 3 years, but has a long history in the valley in 2 other locations, including originally in Scottsdale. It is now in a converted house, with a little white picket fence in front. Cute!  There is a large fish tank at the entry, and then there are 2 seperate small dining rooms. Large wood beams go acros the ceilings. A tall, bald Causasian man took my order, but he knew Vietnamese food, and the cook is a little Vietnamese old lady, and she can cook!   This restuarant has all the usual dishes you would find in a place like this, from Pho (noodle soup) to Com (rice plates) to Bun (Rice vermicelli plates).   But I started with the Goi Cuon (spring rolls). 2 of them came on a single order, and were very large! Usually you get just 2 shrimps in each, but they had 3 or 4 shrimp in each! Lotsa veggies and pork, too! Served with a peanut sauce.   Instead of all the typical plates, I also went for one of my favorite appetizers again....Banh Xeo! Banh Xeo is a large crepe/omelet like half-crescent pancake, stuffed with bean sprouts, pork and shrimp, and fried to a crispy shell, sort of like a Dosa in Indian Food. For $6.99, I got two large Banh Xeo! Most places only give you 1, so this is a great deal.   It was tasty and crispy! They served it with the Romaine leaves to wrap up sections of the Banh Xeo into, along with the pickled carrots, daikon (white raddish), cilantro to stuff inside, and the Nuoc Mam (fish sauce) to dip into.   It is really messy to cook Banh Xeo, what with all the dough and frying, and it is perhaps more messy to eat it, as you wrap it in romaine with a bunch of veggies, and dip it into the Nuoc Mam, and then try to make it to your salivating mouth! By the end (I couldn't finish the entire 2), I advise you go wash your hands, or smell like Nuoc Mam for hours later!   PS - they offer Vietnamese 33 beer!

I have been to the restaurant once . Its a family owned restaurant located in downtown Gledale. My experience has been good. The food is quite awesome.  Food: 4 out of 5 Ambience: 2 out of 5 Service: 3 out of 5

There was a line up at the door before opening for dinner, so automatically knew this place was popular. Food, service and drinks were fantastic but the price is $1-2 more than what you would find in Toronto. Would definitely come back as the quality was great. Loved how there were fried peanuts and green onions in the vermicelli!

I give them a two star because the attending lady was rude, we went there yesterday for lunch hour and we were waiting to be seated for at least 15 minutes which in some other places you only wait at least 4 minutes! I wrote our names on the waiting list because I didn't know if they needed a certain name or multiple names to put on the wait list! The lady was yelling out our names and she then said is this a group and I said yes, and she hesitated and said you don't have to do that, but the way she said it she said it like if she was bothered! We waited for another 15 minutes and then she came and we said we are in a bit of a hurry, then she said "it's not gonna happen!" And we decided to leave!

Very clean tucked away oasis in a hot hot parking lot.  You can actually park behind the building and find a bit of shade. We arrived for lunch and were promptly seated and given menus and cold water to drink. The bowl of Pho we ordered was just the right size. Fresh spring roll fresh and served pretty promptly and with a smile. What amazed me was the flavor of the broth and the subtle flavors that hit your palette.  I enjoyed first to last bite. I am looking forward to returning to try some of the other dishes.

Disgusting, I am an avid pho lover searching all over the Phoenix area for the best pho and this place is by far the worst I've had. The broth was greasy, the brisket was harshly over cooked and the tendon and organ meat WAS no clean and tasted horrible. I left with a huge stomach ache. Don't come here!

Definitely the best pho in the west side. To me the most important part of the pho is the broth - they have the most flavorful broth.  The only one that comes close is Pho Thanh in terms of flavor.  43rd Express is also very good.  Don't get me wrong, there are a lot of good pho places in Phoenix.  I would say that they are the best though.  You cannot go wrong with Little Saigon.
took my parents and brother here and everybody loved it! I've gone back multiple times since then! Great food at great prices!
Always come here the food is good the service is great! Cathy the server is always so nice and helpful! The beef pho and the spring rolls are my favorite !

I was around the area so I decided to give it a second try after visiting a year ago. Last time I had the beef and spring roll vermicelli and didn't like the way they made the beef. Now looking at the menu I realized the beef was sautéed while the pork was grilled. I ordered the pork and it came out tasting right and served with plenty of greens. So the grilled pork and spring roll vermicelli would be my recommendation if you're into vermicelli.

My wife and I ordered the #38  Beef, pork tenderloin, grilled on top of fried rice.   Absolutely awesome!!!!!  You must go here to eat your Vietnamese.   If you haven't tried it. Try it here, you will not be disappointed. We wasn't.

My wife and I have travel over 40 minutes to eat here and we've been here a dozen times. We often take out of town visitors and customers here, like we did tonight.   To start, the server forgot one of our five drinks. One meal was missing a meat. The most annoying thing about our last visit was that they forgot to make my wife's meal and started cooking it after the rest of us had nearly finished our meal, and every other table (seated after us) was served. When the meal finally arrived, everyone else had finished so we asked for the meal to go expecting it to be free because it came out ridiculously late and was clearly forgotten. Instead of an apology we were told that if we wanted the meal we had to pay for it despite it being forgotten and arriving after everyone else had finished.   The service was just bad. Not once did anyone apologize for any of the forgotten items and to argue over a $9 meal with customers who come often and with guests just seems petty. We'll take our guests to one of the many other Vietnamese establishments in the valley from now on.    Go somewhere else

Wonderful Vietnamese food. I just ordered some take out for me and a co-worker, our first try of this little restaurant. I ordered the Ga Xao Xa Ot, which was so rich and full of flavor. When I picked up our food, the restaurant was packed with a waiting list at 11:30, obviously a very popular place to dine for lunch. I will definitely go back to try other dishes.

If you want to taste the Vietnamese's foods, it's bad. Waiting to get the menu, waiting for food and waiting for the the bill. Each time, I have to wait about 30 minutes in order tmto get it. People after us got their food.   I was there with a friend, enjoy to introduce a new restaurant to my friend: we got very disappointed. The pho did not get enough the basilic, neither the fresh one or the meat one. For the fried spring rolls, I had to ask the salad in order to roll it with.

I am so happy with this spot. The only thing missing for me is the Bahn Mi. Loved the spring rolls the pork is seasoned and grilled not boiled. This gives the roll a different taste. A very delicious taste. Shrimp was cooked perfectly not chewy. Peanut sauce is on point. I could eat just this for lunch and be satisfied. I did order the beef pho and enjoyed every drop of it. The broth is not not as aromatic as I am used to so maybe a first time pho eater would take to it. I like that it does come out piping hot which makes the first sip of broth just run through your soul. And that is an amazing feeling. Warms the tummy. The resteraunt is clean an cozy. Our waitress was very nice and extremely helpful. There is seating outside too. I will most definitely be back.
Our preferred pho place in PHX. Delicious broths and lots of choices make for a fun time at lunch or dinner. Speedy service means we are never late for Yotes puck drop!
Love their food and it's a quaint location inside and out.  Have been many times and always enjoyed the food and service.

I have to say that I have been coming to Little Saigon for years, but never reviewed it?!?  We came down here during Glitter n Glow and now my mind ifs refreshed on how great it was!   First off I love the location and the old restored house where the restaurant is made into. The service has always been good. It's a very nice and quaint feeling instantly when you walk in.   I've tried several items but my personal favorite is the catfish in the black pepper pot with a side of white rice. I've must have had this at least 10 times and I wish I could have it more!! The pepper sauce is amazing and the catfish is tasty.   I've also had the pho and it was also very good.   All in all Little Saigon is one of if not best Vietnamese restaurant in the valley. My personal favorite. I can't wait to go back!

I can't believe I grew up in Glendale and never heard of this place! I'm so glad somebody told me it was there. Cute Place tucked away in the heart of Glendale with a traditional Vietnamese menu. I love the hot pot soups especially when I'm feeling under the weather.

I've been to Little Saigon many times and I find that they are always busy, even if I visit during "off peak" hours. The food is tasty enough that I don't mind the 5-15 minute wait for a table.   The deep-fried spring rolls are delicious and a generous size as well. I think they fry them to order (as I've never had them in any state other than piping hot and crispy). I find their pho broth to be mild-yet-flavorful and non-greasy, which is nice. I like the fresh herbs (with minimal brown spots) and non-soggy sprouts for pho- it's rare to find a place that gives consistently fresh herbs and sprouts for their pho.   The customer service is fast-paced but very friendly, I've never had a bad experience with anyone being rude. Will continue to come back when I have a craving for Vietnamese food!

This is probably the best pho I've had in the GTA. The broth is flavorful but light (you can really taste the layers of flavors), the toppings are beautifully layered on top of the noodles (the beef balls are one of the best I've had, it's got the perfect bite), the condiments are plentiful and fresh, and the noodles are cooked just perfectly. No wonder there's always a line!
Pretty decent Pho but I've had better; I've definitely had worse also. I also tried the shrimp spring roll, it is was decent also.

Wow I'm so sad to do this review as I have been coming here for years and years. Sadly today I was not impressed. We ordered spring rolls and the meat that was inside was really hard like it was old meat, then we get our dishes I ordered a won ton soup my husband had a beef and potatoes pho, talk about completely being flavorless I mean nothing at all just like water. Our service wasn't good either. So disappointed especially since this isn't too close to where I live.
Awesome little place, great service, good food, actual asians, no annoying music, and reasonable prices.
I went to little saigon with my buddy and literally had an orgasm because it was so good

My first Pho! I never understood why you see the food network people get all excited as they describe the pho they are eating and the layers of flavor... now I GET IT! AWESOME! I love pho! The spring rolls are spectacular too! The servers are very helpful when you are ordering, taking the time to explain everything!

What a great little find. Charming restaurant in a cute neighborhood. From the outside it reminded us of coffee shops that we've visited in Saigon. Inside it's just as charming, as it appears to be an old house turned into a restaurant.  A couple things threw us off - wait to be seated, but put your name on the clipboard. Second - large fish in the fish tank that reads "These fish are our friends, not food"  Anyway on to the menu - great selection of various dishes. Prices are a $1 or $2 more than other Vietnamese places we've tried to far in Phoenix - I'll give that to the area. My wife had a grilled chicken and rice dish, which she absolutely loved. Dark thigh meat chicken (it's flavorful and moist - no chicken breast here) and a lot of it. Standard rice, tomato and cucumber with fish sauce.   I chose to have an egg noodle soup (mì sui co #20) with sliced pork, pork belly (small cubes of pork belly I believe), wontons and ground pork. Also had bok choy. Great flavorful broth that really hit the spot.   Staff was friendly if not a little overwhelmed - place was busy but not slammed and the two younger people working the tables seemed like they were struggling to keep up. We still felt well attended to. Five stars all the way for great food, great ambiance and fair prices. Will be going back before we leave town.

So this is going to sound super cheesy but it's been a looong time since food had made me smile! I had the spicy chicken w/veggies in a lemongrass/fish sauce. (#51 on the menu). I took my first bite and instantly smiled... My daughter asked, "what's so funny" I responded with "nothing, this food is just that good that it made me happy". This was my first time here but def not my last!

Had to drop 1 of my 4 kids off to a birthday party at the nearby LaserQuest (yes I got FOUR kids!) so decided to have dinner with the rest of them at Little Saigon.  In my opinion Pho places are one of the best bang for your buck to feed large families.  Have a lot of mouths to feed and need to feed them cheap?  Don't have Mickey D's, have some Pho I say!  Run by a Vietnamese family, the pho here is rich, smooth and flavourful.  The noodle texture was done really well with the meat tender and flavourful.    The only negative I can say was that the portions were a little on the small side compared to most places.  Also the menu is very small in size and selection.  On a side note the fried spring rolls were fantastic and probably one of the best ones that I have in a long time so do yourself a favour and order a plate.  The place is small so do expect a wait if you come during dinner or lunch rush.  Service was very friendly for an Asian restaurant which is always a positive in my books.  So what's my decision?  "Pho outta Phive!"

This place is AMAZING!!!!  We love the staff, the food, everything about it.  I wouldn't suggest getting take out here though.  They charge an additional fee for it.  Its not the cheapest place and I don't complain because everything I have eaten here is wonderful, but I do stop at the "to go" charge.  Its makes your meal quite spendy.   My favorites?  Vermicelli beef and shrimp salad and the Pho of course.  Their pork and shrimp spring rolls are to die for.  Best I have had so far at any Vietnamese place I have eaten at.

Was looking for a decent pho place in Richmond Hill and thanks to the Yelp reviews I tried this place last night and loved it!  Hubby and I had the deep fried rolls for $4 and a large bowl of pho for $9. The broth in the pho was so clear and tasty. The hot tea was just right. I think it is the first time we finished all the broth. I think next time since we were sharing a bowl, we will pay for more beef in the pho. The place is clean and well kept and the staff looks happy to work there unlike some other pho places where the staff looks like they would rather be somewhere else. It is cash only. There is an ATM right by the cash register if you forget your cash. There is no problem parking as it is a big plaza with T&T.  Next time we will try some rice or vermicelli dishes. They do takeout as a couple of people came in and ordered some rice dishes to go.

Quaint little Vietnamese restaurant with quite the extensive menu, delicious flavors,  and welcoming staff. Worth going back when I'm in the area for sure. Not a bad thing at all from my experience. Portions are good. Dessert was delicious (Friend Bananas with Ice Cream). 5/5

The food was great. I went on a Friday at lunchtime and the place was full. I had to wait about 10 minutes. It was totally worth it. I had the potstickers which were great. They tasted like they were made in house. I also had #23. h tiu xào thp cm / flat rice noodles with beef, pork, chicken & vegetables. It was similar to chow fun if you have had that before. The flavor was very good. The meat was tasty and all the veggies were fresh and crisp. The noodles were just right. Everything was well balanced. I have had the pho and spring rolls before and they were great as well. If you like asian food you should add Little Saigon into your rotation. It provides different flavors than Grand Dragon or Siamese Kitchen the Chinese and Thai restaurants I love on the west side. I can't wait to go back and try some other items.
We have been here twice.  Had #30 and my husband had #51. Both were very good. Service is good and friendly. Very popular place it seems and for good reason.

Flavour? Yes. Worth Lining Up For? No.  Little Saigon took over from another Vietnamese restaurant in the same location and is quite good. While the broth of the pho is not the best in the GTA it is quite good, flavourful and has some depth. The portions are generous and the Medium - there is also Large - would suffice for most people. The menu is limited compared to most Vietnamese restaurants, but all the staples are present. I had the house pho which has good broth, beef and noodles. The vegetables and bean sprouts were fresh of course (see below: line-up). The spring rolls, however, were disappointing in that they were quite soggy and oily.  The restaurant is packed and there is a line-up. It may be the sheep effect that makes people stand in line because there is already a line there because the food is not that good, but it is certainly above average. Tai Bac across the street is as competent, larger and has no line-up. Little Saigon hands out numbers at the door and we had to wait 30 minutes for a seat.  The service is polite and prompt and one cannot fault them in any way. The restaurant is cash-only. The premises appear clean.  As much as the food is good this may be my last time here. Little Saigon and I do not have the same relationship as Chinese-Canadian friends and authentic Japanese businesses opening in town (Uncle Tetsu as one example)!
The best of the best of the best can't say enough good thing about this place owners are super nice and great service .. I'd come here everyday if I could

Tip:  CASH ONLY!  As far as Vietnamese places are concerned, this place is fairly new, clean, and fresh!  My +2s and I were on our way to Yelp GTA Rocks, when we decided to stop in for a quick meal.  What were we thinking??  (Maybe it was just Kris U's email echoing in my mind, but I really didn't expect to eat an entire meal at the Yelp event.  Boy, was I wrong!)  I love stopping by new restaurants 'cause they're always eager to please as with the case with Little Saigon.  Basil/bean sprouts were fresh and abundant.  Broth for pho was clear and didn't taste as though it was from the previous days...you know what I'm talkin' about!    My only criticisms were that:  1)  somewhat pricey for a pho place, $7 for a regular size which was a good sized portion and 2)  friend ordered the Lemongrass Spicy Chicken with Rice and it wasn't all that spicy and the large slices of white onion almost outnumbered the pieces of chicken.  So they could work on the ratio.  Decent place for pho if you're in the area though!  Server was kind and attentive.

I've tried all kinds of pho places in the GTA, but none of them beat the pho here at Little Saigon. The soup is very flavourful, unlike the bland tasteless soup you'll find at other pho restaurants.  The restaurant itself is very clean and the service is decent. Definitely will be coming here more often.

Little Saigon is a small restaurant in Glendale hidden north of Glendale ave on 57th avenue. Lets begin with cleanliness; floors were spotless and the restroom was very clean. The waitress was very friendly and took the time to explain the menu which was both in english and vietnamese.      I ordered the number 37 which is a pork and beef dinner with fried rice and  small salad. The plate was amazing and delivered promptly. Food was fresh and delicious.  A home run thx

I am an avid fan of Vietnamese Rice Noodle... I can eat this noodle soup everyday! At least once a week or more, I go to Pho602, or the one near in Bethany Home Rd. and 43rd Ave. in Phoenix. Being said so... I am very familiar how it should look like, and what are the stuff I should expect in my Vietnamese Rice Noodle. My wife and I decided to eat in LITTLE SAIGON in Down Town Glendale, AZ for a Rice Noodle and Fried Noodle. PROS: 1. The place is clean. 2. The servers are very welcoming. 3. Quick Service.  CONS: 1. The first thing that you will see in the entrance is the FILTY AQUARIUM that if you look into it, you will lose your appetite right away... (Too bad, I love aquariums and I know the difference between clean and filthy aquarium)  2. I was expecting a lot in my Rice Noodle bowl since it is more expensive than Pho602. It was $9, so this young lady bringing it from the kitchen, from a far I was so happy because it was HUGE BOWL, but when she put it in the table, IT CONTENTS ONLY HALF OF THE BOWL! NO TRIPE, MEATBALLS ONLY 2 PIEACES, RICE NOODLE NOT ENOUGH, BEEF SMALL AMOUNT COMPARED TO Pho602 and the one near Bethany and 43rd Ave. When you order XL it is really XL and you can expect so much stuff inside your bowl! Tripe, beef meat, beef ligament, lots of noodle to enjoy for only $7.50!  3. My wife ordered fried noodle and it was $10, so I was expecting something really good, like amount wife and ingredients will be more. But unfortunately, IT WAS TOO DRY, THEY JUST BASICALLY PUT LOTS OF VEGETABLE, NOT THAT MUCH OF MEAT.  IF YOU WANT TO GET A QUALITY VIETNAMESE FOOD FOR THE PRICE YOU ARE WILLING TO PAY FOR, SAVE YOUR SELF FROM THIS PLACE AND DRIVE FEW MILES AND GO TO PHO 602 or the one near Bethany Home Village and 43rd Ave.

Came in today for a quick lunch and was craving something spicy as well. As I was walking in I noticed it was cash only. I was seated after making sure I had enough cash to pay for lunch.  I ordered the Tom Yum noodle soup with shrimp. It was delicious, fresh, and had the perfect amount of spice. The restaurant looked clean as well, and my server was kind and attentive. I gave it 4 stars because they should accept another method of payment aside from cash. Aside from this I will be back soon!

I love this place. The best Vietnamese I have had in Arizona. The house fried rice is a great safe bet if you are trying Vietnamese for the first time. I like the pho, fresh spring rolls and noodle bowls. The side veggies they serve for the pho and noodles are always fresh. I have had their fried spring rolls too but I prefer the fresh only because of their delicious peanut sauce for dipping.

Wonderful! Down from Sacramento for Spring Training and felt like a little Pho, which is plentiful in Sactown. This place was quaint, in an old house. Little rooms of tables. Fast service! We started with the pot stickers, which were homemade and fresh. Very tasty. the Pho was great, too. The nice lady who took our order was very great. My spousal equivalent is not a fan of fish. When he ordered a noodle dish that sounded tasty, she gave us a heads up that is has a strong flavor of fish sauce. Tragedy averted; he ordered something else. I could not finish my noodles and a take-out dish was promptly offered. Very pleased with our dinner; give it a try!
Excellent food, adorable restaurant. Very small and cozy. The staff was very friendly.
I can't believe I didn't know this place existed. Great service, and the food is delicious!
Staff is always friendly when we go! My favorite place in Arizona to go get phó! It brings back childhood memories. Their phó is very spot on and I love everything about this little place.

Three of us went to Little Saigon yesterday. I had the curry chicken & my wife & brother-in-law had fish. Plus we all had spring rolls. The food was fabulous & the service was terrific! Will go back, hopefully soon, even though we live in Sun City.

It's PHOOOO time   My boyfriend and his friends picked this location for a  kid friendly lunch get together. Although the place was packed, the service was so good that we were able to get a table for 8 people very quickly. My boyfriend ordered a large rare beef & beef brisket pho and I order cold noodles with a spring roll, grilled chicken and pork. We wanted an avocado shake but unfortunately the blender was broken...so we got a Viet iced coffee instead. The food came very fast and the servers were very attentive with giving us extra bowls, a booster and asking if our food was good.   The pho bowls were fairly big and the soup base was delicious. My cold noodles was definitely fresh and tasty. It was filled with herbs, veggies - lettuce, cucumber and pickled carrots. The spring roll was nice, fresh & crispy!!! But WOW....  either I'm a weak coffee drinker but I found the Viet coffee strong, which is great because it gave a great energy boost.  If you'd ask me, this would be my next go to pho place in the area. The food was fresh and taste. The service was amazing and not to mention there was a huge line the whole time we were eating.  Tips: they take cash only, so make sure u come prepared.  If you haven't tried this place, I would highly recommend coming here!

Yay! A really neat cottage looking Vietnamese restaurant in Glendale. Thank you Yelp for this little golden nugget :)  I ordered the fresh spring rolls and was so impressed. Sometimes the outside wrapper tends to be chewy and tough but this one was definitely freshly made. Delicious!   I also got the chicken pho. Loved the broth and the fresh veggies that came with it for garnish. I enjoyed my meal thoroughly. Can't wait to come back and try some other dishes I saw other patrons get. It looked delightful and they appeared to all be very satisfied.  Service is quick and friendly. Facilities are clean. Street parking right in front is nice :)

Little Saigon has been my alternate choice for my Vietnamese food fix for some time. My first choice has been Phò Thanh, due how close it is, and the value. But Little Saigon's humble abode offers the best Bowl in the west side, and possibly in Arizona.   Their egg rolls are simple and small, but packed with flavor. And the fact that they do offer boba tea and an abundance of classic dishes should please any patron.  Now for the important part, the soup. There is only one size available, but it is the perfect amount. The shrimp was large enough and also detailed. The meat was also pretty big and cooked perfectly. The taste was so excellent.  Not only was the food wonderful, but the service is more than friendly and helpful to all of our requests. We have not had a bad meal here, and come here whenever we are in the area.
This place is an amazing hidden gem I am so happy to find good pho and cold noodles out here I will definitely keep coming back

Happened upon this place today, mostly by chance, but it ended up being a good experience and definitely good food.   Tucked away in old town Glendale, this place is a little off the beaten path (it's not on the main drag) but not too far. It's nestled in a nice area set back slightly from the street, so you get less noise than the other places along the main drag (Glendale avenue). What stands out immediately though is the decor and the ambiance of the place. There's a large aquarium in the foyer with beautiful fish, and ornate wood floors and wall siding. The restaurant has several sections that are divided off with narrow door ways, to give a bit of privacy to different groups and, I suspect, keep the noise level down. The tables are also spread apart a bit, which has the same kind of effect. There's definitely much less noise pollution when you're dining with your guests, something that is hard to achieve in most restaurant settings. You legitimately feel like you're somewhere else and not the middle of the Arizona desert when step inside this restaurant.   Our group was immediately seated at a large table and our server was very helpful and patient with us, as we were all unfamiliar with much of the menu offerings. That's actually one thing that I would nitpick about, the menu has nearly 100 items on it and it can be a bit daunting for the uninitiated. With so many options, it's a serious mental exercise to balance the choices and figure out what sounds most appetizing. Our first challenge was the appetizer and following the server's recommendation, we tried the spring rolls and the egg rolls, all of which were fantastic, and quickly devoured. Everything was very well made and the spring rolls were fresh, crisp and simply mouth watering.   Our main entrees were pretty diverse, including the crispy noodles and a couple of their soups (including catfish) but everyone enjoyed their food. The crispy noodles were delicious and I especially liked how they wicked up the moisture from the juices in the bowl and softened up, so that you'd get a contrast between crunchy and regular noodles to go with the vegetables and meat (chicken and beef, in my case).   Service was fairly prompt, even though they were busy with the Friday lunch crowd and had fewer staff than I would have expected. Food service was also quick, with our meals coming out right on time as we polished off the appetizers.   Definitely a place I'd like to go back to, because there's just so much of the menu to explore and so many different things to try. Really glad I got a chance to try this place out!

What happened!? So disappointed. Theres been a steady decline in flavor, portion size, and missing menu items. Pho portions have been getting smaller and smaller with less protein and noodles and they never have the coconut water or banana dessert when we try to order it. If you order any dish with meat they will literally put like 3-4 slivers on your plate and pour on the veggies to make it look like more. I want my moneys worth! Pho broth is not as flavorful anymore either, seems like theyre not putting as much time into it. I dont know if its a new owner or theyre trying to cut costs but theyre one more bad dining experience away from losing us as customer forever. At least theyre spring rolls are still amazing...

Why I didn't find this gem a long time ago seems to really amuse me. Came here with my sister, while in my pho moods. I have really been struggling to find some really good pho out here in Arizona. Side note I moved out here from la (aka: city with the best foods) and I have been missing a good bowl of pho!  Ordered the chicken pho, veggie egg rolls, and dessert! I have to admit this was probably the best pho I have had In Arizona. Very quick authentic the broth was made to perfection. My mouth is literally watering just thinking about it. Lol    If you're a pho addict/lover/enthusiast you have to stop by here and try a bowl! I promise you won't regret it! Customer service is great our waitress was very helpful and attentive. Menus are to the point short and sweet just how I like them lol

Allright, this a review based on my SECOND visit to LS.  The first visit was about 2 years ago when LS was first getting into their new digs in Old Town Glendale.  Needless to say both visits were positive, but my second visit was a close encouter of the delicious kind.  I ordered the Pho to go (yo) cause I'm a slave monkey for my company and not allowed to take a "lunch hour"   I tell the waiter "extra meat for a buck please" .  Not only does he NOT forget this like I figured he would,  he separates the meat into it's own little lifeboat so it doesn't cook itself to leather in da broth.  Massive, massive shibby my man.    And such extra meat he gave! (in a very hetero way I assure you).  This was one of the only times I couldn'y finish my Pho off.  Usually I'm bitching and moaning like a 4 year old on ADD meds, but this time I was supremely satisfied and not dissapointed in the carne content of my soup.    Rock on Saigon.  Charlie has definetly secured this area.

Good Afternooooon, Vietnam!  Did somebody say lunch time?  Somewhere I heard someone say something about some food.  What a pleasant surprise this Little Saigon is. Nice openness - little rooms with big tables. The atmosphere was comfortable with a capital C - from seating, ordering, eating, to asking questions about the menu. I even felt comfortable being the typical annoying customer.   Our servers were very kind and pleasantly accommodating. They informed the vegetarians in our party of chicken stock in the soup broth. Did we care?   -- begin moment of silence -- ...thinking of the chickens who gave their lives. Uhhhh...a little animal flesh and blood never hurt nobody.   -- end moment of silence --  Soup! Soup! Soup! Soup!  Food was tasty and plentiful. We ordered a multitude of items like three appetizers, boba, fried rice, tofu, veggies, spinach and onions, and a curry dish. Here were my personal choices:  1. Deep fried vegetarian egg rolls ($6) - six small crispy rolls accompanied by romaine leaves, parsley, mint, slices of cucumber and carrot. The rolls have tofu inside. I found one cube of it in each roll that was easily picked out with chop sticks.  2. Lotus root salad ($7) - sans pork. Tasty marinated lotus root and veggies served with four crunchy shrimp flavored rice chips on the side. Lotus is easily identifiable by sight, but its taste blended with the other veggies. The texture of it though is also unique. It reminded me of bamboo slices that get served in chow mein.  3. Bok choy soup w/ginger and onions ($8) - served in large bowl. Very good broth, close to a quart with dark green bok choy and few pieces of ginger and onion. The veggies alone would not be filling, but if you drink all the broth, you'd be full for the next hour or so.  4. Eggplant with onions and veggies ($8) - ordered spicy. It was good, but was not as spicy as I hoped. Took home leftovers.  I definitely recommend this restaurant to any vegetarian looking to try Vietnamese food.

Never disappoints.. Today I had a work lunch and ordered the appetizer #2 Goi Cuon.. (Grilled pork, shrimp, and vegetable spring rolls) a Vietnamese iced coffee, and for my entree I can haz #39 Com Dac Biet So 2 (grilled pork tenderloin and beef with fried vegetable rice) instead of the eggroll I asked for a fried egg.. It was all amazing. And the selection of condiments such as hoisin, sriracha, and chili paste can make it even more flavorful.

I reviewed Little Saigon once before but I have to again. This place is seriously the best kept secret in the valley. The service is superb. The Vietnamese cuisine is so good here too; it's incredible. My family and I recently went to Disneyland and stopped off in the actual "little Saigon" in Garden Grove California and ate at a couple of restaurants there. The food from Little Saigon here in Glendale was hands down better and the menu is more extensive. They offer far more selection than your average Vietnamese place. Also the spring rolls are about the best I've ever had. Try them and tell me I'm wrong. The Pho is always awesome. Get the #12 it has all the delicious bits you want! The vermicelli salads are perfect for a quick lunch or for an after dinner midnight snack (I usually order one to go after our meal, I'm fat, we like to eat, don't judge me). The crispy crepe is on another level of deliciousness. Packed full of mint, shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, served with daikon, carrot, lettuce, and sweet fish sauce. Roll it up in the lettuce, dip it in the fish sauce, and punch your ticket to flavor heaven. I will warn you this appetizer is the equivalent of crack cocaine. You will have to have more. You will find yourself driving not of your own accord to get your Vietnamese fix and it will begin with you mainlining some crepes and spring rolls. I'm an addict too so I know...

Such a cute little place!   We had their pho and it was delicious! Everything we saw other people get looked delicious as well and we can't wait to go back to try other things! (Total run on sentence, I know. lol)

I love this place!!! The outside is nice and romantic full of lights and an overall great loose vibe. The food is awesome too and the prices aren't too bad. I will definitely come back and bring friends!
I wasn't sure what to get, but the hostess helped me out. The veggie fried spring rolls are to die for and the 23, 51, & 54 were oh so very good as well. Everything seemed fresh. Will be going back

I love when I get brave enough to try new cuisines, and then they turn out amazing. Little Saigon, a little house I've overlooked for years, delivers in flavor, value, and probably nutrition.   The vegetables are that good.   I started off with my very first banh xeo, a crunchy crepe filled with bean sprouts and some shrimp. Unlike French crepes that you can simply dig into, this dish will crumble as soon as you touch it. Use it as filling for a lettuce wrap, and if you're quirky like myself, enjoy the liberal portions of fresh mint and carrots that come along with it. It's still weird to me, but I'd eat it again.   My main course was some beef over bok choi, which was prepared perfectly. I have never had bok choi this tasty, and I'd definitely recommend it. I think it's the number 57, which shows you how many options they have.   For dessert, I went with a taro boba. It was way sweeter than I'm used to...but hey, it's a dessert, so what could I expect? Overall, I was satisfied with a very affordable meal in a clean, stylish environment. I would totes come back.
We drive 22 miles from Goodyear to enjoy the food and service here.  This is the best. Great Vietnamese food at a fantastic value. Staff is so warm and welcoming. Great find.
The best Vietnamese food in all of the Phoenix metro area!  The staff are always courteous, polite and fun too.  I definitely recommend the vegetarian spring rolls - excellent.

This place was recommended by my colleague. And it was not disappointing. The pho had good portion and they were not greedy with the meat. Service was great as well. Strongly recommend their spring rolls, tons of ingredients and well worth it.

We came here on Tuesday around 7PM. Place was full, we had to wait around 10 minutes which was not too bad. Interior is nice and modern, everything is clean and well taken care of. Now if only the food would have been at the same level that would be great, however my pho's soup base was tasteless. Also dish would benefit from more rare beef, which was of an average quality.   All in all - adequate food for the price, good speedy service but sadly nothing spectacular/outstanding.
Great place for pho! The broth is fragrant and the place is clean. Two regrets are cash only and a limited menu.

I went this restaurant after reading from Yelp even tho it is kind of far from me.  The food was good, but what I like more about this place was the atmosphere.  It made me feel like I am in Vietnam. I liked that. Honestly I am not sure about the taste. I didn't feel really special but I liked it because I like Vietnamese food anyway!

I ran here on a whim last weekend because I was in the area and it was recommended to me by a friend, so glad I did. I ordered the #38 with a chicken substitute instead of the pork and it was pretty tasty, the fried rice was excellent, the meat was tender and marinated just right, even the egg roll was good. I will definitely be back.

EXCELLENT food!  Very charming atmosphere, great service. This place is located in old, small house converted to restaurant. They also have great outside area, unfortunately it seems they don't use it. Its always packed but wait times are not long.   We are going there very often and food taste amazing every time,  service is great every time. If you would like to experience absolutely awesome food in charming atmosphere this is the place to go. And I guarantee -  you will be back soon.
Best PHO in ARIZONA. sooo fresh and sooo good. Service is amazing and so are other dishes. I was very surprised with their taro bubble tea as well- fresh taro instead of powder..say what??!
Pho was very good. Huge portion, like normal, so you could share. I got the shrimp and chicken rice plate. The chicken was tender and soft, but also well cooked. Nice sweet flavor.

Stopped by for the first time today. I'll be back! Started with the hot jasmine tea. Then the pot stickers which were piping hot and really flavorful, we wound up getting a second order they were so good .  My entree was number 26 pan fried flat rice noodles with beef pork and chicken . I added shrimp for $2 more.  The brown sauce was really tasty and the veggies were crisp and perfect .

Visited this place a couple times and I'm always pleased with the food. We went about 30 min before they closed, so we had to order quick. We were pretty much in and out. Our server was very sweet and took care of us well. I also enjoyed seeing the outdoor lights hanging out on the patio, it brings more charm to the charming little restaurant/house. We will surely visit again.
I've been so many places and this one is not bad at all! No need to go downtown anymore.

Best Vietnamese food in the valley!!! The waitress is so sweet and will remember you. Food is flawless, average price for Vietnamese food, not too pricey, cozy atmosphere, quick and hot. Definitely a regular now.
I really enjoy this place.  Great service.  Atmosphere is relaxing.The food is prepared fresh and served hot.

i love it here!! Simply an amazing hide away place that doesn't attract too many people. It's nice and roomy inside, adorned with a fish tank that my son loves! The service is great, never had any problems with them before. Loyal customer!  Recommend for sure! Always get the house fried rice! Personal favorite!!

We went there one Sunday noon with a party of 20. I have to say, with the short staff that they had that day, they performed admirably. This is the 3rd time we've been there and they never fail us. We ordered different kinds of entrees from Bun Cha, Com Dia, Pho, and multiple orders of Cha Gio and Goi Cuon. My brother-in-law ordered the house fried rice for two young boys with us, and of course the adults had to try it first (to make sure it was good... lol). And, indeed it was. The kids also ordered a bunch of fresh coconut and they enjoyed it very much. When you go to a Vietnamese restaurant, don't just settle for the Pho. Try other things. This is the place to do it.

Delicious pho, and I'm one to always order the same thing, but every time I eat here I try something new. There's a lot of options and all of them so far have been awesome! The hot pot soup is an excellent choice for something different if you generally like pho and want to try something new. The service is fast and friendly. A must in Glendale!

This place is awesome!  I have been here twice already within a week and I love it.  Fresh, hot, spicy if you want and very delicious.  I had a #23 (Mi Cao Lau), #5 (Banh Khot), a Sing Ha and finished with fried bananas with vanilla ice cream.  Loved it!  Especially the fried bananas!  So crispy on the outside and moist on the inside...best I have ever had!
Such great food for such awesome prices !!! First time there with my mother and I, and we both loved out experience and waitress

The pho here is amazing. I suggest for newbies dont get any pho with the meat balls, it can be weird. Sometimes it takes a minute to be seated, but its a family owned restaurant, not McDonalds, so dont expect drive thru time. Always a good choice in downtown Glendale, and soooo recommended!! Do it! Go get some pho!
Hands down best pho in the GTA. From their traditional rare beed pho, to their lemongrass beef vermicelli, every meal is fresh and delicious!

Popped in for lunch.  Service was good ...my food choices not so much.   The potstickers (pan fried) looked amazing but didn't have any flavor.  The filling was white and stringy...perhaps chicken? Hard to say, likely boiled and lacking any ginger or other spices. Seriously no flavor.   The pho. Ordered the beef combo (#11 I think). Again...this dish also lacked flavor. Regarding the broth, it  had a watered down flavor.  The tendon had a strange almost sour taste.   Was surprised with all the great reviews...but in reviewing them again, it appears Pho is the thing to avoid.

This was our first time Having Vietnamese food and it was very good. We had potstickers as an appetizer and two different kinds of pho. Our bill was less than 20 dollars. Great value. The restaurant looks to be a converted house, so you're eating very close to the other guests and felt like you had to talk quietly. I will go back.
Wonderful food.  2nd time here.  Had to wait quite awhile for 4 of us to be seated.  Hot inside.  104 today.  Nice people.  Again - excellent food.

I was thinking this place would be really good with all of the reviews, but I wasn't really impressed. I ordered the shrimp and steak noodle bowl. The shrimp was Ok, the steak was very chewy and a little bland. It came with a salad and some weird smellling dressing, so I skipped in the dressing. I actually liked the salad by itself and I think it had some green papya in it??? The Thai iced tea was really good though. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? I don't know or maybe I don't like Vietnamese food? Anyway, and the customer service was mediocre so I more than likely won't be back.
Great food, great location!, was timely and good! Why does yelp make me write so much

Cute little Vietnamese restaurant in downtown Glendale. The food was good/decent. I liked my bun. The pork was flavorful.   The portions were nice. My egg rolls and the snow was ok. I probably wouldn't get next time just because it's not as good as others that I've had. But I'd definitely come back to try more things!  It is a bit pricier than other Viet restaurants.

Great little pho shop. The broth is light but delicious and tasted like it was made from scratch.  We also had the Vietnamese coffee which had a little too much condensed milk for my liking but the coffee was rich and flavourful.   Finally the atmosphere of the restaurant is great as it is clean, well decorated and very cozy.  The staff were attentive and friendly.   If they had a little more Dishes on the menu I would give it 5 stars.

After a fairly miserable first experience at Little Saigon, I was hesitant to go back, but because I know so many people who hold it in such high regard, I've been back several times. It grows on me a little bit every time and I realized that ever since I haven't seen the bad server I had the first time, I've really liked it!  They do fantastic spring rolls, with a tasty peanut sauce and the presentation is much nicer than usual. Bun Cha and Pho Tai are two dishes I've had there multiple times and was really impressed. Cold, fresh veggies, quality ingredients, and great taste.   This is a family run business and it really shows with the pride they take in getting to know their customers, and efficient friendly service. The restaurant, being in a home, has a certain charm that I'm used to downtown and really appreciate. This isn't my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in town, but it's up there with the best. I wish their prices weren't so high. They are at least a dollar more per item than anyone else.
Great veitnamese food! Obviously they have some great pho but the spring rolls and vermicelli always hit the spot!
Great place to eat fresh food and relax.The Curry,Spring Rolls, Pot-Stickers and Vermicelli noodles and pork is outstanding .We have been customers for 11 years now

Came here to grab dinner with Cali friends before they head back home. I ordered their hot pot sweet and tangy soup with catfish. It was a perfect marriage of sweetness & tangy-ness with tomatoes, okra, celery, pineapple, bean sprouts, and herbs/spices. My bf and gf got pho. They said it was pretty good. Another friend got vermicelli noodles with grilled pork and egg rolls. He ate all of it with a smile on his face so I'm assuming it was good. Lol. I also ordered the Che ba mau (3 flavors dessert drink) and that was good too. The service was awesome as well.  Would definitely come back again.

This place has pretty good pho in Glendale glitters! If you're downtown Glendale if you're looking to get some soup this is a good place to pop into. I do recommend them  I give them 1 thumb up. The only thing I didn't like about them was that they did not give enough  beef. So if you do order from this place they give below average on the beef so you might want to ask them for extra

If it were closer to home I would give it a second go, but it's just too far, and was too mediocre for the drive.  I got one of their "Pho" dishes, turkey, ham and beef.  The meat seemed of very low quality, actually made me wish I would have gone veggie.  The spring rolls were alright, but nothing I will be writing home to Mom about. They do have a cool fish tank, which almost bumped them to a 3 star'r.

Awesome Vietnamese in downtown Glendale. Normally when we go here it's for spring rolls and Banh Xep (rice flour crepe with shrimp pork and bean sprouts )always, sometimes pho and sometimes one of their delicious vermicelli salad bowls with chicken or pork. They always have fresh fixings with everything like mint, basil, cilantro and the jalapeños (with the pho)for all the dishes we get. Pho is huge and hot as hell and we are sweating and full when done. Everything has so many different flavors and textures and I love the variety. Employees are always pleasant and attentive to our needs and have made special requests(for kids because no kids menu) when needed. If you like bobas try the Thai one! YUM!

I had a lunch here today,  it was worth to burn the gas from Avondale. I ordered #24 (Stir fry rice noodle with meats and veges), OMG it was soooo good, but the portion was smaller than I expected. I think I can eat here every week,  I like to try rice noodle soup (Pho) next time.

Excellent family owned Vietnamese restaurant in downtown Glendale. Courteous, fast service and the food is fantastic! Perhaps the best part is the value--you will be hard pressed to find better food at lower prices. My wife and I go to LS about 2-3 times per month.

Little Saigon in Glendale?  Holy Cow this place was fantastic. My family and I came here for lunch , and we had their Pho tai and it was delicious ! And the smelled was awesome, the classic pho soup with all the veggies. The taste was so good, it brought me back when I was Seattle visiting my son . We also experience for the first time Goi Cuon spring rolls with shrimp they were simply amazing .I almost forgot we order the Banh Xep pan fried potstickers with sauce they were so yummy .Yeah for finally finding a good authentic Vietnamese place. I miss my Vietnamese food and Yeah that I don't have to drive far to get it. Approximately  mile 1/2 away from me. I can't wait go there again ...
Everything I have ordered so far has been delicious, fast friendly service, stand out dishes - the pho of course, spring rolls, yellow curry with shrimp I could go on and on.

Nowadays, it's hard to find a good Vietnamese restaurant. Fortunately, there's Little Saigon :).  This place opened up not too long ago and was relatively unbeknownst to the public at the start, but had gained a lot of traffic, for good reason too!  My typical order is the Pho Tai Nam - rare beef and flank steak, and I usually compare Pho places by this. Their pho is very clean tasting and doesn't leaves a lingering oily film in your mouth afterwards - the one thing I absolutely despise.
