Their bun (vermicelli) is very fresh and tasty and the spring rolls are still very crisp and their filling has a nice balance of flavour.  There's only good things I can say about Little Saigon, but only time will tell if this standard will continue: take Pho Quinn for instance (feel free to check out my review there too).

You can't go wrong here. I've tried almost everything on their menu and I've never been disappointed. I love coming here. I recommend the spring rolls, they are probably the best in town!! (In my opinion anyways) I love their vermicelli and pho too! Their staff are very friendly and always helpful.
Excellent food, great service, clean and authentic. Spring rolls and other appetizers are tasty. Pho is awesome.
I love this place! The Vietnamese pork spring rolls and vermicelli salad...omg...best Vietnamese in Glendale

Vietnamese food in Glendale?  Holy Crap this place was fantastic.  Its set in this little ol house on Glendale and 57th ave in what appears to be a local hangout  Whats cool is that this place must have a huge following because the waiter new half the people in the restaurant.   The place is small on the inside it has two rooms.  We were in the first one as you walked in which had seating for about 20+ people it was pleasantly decorated and the beer and wine was clearly visible from our table.  They serve house wine and beer.  And yes you can get Vietnamese beer here.    We started our meal with the appetizer crepes.  The crepes were filled with yummy shrimp pork and rice noodles.  Our waiter showed us how to eat these as they come with lettuce leaves that you are supposed to wrap the crepe in add some veggies and dip in oil.  Messy But FUN!  and so so tasty.  The crepe was light and so were the fillings.  Don't be intimidated by the size of the appetizer which is monstrous because if you share its enough.    For my dinner I had the dumpling soup.  Which was just awesome.  The broth is fantastic.  The egg noodles perfect and the garnish was absolutely awesome.  It comes with mint leaves, bean sprouts and lemon.  My girl had the mix rice bowl with chicken,pork, and egg rolls.  Hers was so mouth watering and she had so much we took the other half home and had a midnight snack!  Now I haven't had Vietnamese food in forever and I was over joyed by the friendliness and comfort of this place.  We will be back.  I would recommend this for anyone wanted to try something that is a little different but very tasty.  You will be glad you did!  Lastly I dont know what this is a two cash sign price range.  For two dinners an appetizer and two glasses of wine we paid 26 bucks.

Little Saigon is in our top 5 restaurants here in Arizona. My husband and I love this place. First of all, it's in a fun bungalow style house in old Glendale which just adds to its charm. Second, the family that runs it is awesome. You'll be greeted by Tony or Hui (not sure how to spell it) or John and they're all great people. They know us by now and we're always greeted like old friends. I've tried half the items on the menu, which is extensive and haven't found anything I don't like. My husband is usually stuck on #35 or #36 which are their rice noodle dishes. So good. We've introduced our friends to Little Saigon and I have one friend who will gladly drive from East Scottsdale just for the fried banana/ice cream dessert (which is a MUST, by the way). In all, I will always recommend this restaurant!

I don't think I have been to a Viet restaurant, where I have to wait for a table on a weekday lunch hour. Despite its small location, I was seated quite quickly.   They didn't have much selections, so I decided to order their HOUSE SPECIAL phõ and a grilled chicken roll. The soup was very flavourful and not salty at all. Much more meats than noodles compare to most places, where the ratio would be the opposite. The chicken roll came with a homemade (?) peanut sauce that you dip in, as the roll itself did not contain much flavour, all you taste were mint, chicken, and plain rice noodles.   Price wise, not too too expensive, yet, I can't say it is cheap. But given its location is close to my house, I will definitely go here to satisfy my phõ crave.

First, let me start by saying the five star rating is relative. This is the best place I have found in the valley to get my Vietnamese food fix. I'm not talking the usual pho or spring rolls, I'm talking some real, hard to find, authentic Vietnamese dishes that pho restaurants don't make/serve. Compared to some of the best places I've been for Vietnamese food (including Vietnam), it wouldn't be 5 stars, but for the valley? Definitely.   They have a fairly wide selection of dishes and everything that I have tried has been well made and tastes great. My boyfriend and I usually order #65 (steamed catfish in a hot clay pot), #72 (flash fried calamari), and my favorite #88 (sweet and sour catfish soup). I love that we can get full, but it's still a light full, not heavy and greasy. Nothing like some fresh Vietnamese food to get you feeling right!

I have been here twice, first time for dinner and the other for lunch. The restaurant is quite small, can maybe seat like 35 people. It is a CASH ONLY place. This was the only Vietnamese restaurant area for awhile, until recently. It is a casual restaurant with a modern feel to it. Unlike other Vietnamese restaurants in the area which is more family or diner type style. Not the best place for big groups, since it will take up nearly half the restaurant.  Always check their hours before coming to this place, to ensure they are open.   Menu - (4/5) small, not too many options due to the size of their business but still sufficient.  Customer Service (4/5) - nice and friendly.  Price - (2/5) Price is a bit on the high side with respect to their portions. Been to better places, which offer more sizes and better portions for their noodle soups. I haven't tried their other main dishes.   Quality - (3.5/5) The meat is good but I found the soup quite blend, twice that I went. I try to order the same dish (i.e. pho with brisket) every Vietnamese restaurant I go. I prefer a bit saltier, that's a personal preference.   Presentation - (3/5) Pretty typical presentation for pho, nothing creative. I personally dislike the china they use to serve for pho, not really the biggest fan on slanted bowls.   Overall, it is okay. I prefer to go elsewhere for economical reasons and better soup base. I personally haven't gone back since. I have eaten other pho places in Hamilton, London, Toronto, Scarborough, and Richmond Hill; I wouldn't say this is the best place to go in the GTA. The pho places in Hamilton and London is better than this place. If you do live or work close by this place then it is an okay place.
This is our favorite place to eat in Phoenix, we always stay over night  when We're passing through,  just so we can indulge our selves with the number 12 and the number 28 on the Little Saigon menu.
Great food, great service, and will come back. I recommend every dish as they are all good and authentic. The family who owns it is real nice and sometime would greet you personally.

Not the best pho ive ever had but passable. The egg rolls are awesome and the catfish Is delish. For the price it was good not great. Might stop by another time. Try it once, it might be to your liking.

I ordered the grilled chicken rice plate with a fried egg and shrimp. Great authentic Vietnamese food, it is a far drive for me so I don't come here often.  The Vietnamese coffee isn't as strong as most Vietnamese coffees I've tried.  Lots of different dishes to choose from!
Love this place! The restaurant is in a kewl old house in downtown Glendale.   Pork is bomb, chicken pho killer, egg rolls and service are great!

I've been there 3 or 4 times. This is the best pho I had so far in Markham/Richmond Hill area, even there is a little line up everytime I went but it definetly worth the wait.  The restaurant is super clean!  I never been to any other pho restaurant cleaner than them. $8 for medium & $9 for Large, very reasonable price.  Their medium size pho is like large compare to any other pho restaurant. When the noodle came, my nose tells the stroy....Rich broth of cracked bones, deep beef and aromatic star anise,I luv it!  The beef texture are soft +1 star !! Their spring roll are so crispy & yummy! + 3 star!!. The staff are nice but I take 0.5 away because they are a little bit slow (taking too much time cleaning the table lol) and another 0.5 away because the soup base is slightly too sweet.   Overall, the experience are great, the prices are cheap & food is excellent- comparing to the bad experience I had at another pho restaurant recently, this place is heaven.  I recommended my colleague to this place and now he went there at least once or twice weekly.

Definitely clean and very nice servers.  Adorable little restaurant.  The food, like packaged Vietnamese food.. Egg roll tastes like Costco frozen.  I asked for my pho to be extra spicy and was told to use one of the grocery store bottles of sauce.  I asked again when the food came and she brought me a couple of Thai peppers.  Chicken noodle soup with a couple gristle pieces of meat.  My husband got sweet and sour catfish.  Nice portion but tasted like trader Joe's frozen.  Great prices...
Had pho spring roll was good spicy chicken wings made with Vietnamese chili sauce is fire hot but good. This is a place where you go for lunch break from work easy simple fast & tasty. You

I liked the food my first time there, but they just keep getting the order wrong. My gf is vegetarian, STOP putting chicken in her VEGETARIAN curry. Can't trust the order to be right...so we can't go back.

Great little family run restaurant in downtown Glendale.  Right near antique stores and in the historic part.  The restaurant is in a quaint old house.  There are not to many Vietnamese restaurants that I've been to with atmosphere so that's an added plus.  The food is also great too.  If you love Vietnamese food you have to try this place.  If you haven't had it check out their website.  There you will find the menu and pictures of some of their food items.  Huge menu!  They don't have Vietnamese sandwiches here though.  They have a family member with a restaurant off I-17 and Bell to get your banh mì fix.  I have had the rice flour crepe with shrimp, pork and bean sprouts.  It is served with a plate of veggies.  It fills up the plate!  I also had the famous #37 with grilled pork, shrimp, egg roll and sunny side up egg.  Really good.  You'll see why it is so popular.  I also had the Pho with sliced beef.  It was not the best I ever had but very, very good.    The service is pretty good here.  The second time I went there they were fairly busy so I had to wait a short time to get seated.  The other two times they were pretty quick.  Servers were all friendly.     It is a good drive from my house but totally worth it plus It's in a great part of Glendale.

Little Saigon has really good Pho, but my favourite items on the menu are their rice dishes.  The Lemon Grass chicken and Lemon grass pork with rice are the best in Markham/Richmond Hill.  Their prices are also incredibly reasonable.  I wish they had a larger beverage selection though.  Nevertheless, I continue to come back to this place.    NOTE:  They only accept CASH.
AUTHENTIC!! Travel from Little Taipei, California,  I'm glad that I found this place to satisfy my Asian food cravings. Very solid and decent place.

Pro Tips: Stay with Pho or Bun Cha  With a limited menu and one would think at least Little Saigon knows what they are doing.   Photos are deceiving as I know quite well as I myself is guilty to make my food looks more tasty through my camera lens and by using filters. But their Shrimp and Chicken Pad Thai ($10) was such a disaster. I can made something better than this. The plate of noodle swimming in some brownish sauce was nothing close to how it looks in the menu. This is not a restaurant quality dish.   Would I be coming back? I would only for Pho and their Summer Rolls and nothing else.

Had vegetarian pho here today. It was good - some of the vegetables were really too big to be eaten without cutting. Might have tried the jalapenos in the soup, but they were in pieces that were WAY too big for me to consider adding. YMMV.  Service was quick and efficient.   The place is cute - small house turned into a restaurant. We were in the biggest room - smaller rooms are quieter asI remember. Prices are reasonable. My large pho was $7.  It has been a while since I've been to Little Saigon - I should go more often.

Notice: This is a review for the Pho soup, none of the other dishes.   If you've been to other Pho places, the soup here tastes a little on the light side.  No matter though, it's still Pho, right?  I actually don't mind the lighter soup since it didn't make me feel as heavy/sleepy when walking out of the restaurant.  Aside from the on-the-light-side taste, the portions were good with plentiful amounts of beef, tripe, and tendon.  They also seem to serve chicken Pho here, too so if you want to avoid red meat you might want to try that out.    This place seems much more accommodating than other Pho places, most likely because the servers here actually know how to speak English.  For those who worry about poor service, you won't find that here.  These guys were on top of my water never being empty (a big one with Pho noodle soup, since it really seems to dehydrate you).  My dad also tried the Thai Boba Tea and said the boba was decent (I'm not a fan of Thai Tea, sorry!).    As for prices, they're a little on the steeper side of Pho at $9 for a combo soup, but as I mentioned above the portions are good so I would say it is worth it.

Came here on my quest to find the best Vietnamese Bun Cha in the Markham area and I think I found the place!  The vermicelli was perfectly cooked (chewy yet soft), the grilled meat was seasoned well, and the fried spring rolls had an extremely satisfying crunch to it.  My girlfriend ordered a pho and it was pretty good too.  I highly recommend the Bun Cha here.

I was bummed that they did not have Bahn Mi sandwiches. I had my heart set on that so I decided to split a plate of the stir fried flat noodles with chicken. My biggest mistake was not ordering my own plate. This dish was delicious, far exceeded my expectations! My hot pot soup with tofu was also really, really good. I definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting Asian food in the Glendale area. Nice mom and pop restaurant with real Vietnamese cuisine.
I consider myself a Pho connoisseur.  This is the best pho in Richmond Hill, maybe even the GTA.  It's very clean, good service, and best of all good pho!  Highly recommend if you haven't tried.

I am more critical to this restaurant than some of other reviewers here. I do not think the Phos  we had tonight were that good. The soup was pretty plain, #12 had a lot of low quality beef with large amount of fat. To be honest, this place has been overrated and does not deserve the high marks.

It's hard to spot on the first drive by, but it's an absolutely lovely looking place. Small, but comfy to those who don't prefer higher-end luxuries. The food selection is great, and from what we've ordered: Each were delicious and of great quality. The prices were affordable, and that's a great plus considering the quality! Most of my attention went to their desserts. The fried banana with ice cream was wonderful~! Definitely recommend!  The only reason why I give it a 4-star instead of a 5-star, is that the quality of the food I've had (cubed steak cuts and stirfry beef), while great, isn't astounding in their flavors - I've had similar in other restaurants, and I've had better in rare other restaurants. Perhaps I should order more foods to see if they stand out in some items more than others. Perhaps next time I'll order an item they're well known for. By no means should you think a 4-star is a bad or unspectacular rating. It's an excellent restaurant for everything it advertises itself to be.
I'm always satisfied with the food here.  Everything I've tried here were decent.  Pho, Vermicelli, rice plates, vietnamese stir-fry.
Love this place, a great little find in downtown Glendale. Great food, service and prices!

I loved my visit here.  I loved the food, the decor, and the lights all around the tiny little house they've turned into a restaurant.  We decided to go to the last night of Glendale Glitters and we were hungry.  My companion was looking for a Subway restaurant, but I sort of whined a little about how cute this place was from the outside, and he agreed to check it out with me.  WOW!  Was he ever glad he did!  I had something with shrimp and chicken, and spring rolls and a Thai Iced tea with boba.  My companion had the yellow curried chicken.  His curry smelled so good, I wanted to cry. Then I tasted it.  It was amazing!   The spring rolls were literally the best I've ever had, and the shrimp was cooked perfectly. Why not 5 stars?  Only because I've only been there once.  It get's 5 stars if we drive all the way back to Glendale just to eat here.  we shall see. In the meantime, if you live anywhere near, go!!

My favorite restaurant in town.  Some of my favorite dishes include the pho ga (chicken soup) (#8), spicy lemongrass chicken (#51), marinated beef in grape leaves (#62), and steamed catfish in black pepper sauce (#65).  The combo spring rolls are the best I have ever had at any Vietnamese restaurant, and I have tried them at many places.  The prices are very reasonable, and the owners are very nice people.  We regularly make a fairly long drive to have dinner at Little Saigon because it has great food at a very good price.  Highly recommended.

I've been here plenty of times and Never have I ever received such as small drink. Wtf? And when I voice my concern the girl says "it's bigger then the ones we usually give". I've been here before and no, that is an utter lie! I left as a very unsatisfied customer.
Amazing service and food! The employees are attentive and fast. Food was fast and delicious!

If you are wondering if this restaurant is worth trying, welll stop wondering. This place has very authentic Vietnamese food. The owners are very nice and interact with the customers all day. My personal favorite dish would have to be the Lemongrass Chicken. It's location is perfect for the residents of Glendale because there aren't very many Vietnamese restaurants in the Northwest part of Phoenix.

I hesitated on whether or not I should write a review because I didn't want this place to be overpacked all the time (though it pretty much is). However, this place deserves all the credit for their food and service.  Food - Quality is amazing! Usually you find a few dying leaves or dark spots on bean sprouts, but I didn't spot anything wrong with it. Nothing is over or under seasoned. Every ingredient worked well with one another. The only complaint I have is that they ran out of shrimp paste on canes, which was really strange since we were literally the first people to go in...  Value - We both ordered 2 vermicelli bowls. The bowls were pretty big and filled to the rim. For $10.00, I really felt like it was definetely worth it.  Service & Cleanliness - Really great service and attitude. No issues with cleanliness.

Title: Awesome Vegetarian dishes, fellow Vegheads!  ooo...My BFF and me hit this place after the Glendale Blues/Jazz Festival the other day and were pleasantly surprised. If you blink, you pass this puppy. We only found it cause we went one street too far wondering where we parked our motorcycles.  We're Veg, so we ordered from the Vegetable entree menu and split everything.  #78 Vegetarian coconut curry  - Awesome flavor although I hate white rice, it all meshed together beautifully.  #80 Flash-fried tofu with carmelized onions and tangy soy sauce - It's the sweet soy sauce that made this dish.  #84 Bok choy soup with ginger and onions - amaaaaazing flavor. Highly recommended. Tasted good for leftovers too. mmmm. mmmm  Price was hella right, peeps. Only $6.99 for each of these delicious dishes. Say wha?????  Cheap date night fer sure!  There were only like 2 servers so the service was a bit slow but very friendly.   As of  4/9/11, they weren't serving alcohol per a few posted signs. I assume waiting for a liquor license to come through.  Will be eating at this gem and recommending to friends every chance I get.
Loved the atmosphere, loved the grilled chicken vermicelli salad.  Had lunch there a week ago Saturday and will definitely return on my next trip to Phoenix to try other dishes!

I've been here twice with the wife.  The first time I ordered a couple spring rolls and loved them so much that (for a while) we started making them at home a few times per week.  I also did the make your own spring roll for the dinner and... it was filling. Fair price and can easily feed 2 people. The staff came and offered to show me how to roll them (I've done it in the past so I declined).  My wife's noodle dish was great. She may have got pad thai but I forget. And the boba is great and has many flavors to choose from.  On our next trip we ordered the firepot soup to split and again... filling. Fair price. Good food. Definitely worth a trip into downtown Glendale.

I ordered a catfish dish. Amazing. Spicy and sweet and sour catfish. This was fantastic. My wife ordered spicy chicken with fried rice. It was wonderful. The egg rolls were great. Wrap them in lettuce with cilantro and mint. Wonderful flavor for the palet. Clean and homey little place. Loved the experience. The staff was great. Never needed to ask for a thing.
Phenomenal meal as always. We have a number of good Vietnamese restaurants in Philadelphia, but we don't have a Little Saigon. Make sure you don't miss this gem.
Best Vietnamese restaurant in Phoenix. We have been coming here for years. It only gets better. I love the beef Pho and the shaved ice for desert.

First time trying Pho with my girlfriend and we picked the right spot... the location of this restaurant is very discreet but is truly a hidden gem... the food was phenomenal but what truly did it was the service. Min was super informative and took the time to answer any questions we had and explained all of the on table sauces. Our drinks were never empty and he checked on us frequently. Will definitely come back.

There really isn't a lot of decent PHO places in Richmond Hill. When this spot opened up we had to try it. Koreans are big on PHO. Most of the decent ones down in North York Central are populated with Koreans enjoying themselves. It's a bit of a jaunt to go there so I'm glad to see one here. The place is small and run by a family (I guess) and they run a decent place. The portion sizes are good and the temperature of the soup is about just right. Their combination meat or the rare beef are good choices. Their cold rolls, spring rolls, and pork rolls are a hit with the family. We've been there quite a bit over the last year and have only one warning. If you have issues with MSG, PHO is not a good diet choice. Otherwise, Go PHO it!

A delightful, delicious, darling place to go. The house is historic in downtown Glendale. Very pretty with twinkle lights on the outside. I love old buildings. I had the curry and it was delicious. Service was good too. Everyone tells me this is the place to go to get Pho. I will have to come back and check that out.

I'm happy to see this place is doing very well, I remember them back in the days at christown mall (spectrum mall)  They were busy but our waitress which is the daughter was good with communication skills to let us know the status of our orders.  I appreciate the times she still came to check up on us, the food was very good, very fresh, and price was very good.  There's not a lot of good Vietnamese restaurants in Arizona, but this one is probably the best due to their consistency and authentic flavor.  Not to be racist but I also noticed Viet people cooking the food in the kitchen instead of Hispanics, which is a plus for me!

This is the first place I tried pho at! It was amazing! I guess you can say it's where I lost my phoginity . I went there with my friend who knows about all the pho places around. She taught me how it goes.   Let me tell you, the broth was really flavorful. I know that many people have talked about how good pho was, but I was completely clueless to dish until I tried it. It does live up to its name of being delicious. This place does a great job of keeping it that way.   The place inside is a bit small, but if I can recall, I remember that they have a private dining room or so. The outside of this place however, the building is so cute. I love the little plants around and the dim warm light setting that they have going on.   I would totally recommend anyone who is interested in going here or looking for a place of similar foods. The menu is quite limited but that does not stop me from giving this place 5 stars!

Boo! Went with a big birthday group after confirming business hours. Got their well over 30 mins before their posted closing business time. Told us kitchen was already closed and turned us away! I would understand if it was a bar/sportsbar where they have last calls for kitchen food and a bar to operate later than their kitchen. If a restaurant has certain hours, I was always under the impression the kitchen is open until the closing time.  May take a while for me to want to come back here. Even tried to plead our case and it was a no go as the host sat there counting his money. Wow.

Have been here several times in the past two years or so - always great food and outstanding service.  Servers really know their stuff and are always eager to recommend the best dishes.  Menu is very extensive.  Everything is very fresh and flavorful.  The location is a (somewhat) renovated old cottage in old-town Glendale, just one short block north of Glendale Ave.  One larger dining room and three or four smaller rooms.  Everyone takes great pains to make sure you are happy.  If you are a fan or Vietnamese food or you are anxious to try it for the first time, I highly recommend Little Saigon.

I've been coming here for six years. I usually get the pho or the fried rice combination plate. My wife and I went this past weekend and we ordered the usual. As my wife was eating her pho, she noticed a worm on her spoon. It was very unappetizing and we immediately stopped eating. To give Saigon the benefit of the doubt, they do provide fresh herbs, so I understand this happens, but it was still gross to see.   I would still strongly recommend this place, just double check your spoon to ensure you are not eating tiny critters!
